r.js
説明を見る。
00001 
00007 /*
00008  * This is a bootstrap script to allow running RequireJS in the command line
00009  * in either a Java/Rhino or Node environment. It is modified by the top-level
00010  * dist.js file to inject other files to completely enable this file. It is
00011  * the shell of the r.js file.
00012  */
00013 
00014 /*jslint evil: true, nomen: true, sloppy: true */
00015 /*global readFile: true, process: false, Packages: false, print: false,
00016 console: false, java: false, module: false, requirejsVars, navigator,
00017 document, importScripts, self, location, Components, FileUtils */
00018 
00019 var requirejs, require, define, xpcUtil;
00020 (function (console, args, readFileFunc) {
00021     var fileName, env, fs, vm, path, exec, rhinoContext, dir, nodeRequire,
00022         nodeDefine, exists, reqMain, loadedOptimizedLib, existsForNode, Cc, Ci,
00023         version = '2.1.8+',
00024         jsSuffixRegExp = /\.js$/,
00025         commandOption = '',
00026         useLibLoaded = {},
00027         //Used by jslib/rhino/args.js
00028         rhinoArgs = args,
00029         //Used by jslib/xpconnect/args.js
00030         xpconnectArgs = args,
00031         readFile = typeof readFileFunc !== 'undefined' ? readFileFunc : null;
00032 
00033     function showHelp() {
00034         console.log('See https://github.com/jrburke/r.js for usage.');
00035     }
00036 
00037     if ((typeof navigator !== 'undefined' && typeof document !== 'undefined') ||
00038             (typeof importScripts !== 'undefined' && typeof self !== 'undefined')) {
00039         env = 'browser';
00040 
00041         readFile = function (path) {
00042             return fs.readFileSync(path, 'utf8');
00043         };
00044 
00045         exec = function (string) {
00046             return eval(string);
00047         };
00048 
00049         exists = function () {
00050             console.log('x.js exists not applicable in browser env');
00051             return false;
00052         };
00053 
00054     } else if (typeof Packages !== 'undefined') {
00055         env = 'rhino';
00056 
00057         fileName = args[0];
00058 
00059         if (fileName && fileName.indexOf('-') === 0) {
00060             commandOption = fileName.substring(1);
00061             fileName = args[1];
00062         }
00063 
00064         //Set up execution context.
00065         rhinoContext = Packages.org.mozilla.javascript.ContextFactory.getGlobal().enterContext();
00066 
00067         exec = function (string, name) {
00068             return rhinoContext.evaluateString(this, string, name, 0, null);
00069         };
00070 
00071         exists = function (fileName) {
00072             return (new java.io.File(fileName)).exists();
00073         };
00074 
00075         //Define a console.log for easier logging. Don't
00076         //get fancy though.
00077         if (typeof console === 'undefined') {
00078             console = {
00079                 log: function () {
00080                     print.apply(undefined, arguments);
00081                 }
00082             };
00083         }
00084     } else if (typeof process !== 'undefined' && process.versions && !!process.versions.node) {
00085         env = 'node';
00086 
00087         //Get the fs module via Node's require before it
00088         //gets replaced. Used in require/node.js
00089         fs = require('fs');
00090         vm = require('vm');
00091         path = require('path');
00092         //In Node 0.7+ existsSync is on fs.
00093         existsForNode = fs.existsSync || path.existsSync;
00094 
00095         nodeRequire = require;
00096         nodeDefine = define;
00097         reqMain = require.main;
00098 
00099         //Temporarily hide require and define to allow require.js to define
00100         //them.
00101         require = undefined;
00102         define = undefined;
00103 
00104         readFile = function (path) {
00105             return fs.readFileSync(path, 'utf8');
00106         };
00107 
00108         exec = function (string, name) {
00109             return vm.runInThisContext(this.requirejsVars.require.makeNodeWrapper(string),
00110                                        name ? fs.realpathSync(name) : '');
00111         };
00112 
00113         exists = function (fileName) {
00114             return existsForNode(fileName);
00115         };
00116

00119 
00120         if (fileName && fileName.indexOf('-') === 0) {
00121             commandOption = fileName.substring(1);
00122             fileName = process.argv[3];
00123         }
00124     } else if (typeof Components !== 'undefined' && Components.classes && Components.interfaces) {
00125         env = 'xpconnect';
00126 
00127         Components.utils['import']('resource://gre/modules/FileUtils.jsm');
00128         Cc = Components.classes;
00129         Ci = Components.interfaces;
00130 
00131         fileName = args[0];
00132 
00133         if (fileName && fileName.indexOf('-') === 0) {
00134             commandOption = fileName.substring(1);
00135             fileName = args[1];
00136         }
00137 
00138         xpcUtil = {
00139             isWindows: ('@mozilla.org/windows-registry-key;1' in Cc),
00140             cwd: function () {
00141                 return FileUtils.getFile("CurWorkD", []).path;
00142             },
00143 
00144             //Remove . and .. from paths, normalize on front slashes
00145             normalize: function (path) {
00146                 //There has to be an easier way to do this.
00147                 var i, part, ary,
00148                     firstChar = path.charAt(0);
00149 
00150                 if (firstChar !== '/' &&
00151                         firstChar !== '\\' &&
00152                         path.indexOf(':') === -1) {
00153                     //A relative path. Use the current working directory.
00154                     path = xpcUtil.cwd() + '/' + path;
00155                 }
00156 
00157                 ary = path.replace(/\\/g, '/').split('/');
00158 
00159                 for (i = 0; i < ary.length; i += 1) {
00160                     part = ary[i];
00161                     if (part === '.') {
00162                         ary.splice(i, 1);
00163                         i -= 1;
00164                     } else if (part === '..') {
00165                         ary.splice(i - 1, 2);
00166                         i -= 2;
00167                     }
00168                 }
00169                 return ary.join('/');
00170             },
00171 
00172             xpfile: function (path) {
00173                 var fullPath;
00174                 try {
00175                     fullPath = xpcUtil.normalize(path);
00176                     if (xpcUtil.isWindows) {
00177                         fullPath = fullPath.replace(/\//g, '\\');
00178                     }
00179                     return new FileUtils.File(fullPath);
00180                 } catch (e) {
00181                     throw new Error((fullPath || path) + ' failed: ' + e);
00182                 }
00183             },
00184 
00185             readFile: function (/*String*/path, /*String?*/encoding) {
00186                 //A file read function that can deal with BOMs
00187                 encoding = encoding || "utf-8";
00188 
00189                 var inStream, convertStream,
00190                     readData = {},
00191                     fileObj = xpcUtil.xpfile(path);
00192 
00193                 //XPCOM, you so crazy
00194                 try {
00195                     inStream = Cc['@mozilla.org/network/file-input-stream;1']
00196                                .createInstance(Ci.nsIFileInputStream);
00197                     inStream.init(fileObj, 1, 0, false);
00198 
00199                     convertStream = Cc['@mozilla.org/intl/converter-input-stream;1']
00200                                     .createInstance(Ci.nsIConverterInputStream);
00201                     convertStream.init(inStream, encoding, inStream.available(),
00202                     Ci.nsIConverterInputStream.DEFAULT_REPLACEMENT_CHARACTER);
00203 
00204                     convertStream.readString(inStream.available(), readData);
00205                     return readData.value;
00206                 } catch (e) {
00207                     throw new Error((fileObj && fileObj.path || '') + ': ' + e);
00208                 } finally {
00209                     if (convertStream) {
00210                         convertStream.close();
00211                     }
00212                     if (inStream) {
00213                         inStream.close();
00214                     }
00215                 }
00216             }
00217         };
00218 
00219         readFile = xpcUtil.readFile;
00220 
00221         exec = function (string) {
00222             return eval(string);
00223         };
00224 
00225         exists = function (fileName) {
00226             return xpcUtil.xpfile(fileName).exists();
00227         };
00228 
00229         //Define a console.log for easier logging. Don't
00230         //get fancy though.
00231         if (typeof console === 'undefined') {
00232             console = {
00233                 log: function () {
00234                     print.apply(undefined, arguments);
00235                 }
00236             };
00237         }
00238     }

00245 //Not using strict: uneven strict support in browsers, #392, and causes
00246 //problems with requirejs.exec()/transpiler plugins that may not be strict.
00247 /*jslint regexp: true, nomen: true, sloppy: true */
00248 /*global window, navigator, document, importScripts, setTimeout, opera */
00249

00251 (function (global) {
00252     var req, s, head, baseElement, dataMain, src,
00253         interactiveScript, currentlyAddingScript, mainScript, subPath,
00254         version = '2.1.8',
00255         commentRegExp = /(\/\*([\s\S]*?)\*\/|([^:]|^)\/\/(.*)$)/mg,
00256         cjsRequireRegExp = /[^.]\s*require\s*\(\s*["']([^'"\s]+)["']\s*\)/g,
00257         jsSuffixRegExp = /\.js$/,
00258         currDirRegExp = /^\.\//,
00259         op = Object.prototype,
00260         ostring = op.toString,
00261         hasOwn = op.hasOwnProperty,
00262         ap = Array.prototype,
00263         apsp = ap.splice,
00264         isBrowser = !!(typeof window !== 'undefined' && navigator && window.document),
00265         isWebWorker = !isBrowser && typeof importScripts !== 'undefined',
00266         //PS3 indicates loaded and complete, but need to wait for complete
00267         //specifically. Sequence is 'loading', 'loaded', execution,
00268         // then 'complete'. The UA check is unfortunate, but not sure how
00269         //to feature test w/o causing perf issues.
00270         readyRegExp = isBrowser && navigator.platform === 'PLAYSTATION 3' ?
00271                       /^complete$/ : /^(complete|loaded)$/,
00272         defContextName = '_',
00273         //Oh the tragedy, detecting opera. See the usage of isOpera for reason.
00274         isOpera = typeof opera !== 'undefined' && opera.toString() === '[object Opera]',
00275         contexts = {},
00276         cfg = {},
00277         globalDefQueue = [],
00278         useInteractive = false;
00279 
00280     function isFunction(it) {
00281         return ostring.call(it) === '[object Function]';
00282     }
00283 
00284     function isArray(it) {
00285         return ostring.call(it) === '[object Array]';
00286     }
00287 
00292     function each(ary, func) {
00293         if (ary) {
00294             var i;
00295             for (i = 0; i < ary.length; i += 1) {
00296                 if (ary[i] && func(ary[i], i, ary)) {
00297                     break;
00298                 }
00299             }
00300         }
00301     }
00302 
00307     function eachReverse(ary, func) {
00308         if (ary) {
00309             var i;
00310             for (i = ary.length - 1; i > -1; i -= 1) {
00311                 if (ary[i] && func(ary[i], i, ary)) {
00312                     break;
00313                 }
00314             }
00315         }
00316     }
00317 
00318     function hasProp(obj, prop) {
00319         return hasOwn.call(obj, prop);
00320     }
00321 
00322     function getOwn(obj, prop) {
00323         return hasProp(obj, prop) && obj[prop];
00324     }
00325 
00331     function eachProp(obj, func) {
00332         var prop;
00333         for (prop in obj) {
00334             if (hasProp(obj, prop)) {
00335                 if (func(obj[prop], prop)) {
00336                     break;
00337                 }
00338             }
00339         }
00340     }
00341 
00346     function mixin(target, source, force, deepStringMixin) {
00347         if (source) {
00348             eachProp(source, function (value, prop) {
00349                 if (force || !hasProp(target, prop)) {
00350                     if (deepStringMixin && typeof value !== 'string') {
00351                         if (!target[prop]) {
00352                             target[prop] = {};
00353                         }
00354                         mixin(target[prop], value, force, deepStringMixin);
00355                     } else {
00356                         target[prop] = value;
00357                     }
00358                 }
00359             });
00360         }
00361         return target;
00362     }
00363 
00364     //Similar to Function.prototype.bind, but the 'this' object is specified
00365     //first, since it is easier to read/figure out what 'this' will be.
00366     function bind(obj, fn) {
00367         return function () {
00368             return fn.apply(obj, arguments);
00369         };
00370     }
00371 
00372     function scripts() {
00373         return document.getElementsByTagName('script');
00374     }
00375 
00376     function defaultOnError(err) {
00377         throw err;
00378     }
00379 
00380     //Allow getting a global that expressed in
00381     //dot notation, like 'a.b.c'.
00382     function getGlobal(value) {
00383         if (!value) {
00384             return value;
00385         }
00386         var g = global;
00387         each(value.split('.'), function (part) {
00388             g = g[part];
00389         });
00390         return g;
00391     }
00392 
00401     function makeError(id, msg, err, requireModules) {
00402         var e = new Error(msg + '\nhttp://requirejs.org/docs/errors.html#' + id);
00403         e.requireType = id;
00404         e.requireModules = requireModules;
00405         if (err) {
00406             e.originalError = err;
00407         }
00408         return e;
00409     }
00410 
00411     if (typeof define !== 'undefined') {
00412         //If a define is already in play via another AMD loader,
00413         //do not overwrite.
00414         return;
00415     }
00416 
00417     if (typeof requirejs !== 'undefined') {
00418         if (isFunction(requirejs)) {
00419             //Do not overwrite and existing requirejs instance.
00420             return;
00421         }
00422         cfg = requirejs;
00423         requirejs = undefined;
00424     }
00425 
00426     //Allow for a require config object
00427     if (typeof require !== 'undefined' && !isFunction(require)) {
00428         //assume it is a config object.
00429         cfg = require;
00430         require = undefined;
00431     }
00432 
00433     function newContext(contextName) {
00434         var inCheckLoaded, Module, context, handlers,
00435             checkLoadedTimeoutId,
00436             config = {
00437                 //Defaults. Do not set a default for map
00438                 //config to speed up normalize(), which
00439                 //will run faster if there is no default.
00440                 waitSeconds: 7,
00441                 baseUrl: './',
00442                 paths: {},
00443                 pkgs: {},
00444                 shim: {},
00445                 config: {}
00446             },
00447             registry = {},
00448             //registry of just enabled modules, to speed
00449             //cycle breaking code when lots of modules
00450             //are registered, but not activated.
00451             enabledRegistry = {},
00452             undefEvents = {},
00453             defQueue = [],
00454             defined = {},
00455             urlFetched = {},
00456             requireCounter = 1,
00457             unnormalizedCounter = 1;
00458 
00468         function trimDots(ary) {
00469             var i, part;
00470             for (i = 0; ary[i]; i += 1) {
00471                 part = ary[i];
00472                 if (part === '.') {
00473                     ary.splice(i, 1);
00474                     i -= 1;
00475                 } else if (part === '..') {
00476                     if (i === 1 && (ary[2] === '..' || ary[0] === '..')) {
00477                         //End of the line. Keep at least one non-dot
00478                         //path segment at the front so it can be mapped
00479                         //correctly to disk. Otherwise, there is likely
00480                         //no path mapping for a path starting with '..'.
00481                         //This can still fail, but catches the most reasonable
00482                         //uses of ..
00483                         break;
00484                     } else if (i > 0) {
00485                         ary.splice(i - 1, 2);
00486                         i -= 2;
00487                     }
00488                 }
00489             }
00490         }
00491 
00502         function normalize(name, baseName, applyMap) {
00503             var pkgName, pkgConfig, mapValue, nameParts, i, j, nameSegment,
00504                 foundMap, foundI, foundStarMap, starI,
00505                 baseParts = baseName && baseName.split('/'),
00506                 normalizedBaseParts = baseParts,
00507                 map = config.map,
00508                 starMap = map && map['*'];
00509 
00510             //Adjust any relative paths.
00511             if (name && name.charAt(0) === '.') {
00512                 //If have a base name, try to normalize against it,
00513                 //otherwise, assume it is a top-level require that will
00514                 //be relative to baseUrl in the end.
00515                 if (baseName) {
00516                     if (getOwn(config.pkgs, baseName)) {
00517                         //If the baseName is a package name, then just treat it as one
00518                         //name to concat the name with.
00519                         normalizedBaseParts = baseParts = [baseName];
00520                     } else {
00521                         //Convert baseName to array, and lop off the last part,
00522                         //so that . matches that 'directory' and not name of the baseName's
00523                         //module. For instance, baseName of 'one/two/three', maps to
00524                         //'one/two/three.js', but we want the directory, 'one/two' for
00525                         //this normalization.
00526                         normalizedBaseParts = baseParts.slice(0, baseParts.length - 1);
00527                     }
00528 
00529                     name = normalizedBaseParts.concat(name.split('/'));
00530                     trimDots(name);
00531 
00532                     //Some use of packages may use a . path to reference the
00533                     //'main' module name, so normalize for that.
00534                     pkgConfig = getOwn(config.pkgs, (pkgName = name[0]));
00535                     name = name.join('/');
00536                     if (pkgConfig && name === pkgName + '/' + pkgConfig.main) {
00537                         name = pkgName;
00538                     }
00539                 } else if (name.indexOf('./') === 0) {
00540                     // No baseName, so this is ID is resolved relative
00541                     // to baseUrl, pull off the leading dot.
00542                     name = name.substring(2);
00543                 }
00544             }
00545 
00546             //Apply map config if available.
00547             if (applyMap && map && (baseParts || starMap)) {
00548                 nameParts = name.split('/');
00549 
00550                 for (i = nameParts.length; i > 0; i -= 1) {
00551                     nameSegment = nameParts.slice(0, i).join('/');
00552 
00553                     if (baseParts) {
00554                         //Find the longest baseName segment match in the config.
00555                         //So, do joins on the biggest to smallest lengths of baseParts.
00556                         for (j = baseParts.length; j > 0; j -= 1) {
00557                             mapValue = getOwn(map, baseParts.slice(0, j).join('/'));
00558 
00559                             //baseName segment has config, find if it has one for
00560                             //this name.
00561                             if (mapValue) {
00562                                 mapValue = getOwn(mapValue, nameSegment);
00563                                 if (mapValue) {
00564                                     //Match, update name to the new value.
00565                                     foundMap = mapValue;
00566                                     foundI = i;
00567                                     break;
00568                                 }
00569                             }
00570                         }
00571                     }
00572 
00573                     if (foundMap) {
00574                         break;
00575                     }
00576 
00577                     //Check for a star map match, but just hold on to it,
00578                     //if there is a shorter segment match later in a matching
00579                     //config, then favor over this star map.
00580                     if (!foundStarMap && starMap && getOwn(starMap, nameSegment)) {
00581                         foundStarMap = getOwn(starMap, nameSegment);
00582                         starI = i;
00583                     }
00584                 }
00585 
00586                 if (!foundMap && foundStarMap) {
00587                     foundMap = foundStarMap;
00588                     foundI = starI;
00589                 }
00590 
00591                 if (foundMap) {
00592                     nameParts.splice(0, foundI, foundMap);
00593                     name = nameParts.join('/');
00594                 }
00595             }
00596 
00597             return name;
00598         }
00599 
00600         function removeScript(name) {
00601             if (isBrowser) {
00602                 each(scripts(), function (scriptNode) {
00603                     if (scriptNode.getAttribute('data-requiremodule') === name &&
00604                             scriptNode.getAttribute('data-requirecontext') === context.contextName) {
00605                         scriptNode.parentNode.removeChild(scriptNode);
00606                         return true;
00607                     }
00608                 });
00609             }
00610         }
00611 
00612         function hasPathFallback(id) {
00613             var pathConfig = getOwn(config.paths, id);
00614             if (pathConfig && isArray(pathConfig) && pathConfig.length > 1) {
00615                 removeScript(id);
00616                 //Pop off the first array value, since it failed, and
00617                 //retry
00618                 pathConfig.shift();
00619                 context.require.undef(id);
00620                 context.require([id]);
00621                 return true;
00622             }
00623         }
00624 
00625         //Turns a plugin!resource to [plugin, resource]
00626         //with the plugin being undefined if the name
00627         //did not have a plugin prefix.
00628         function splitPrefix(name) {
00629             var prefix,
00630                 index = name ? name.indexOf('!') : -1;
00631             if (index > -1) {
00632                 prefix = name.substring(0, index);
00633                 name = name.substring(index + 1, name.length);
00634             }
00635             return [prefix, name];
00636         }
00637 
00653         function makeModuleMap(name, parentModuleMap, isNormalized, applyMap) {
00654             var url, pluginModule, suffix, nameParts,
00655                 prefix = null,
00656                 parentName = parentModuleMap ? parentModuleMap.name : null,
00657                 originalName = name,
00658                 isDefine = true,
00659                 normalizedName = '';
00660 
00661             //If no name, then it means it is a require call, generate an
00662             //internal name.
00663             if (!name) {
00664                 isDefine = false;
00665                 name = '_@r' + (requireCounter += 1);
00666             }
00667 
00668             nameParts = splitPrefix(name);
00669             prefix = nameParts[0];
00670             name = nameParts[1];
00671 
00672             if (prefix) {
00673                 prefix = normalize(prefix, parentName, applyMap);
00674                 pluginModule = getOwn(defined, prefix);
00675             }
00676 
00677             //Account for relative paths if there is a base name.
00678             if (name) {
00679                 if (prefix) {
00680                     if (pluginModule && pluginModule.normalize) {
00681                         //Plugin is loaded, use its normalize method.
00682                         normalizedName = pluginModule.normalize(name, function (name) {
00683                             return normalize(name, parentName, applyMap);
00684                         });
00685                     } else {
00686                         normalizedName = normalize(name, parentName, applyMap);
00687                     }
00688                 } else {
00689                     //A regular module.
00690                     normalizedName = normalize(name, parentName, applyMap);
00691 
00692                     //Normalized name may be a plugin ID due to map config
00693                     //application in normalize. The map config values must
00694                     //already be normalized, so do not need to redo that part.
00695                     nameParts = splitPrefix(normalizedName);
00696                     prefix = nameParts[0];
00697                     normalizedName = nameParts[1];
00698                     isNormalized = true;
00699 
00700                     url = context.nameToUrl(normalizedName);
00701                 }
00702             }
00703 
00704             //If the id is a plugin id that cannot be determined if it needs
00705             //normalization, stamp it with a unique ID so two matching relative
00706             //ids that may conflict can be separate.
00707             suffix = prefix && !pluginModule && !isNormalized ?
00708                      '_unnormalized' + (unnormalizedCounter += 1) :
00709                      '';
00710 
00711             return {
00712                 prefix: prefix,
00713                 name: normalizedName,
00714                 parentMap: parentModuleMap,
00715                 unnormalized: !!suffix,
00716                 url: url,
00717                 originalName: originalName,
00718                 isDefine: isDefine,
00719                 id: (prefix ?
00720                         prefix + '!' + normalizedName :
00721                         normalizedName) + suffix
00722             };
00723         }
00724 
00725         function getModule(depMap) {
00726             var id = depMap.id,
00727                 mod = getOwn(registry, id);
00728 
00729             if (!mod) {
00730                 mod = registry[id] = new context.Module(depMap);
00731             }
00732 
00733             return mod;
00734         }
00735 
00736         function on(depMap, name, fn) {
00737             var id = depMap.id,
00738                 mod = getOwn(registry, id);
00739 
00740             if (hasProp(defined, id) &&
00741                     (!mod || mod.defineEmitComplete)) {
00742                 if (name === 'defined') {
00743                     fn(defined[id]);
00744                 }
00745             } else {
00746                 mod = getModule(depMap);
00747                 if (mod.error && name === 'error') {
00748                     fn(mod.error);
00749                 } else {
00750                     mod.on(name, fn);
00751                 }
00752             }
00753         }
00754 
00755         function onError(err, errback) {
00756             var ids = err.requireModules,
00757                 notified = false;
00758 
00759             if (errback) {
00760                 errback(err);
00761             } else {
00762                 each(ids, function (id) {
00763                     var mod = getOwn(registry, id);
00764                     if (mod) {
00765                         //Set error on module, so it skips timeout checks.
00766                         mod.error = err;
00767                         if (mod.events.error) {
00768                             notified = true;
00769                             mod.emit('error', err);
00770                         }
00771                     }
00772                 });
00773 
00774                 if (!notified) {
00775                     req.onError(err);
00776                 }
00777             }
00778         }
00779 
00784         function takeGlobalQueue() {
00785             //Push all the globalDefQueue items into the context's defQueue
00786             if (globalDefQueue.length) {
00787                 //Array splice in the values since the context code has a
00788                 //local var ref to defQueue, so cannot just reassign the one
00789                 //on context.
00790                 apsp.apply(defQueue,
00791                            [defQueue.length - 1, 0].concat(globalDefQueue));
00792                 globalDefQueue = [];
00793             }
00794         }
00795 
00796         handlers = {
00797             'require': function (mod) {
00798                 if (mod.require) {
00799                     return mod.require;
00800                 } else {
00801                     return (mod.require = context.makeRequire(mod.map));
00802                 }
00803             },
00804             'exports': function (mod) {
00805                 mod.usingExports = true;
00806                 if (mod.map.isDefine) {
00807                     if (mod.exports) {
00808                         return mod.exports;
00809                     } else {
00810                         return (mod.exports = defined[mod.map.id] = {});
00811                     }
00812                 }
00813             },
00814             'module': function (mod) {
00815                 if (mod.module) {
00816                     return mod.module;
00817                 } else {
00818                     return (mod.module = {
00819                         id: mod.map.id,
00820                         uri: mod.map.url,
00821                         config: function () {
00822                             var c,
00823                                 pkg = getOwn(config.pkgs, mod.map.id);
00824                             // For packages, only support config targeted
00825                             // at the main module.
00826                             c = pkg ? getOwn(config.config, mod.map.id + '/' + pkg.main) :
00827                                       getOwn(config.config, mod.map.id);
00828                             return  c || {};
00829                         },
00830                         exports: defined[mod.map.id]
00831                     });
00832                 }
00833             }
00834         };
00835 
00836         function cleanRegistry(id) {
00837             //Clean up machinery used for waiting modules.
00838             delete registry[id];
00839             delete enabledRegistry[id];
00840         }
00841 
00842         function breakCycle(mod, traced, processed) {
00843             var id = mod.map.id;
00844 
00845             if (mod.error) {
00846                 mod.emit('error', mod.error);
00847             } else {
00848                 traced[id] = true;
00849                 each(mod.depMaps, function (depMap, i) {
00850                     var depId = depMap.id,
00851                         dep = getOwn(registry, depId);
00852 
00853                     //Only force things that have not completed
00854                     //being defined, so still in the registry,
00855                     //and only if it has not been matched up
00856                     //in the module already.
00857                     if (dep && !mod.depMatched[i] && !processed[depId]) {
00858                         if (getOwn(traced, depId)) {
00859                             mod.defineDep(i, defined[depId]);
00860                             mod.check(); //pass false?
00861                         } else {
00862                             breakCycle(dep, traced, processed);
00863                         }
00864                     }
00865                 });
00866                 processed[id] = true;
00867             }
00868         }
00869 
00870         function checkLoaded() {
00871             var map, modId, err, usingPathFallback,
00872                 waitInterval = config.waitSeconds * 1000,
00873                 //It is possible to disable the wait interval by using waitSeconds of 0.
00874                 expired = waitInterval && (context.startTime + waitInterval) < new Date().getTime(),
00875                 noLoads = [],
00876                 reqCalls = [],
00877                 stillLoading = false,
00878                 needCycleCheck = true;
00879 
00880             //Do not bother if this call was a result of a cycle break.
00881             if (inCheckLoaded) {
00882                 return;
00883             }
00884 
00885             inCheckLoaded = true;
00886 
00887             //Figure out the state of all the modules.
00888             eachProp(enabledRegistry, function (mod) {
00889                 map = mod.map;
00890                 modId = map.id;
00891 
00892                 //Skip things that are not enabled or in error state.
00893                 if (!mod.enabled) {
00894                     return;
00895                 }
00896 
00897                 if (!map.isDefine) {
00898                     reqCalls.push(mod);
00899                 }
00900 
00901                 if (!mod.error) {
00902                     //If the module should be executed, and it has not
00903                     //been inited and time is up, remember it.
00904                     if (!mod.inited && expired) {
00905                         if (hasPathFallback(modId)) {
00906                             usingPathFallback = true;
00907                             stillLoading = true;
00908                         } else {
00909                             noLoads.push(modId);
00910                             removeScript(modId);
00911                         }
00912                     } else if (!mod.inited && mod.fetched && map.isDefine) {
00913                         stillLoading = true;
00914                         if (!map.prefix) {
00915                             //No reason to keep looking for unfinished
00916                             //loading. If the only stillLoading is a
00917                             //plugin resource though, keep going,
00918                             //because it may be that a plugin resource
00919                             //is waiting on a non-plugin cycle.
00920                             return (needCycleCheck = false);
00921                         }
00922                     }
00923                 }
00924             });
00925 
00926             if (expired && noLoads.length) {
00927                 //If wait time expired, throw error of unloaded modules.
00928                 err = makeError('timeout', 'Load timeout for modules: ' + noLoads, null, noLoads);
00929                 err.contextName = context.contextName;
00930                 return onError(err);
00931             }
00932 
00933             //Not expired, check for a cycle.
00934             if (needCycleCheck) {
00935                 each(reqCalls, function (mod) {
00936                     breakCycle(mod, {}, {});
00937                 });
00938             }
00939 
00940             //If still waiting on loads, and the waiting load is something
00941             //other than a plugin resource, or there are still outstanding
00942             //scripts, then just try back later.
00943             if ((!expired || usingPathFallback) && stillLoading) {
00944                 //Something is still waiting to load. Wait for it, but only
00945                 //if a timeout is not already in effect.
00946                 if ((isBrowser || isWebWorker) && !checkLoadedTimeoutId) {
00947                     checkLoadedTimeoutId = setTimeout(function () {
00948                         checkLoadedTimeoutId = 0;
00949                         checkLoaded();
00950                     }, 50);
00951                 }
00952             }
00953 
00954             inCheckLoaded = false;
00955         }
00956 
00957         Module = function (map) {
00958             this.events = getOwn(undefEvents, map.id) || {};
00959             this.map = map;
00960             this.shim = getOwn(config.shim, map.id);
00961             this.depExports = [];
00962             this.depMaps = [];
00963             this.depMatched = [];
00964             this.pluginMaps = {};
00965             this.depCount = 0;
00966 
00967             /* this.exports this.factory
00968                this.depMaps = [],
00969                this.enabled, this.fetched
00970             */
00971         };
00972 
00973         Module.prototype = {
00974             init: function (depMaps, factory, errback, options) {
00975                 options = options || {};
00976 
00977                 //Do not do more inits if already done. Can happen if there
00978                 //are multiple define calls for the same module. That is not
00979                 //a normal, common case, but it is also not unexpected.
00980                 if (this.inited) {
00981                     return;
00982                 }
00983 
00984                 this.factory = factory;
00985 
00986                 if (errback) {
00987                     //Register for errors on this module.
00988                     this.on('error', errback);
00989                 } else if (this.events.error) {
00990                     //If no errback already, but there are error listeners
00991                     //on this module, set up an errback to pass to the deps.
00992                     errback = bind(this, function (err) {
00993                         this.emit('error', err);
00994                     });
00995                 }
00996 
00997                 //Do a copy of the dependency array, so that
00998                 //source inputs are not modified. For example
00999                 //"shim" deps are passed in here directly, and
01000                 //doing a direct modification of the depMaps array
01001                 //would affect that config.
01002                 this.depMaps = depMaps && depMaps.slice(0);
01003 
01004                 this.errback = errback;
01005 
01006                 //Indicate this module has be initialized
01007                 this.inited = true;
01008 
01009                 this.ignore = options.ignore;
01010 
01011                 //Could have option to init this module in enabled mode,
01012                 //or could have been previously marked as enabled. However,
01013                 //the dependencies are not known until init is called. So
01014                 //if enabled previously, now trigger dependencies as enabled.
01015                 if (options.enabled || this.enabled) {
01016                     //Enable this module and dependencies.
01017                     //Will call this.check()
01018                     this.enable();
01019                 } else {
01020                     this.check();
01021                 }
01022             },
01023 
01024             defineDep: function (i, depExports) {
01025                 //Because of cycles, defined callback for a given
01026                 //export can be called more than once.
01027                 if (!this.depMatched[i]) {
01028                     this.depMatched[i] = true;
01029                     this.depCount -= 1;
01030                     this.depExports[i] = depExports;
01031                 }
01032             },
01033 
01034             fetch: function () {
01035                 if (this.fetched) {
01036                     return;
01037                 }
01038                 this.fetched = true;
01039 
01040                 context.startTime = (new Date()).getTime();
01041 
01042                 var map = this.map;
01043 
01044                 //If the manager is for a plugin managed resource,
01045                 //ask the plugin to load it now.
01046                 if (this.shim) {
01047                     context.makeRequire(this.map, {
01048                         enableBuildCallback: true
01049                     })(this.shim.deps || [], bind(this, function () {
01050                         return map.prefix ? this.callPlugin() : this.load();
01051                     }));
01052                 } else {
01053                     //Regular dependency.
01054                     return map.prefix ? this.callPlugin() : this.load();
01055                 }
01056             },
01057 
01058             load: function () {
01059                 var url = this.map.url;
01060 
01061                 //Regular dependency.
01062                 if (!urlFetched[url]) {
01063                     urlFetched[url] = true;
01064                     context.load(this.map.id, url);
01065                 }
01066             },
01067 
01072             check: function () {
01073                 if (!this.enabled || this.enabling) {
01074                     return;
01075                 }
01076 
01077                 var err, cjsModule,
01078                     id = this.map.id,
01079                     depExports = this.depExports,
01080                     exports = this.exports,
01081                     factory = this.factory;
01082 
01083                 if (!this.inited) {
01084                     this.fetch();
01085                 } else if (this.error) {
01086                     this.emit('error', this.error);
01087                 } else if (!this.defining) {
01088                     //The factory could trigger another require call
01089                     //that would result in checking this module to
01090                     //define itself again. If already in the process
01091                     //of doing that, skip this work.
01092                     this.defining = true;
01093 
01094                     if (this.depCount < 1 && !this.defined) {
01095                         if (isFunction(factory)) {
01096                             //If there is an error listener, favor passing
01097                             //to that instead of throwing an error. However,
01098                             //only do it for define()'d  modules. require
01099                             //errbacks should not be called for failures in
01100                             //their callbacks (#699). However if a global
01101                             //onError is set, use that.
01102                             if ((this.events.error && this.map.isDefine) ||
01103                                 req.onError !== defaultOnError) {
01104                                 try {
01105                                     exports = context.execCb(id, factory, depExports, exports);
01106                                 } catch (e) {
01107                                     err = e;
01108                                 }
01109                             } else {
01110                                 exports = context.execCb(id, factory, depExports, exports);
01111                             }
01112 
01113                             if (this.map.isDefine) {
01114                                 //If setting exports via 'module' is in play,
01115                                 //favor that over return value and exports. After that,
01116                                 //favor a non-undefined return value over exports use.
01117                                 cjsModule = this.module;
01118                                 if (cjsModule &&
01119                                         cjsModule.exports !== undefined &&
01120                                         //Make sure it is not already the exports value
01121                                         cjsModule.exports !== this.exports) {
01122                                     exports = cjsModule.exports;
01123                                 } else if (exports === undefined && this.usingExports) {
01124                                     //exports already set the defined value.
01125                                     exports = this.exports;
01126                                 }
01127                             }
01128 
01129                             if (err) {
01130                                 err.requireMap = this.map;
01131                                 err.requireModules = this.map.isDefine ? [this.map.id] : null;
01132                                 err.requireType = this.map.isDefine ? 'define' : 'require';
01133                                 return onError((this.error = err));
01134                             }
01135 
01136                         } else {
01137                             //Just a literal value
01138                             exports = factory;
01139                         }
01140 
01141                         this.exports = exports;
01142 
01143                         if (this.map.isDefine && !this.ignore) {
01144                             defined[id] = exports;
01145 
01146                             if (req.onResourceLoad) {
01147                                 req.onResourceLoad(context, this.map, this.depMaps);
01148                             }
01149                         }
01150 
01151                         //Clean up
01152                         cleanRegistry(id);
01153 
01154                         this.defined = true;
01155                     }
01156 
01157                     //Finished the define stage. Allow calling check again
01158                     //to allow define notifications below in the case of a
01159                     //cycle.
01160                     this.defining = false;
01161 
01162                     if (this.defined && !this.defineEmitted) {
01163                         this.defineEmitted = true;
01164                         this.emit('defined', this.exports);
01165                         this.defineEmitComplete = true;
01166                     }
01167 
01168                 }
01169             },
01170 
01171             callPlugin: function () {
01172                 var map = this.map,
01173                     id = map.id,
01174                     //Map already normalized the prefix.
01175                     pluginMap = makeModuleMap(map.prefix);
01176 
01177                 //Mark this as a dependency for this plugin, so it
01178                 //can be traced for cycles.
01179                 this.depMaps.push(pluginMap);
01180 
01181                 on(pluginMap, 'defined', bind(this, function (plugin) {
01182                     var load, normalizedMap, normalizedMod,
01183                         name = this.map.name,
01184                         parentName = this.map.parentMap ? this.map.parentMap.name : null,
01185                         localRequire = context.makeRequire(map.parentMap, {
01186                             enableBuildCallback: true
01187                         });
01188 
01189                     //If current map is not normalized, wait for that
01190                     //normalized name to load instead of continuing.
01191                     if (this.map.unnormalized) {
01192                         //Normalize the ID if the plugin allows it.
01193                         if (plugin.normalize) {
01194                             name = plugin.normalize(name, function (name) {
01195                                 return normalize(name, parentName, true);
01196                             }) || '';
01197                         }
01198 
01199                         //prefix and name should already be normalized, no need
01200                         //for applying map config again either.
01201                         normalizedMap = makeModuleMap(map.prefix + '!' + name,
01202                                                       this.map.parentMap);
01203                         on(normalizedMap,
01204                             'defined', bind(this, function (value) {
01205                                 this.init([], function () { return value; }, null, {
01206                                     enabled: true,
01207                                     ignore: true
01208                                 });
01209                             }));
01210 
01211                         normalizedMod = getOwn(registry, normalizedMap.id);
01212                         if (normalizedMod) {
01213                             //Mark this as a dependency for this plugin, so it
01214                             //can be traced for cycles.
01215                             this.depMaps.push(normalizedMap);
01216 
01217                             if (this.events.error) {
01218                                 normalizedMod.on('error', bind(this, function (err) {
01219                                     this.emit('error', err);
01220                                 }));
01221                             }
01222                             normalizedMod.enable();
01223                         }
01224 
01225                         return;
01226                     }
01227 
01228                     load = bind(this, function (value) {
01229                         this.init([], function () { return value; }, null, {
01230                             enabled: true
01231                         });
01232                     });
01233 
01234                     load.error = bind(this, function (err) {
01235                         this.inited = true;
01236                         this.error = err;
01237                         err.requireModules = [id];
01238 
01239                         //Remove temp unnormalized modules for this module,
01240                         //since they will never be resolved otherwise now.
01241                         eachProp(registry, function (mod) {
01242                             if (mod.map.id.indexOf(id + '_unnormalized') === 0) {
01243                                 cleanRegistry(mod.map.id);
01244                             }
01245                         });
01246 
01247                         onError(err);
01248                     });
01249 
01250                     //Allow plugins to load other code without having to know the
01251                     //context or how to 'complete' the load.
01252                     load.fromText = bind(this, function (text, textAlt) {
01253                         /*jslint evil: true */
01254                         var moduleName = map.name,
01255                             moduleMap = makeModuleMap(moduleName),
01256                             hasInteractive = useInteractive;
01257 
01258                         //As of 2.1.0, support just passing the text, to reinforce
01259                         //fromText only being called once per resource. Still
01260                         //support old style of passing moduleName but discard
01261                         //that moduleName in favor of the internal ref.
01262                         if (textAlt) {
01263                             text = textAlt;
01264                         }
01265 
01266                         //Turn off interactive script matching for IE for any define
01267                         //calls in the text, then turn it back on at the end.
01268                         if (hasInteractive) {
01269                             useInteractive = false;
01270                         }
01271 
01272                         //Prime the system by creating a module instance for
01273                         //it.
01274                         getModule(moduleMap);
01275 
01276                         //Transfer any config to this other module.
01277                         if (hasProp(config.config, id)) {
01278                             config.config[moduleName] = config.config[id];
01279                         }
01280 
01281                         try {
01282                             req.exec(text);
01283                         } catch (e) {
01284                             return onError(makeError('fromtexteval',
01285                                              'fromText eval for ' + id +
01286                                             ' failed: ' + e,
01287                                              e,
01288                                              [id]));
01289                         }
01290 
01291                         if (hasInteractive) {
01292                             useInteractive = true;
01293                         }
01294 
01295                         //Mark this as a dependency for the plugin
01296                         //resource
01297                         this.depMaps.push(moduleMap);
01298 
01299                         //Support anonymous modules.
01300                         context.completeLoad(moduleName);
01301 
01302                         //Bind the value of that module to the value for this
01303                         //resource ID.
01304                         localRequire([moduleName], load);
01305                     });
01306 
01307                     //Use parentName here since the plugin's name is not reliable,
01308                     //could be some weird string with no path that actually wants to
01309                     //reference the parentName's path.
01310                     plugin.load(map.name, localRequire, load, config);
01311                 }));
01312 
01313                 context.enable(pluginMap, this);
01314                 this.pluginMaps[pluginMap.id] = pluginMap;
01315             },
01316 
01317             enable: function () {
01318                 enabledRegistry[this.map.id] = this;
01319                 this.enabled = true;
01320 
01321                 //Set flag mentioning that the module is enabling,
01322                 //so that immediate calls to the defined callbacks
01323                 //for dependencies do not trigger inadvertent load
01324                 //with the depCount still being zero.
01325                 this.enabling = true;
01326 
01327                 //Enable each dependency
01328                 each(this.depMaps, bind(this, function (depMap, i) {
01329                     var id, mod, handler;
01330 
01331                     if (typeof depMap === 'string') {
01332                         //Dependency needs to be converted to a depMap
01333                         //and wired up to this module.
01334                         depMap = makeModuleMap(depMap,
01335                                                (this.map.isDefine ? this.map : this.map.parentMap),
01336                                                false,
01337                                                !this.skipMap);
01338                         this.depMaps[i] = depMap;
01339 
01340                         handler = getOwn(handlers, depMap.id);
01341 
01342                         if (handler) {
01343                             this.depExports[i] = handler(this);
01344                             return;
01345                         }
01346 
01347                         this.depCount += 1;
01348 
01349                         on(depMap, 'defined', bind(this, function (depExports) {
01350                             this.defineDep(i, depExports);
01351                             this.check();
01352                         }));
01353 
01354                         if (this.errback) {
01355                             on(depMap, 'error', bind(this, this.errback));
01356                         }
01357                     }
01358 
01359                     id = depMap.id;
01360                     mod = registry[id];
01361 
01362                     //Skip special modules like 'require', 'exports', 'module'
01363                     //Also, don't call enable if it is already enabled,
01364                     //important in circular dependency cases.
01365                     if (!hasProp(handlers, id) && mod && !mod.enabled) {
01366                         context.enable(depMap, this);
01367                     }
01368                 }));
01369 
01370                 //Enable each plugin that is used in
01371                 //a dependency
01372                 eachProp(this.pluginMaps, bind(this, function (pluginMap) {
01373                     var mod = getOwn(registry, pluginMap.id);
01374                     if (mod && !mod.enabled) {
01375                         context.enable(pluginMap, this);
01376                     }
01377                 }));
01378 
01379                 this.enabling = false;
01380 
01381                 this.check();
01382             },
01383 
01384             on: function (name, cb) {
01385                 var cbs = this.events[name];
01386                 if (!cbs) {
01387                     cbs = this.events[name] = [];
01388                 }
01389                 cbs.push(cb);
01390             },
01391 
01392             emit: function (name, evt) {
01393                 each(this.events[name], function (cb) {
01394                     cb(evt);
01395                 });
01396                 if (name === 'error') {
01397                     //Now that the error handler was triggered, remove
01398                     //the listeners, since this broken Module instance
01399                     //can stay around for a while in the registry.
01400                     delete this.events[name];
01401                 }
01402             }
01403         };
01404 
01405         function callGetModule(args) {
01406             //Skip modules already defined.
01407             if (!hasProp(defined, args[0])) {
01408                 getModule(makeModuleMap(args[0], null, true)).init(args[1], args[2]);
01409             }
01410         }
01411 
01412         function removeListener(node, func, name, ieName) {
01413             //Favor detachEvent because of IE9
01414             //issue, see attachEvent/addEventListener comment elsewhere
01415             //in this file.
01416             if (node.detachEvent && !isOpera) {
01417                 //Probably IE. If not it will throw an error, which will be
01418                 //useful to know.
01419                 if (ieName) {
01420                     node.detachEvent(ieName, func);
01421                 }
01422             } else {
01423                 node.removeEventListener(name, func, false);
01424             }
01425         }
01426 
01433         function getScriptData(evt) {
01434             //Using currentTarget instead of target for Firefox 2.0's sake. Not
01435             //all old browsers will be supported, but this one was easy enough
01436             //to support and still makes sense.
01437             var node = evt.currentTarget || evt.srcElement;
01438 
01439             //Remove the listeners once here.
01440             removeListener(node, context.onScriptLoad, 'load', 'onreadystatechange');
01441             removeListener(node, context.onScriptError, 'error');
01442 
01443             return {
01444                 node: node,
01445                 id: node && node.getAttribute('data-requiremodule')
01446             };
01447         }
01448 
01449         function intakeDefines() {
01450             var args;
01451 
01452             //Any defined modules in the global queue, intake them now.
01453             takeGlobalQueue();
01454 
01455             //Make sure any remaining defQueue items get properly processed.
01456             while (defQueue.length) {
01457                 args = defQueue.shift();
01458                 if (args[0] === null) {
01459                     return onError(makeError('mismatch', 'Mismatched anonymous define() module: ' + args[args.length - 1]));
01460                 } else {
01461                     //args are id, deps, factory. Should be normalized by the
01462                     //define() function.
01463                     callGetModule(args);
01464                 }
01465             }
01466         }
01467 
01468         context = {
01469             config: config,
01470             contextName: contextName,
01471             registry: registry,
01472             defined: defined,
01473             urlFetched: urlFetched,
01474             defQueue: defQueue,
01475             Module: Module,
01476             makeModuleMap: makeModuleMap,
01477             nextTick: req.nextTick,
01478             onError: onError,
01479 
01484             configure: function (cfg) {
01485                 //Make sure the baseUrl ends in a slash.
01486                 if (cfg.baseUrl) {
01487                     if (cfg.baseUrl.charAt(cfg.baseUrl.length - 1) !== '/') {
01488                         cfg.baseUrl += '/';
01489                     }
01490                 }
01491 
01492                 //Save off the paths and packages since they require special processing,
01493                 //they are additive.
01494                 var pkgs = config.pkgs,
01495                     shim = config.shim,
01496                     objs = {
01497                         paths: true,
01498                         config: true,
01499                         map: true
01500                     };
01501 
01502                 eachProp(cfg, function (value, prop) {
01503                     if (objs[prop]) {
01504                         if (prop === 'map') {
01505                             if (!config.map) {
01506                                 config.map = {};
01507                             }
01508                             mixin(config[prop], value, true, true);
01509                         } else {
01510                             mixin(config[prop], value, true);
01511                         }
01512                     } else {
01513                         config[prop] = value;
01514                     }
01515                 });
01516 
01517                 //Merge shim
01518                 if (cfg.shim) {
01519                     eachProp(cfg.shim, function (value, id) {
01520                         //Normalize the structure
01521                         if (isArray(value)) {
01522                             value = {
01523                                 deps: value
01524                             };
01525                         }
01526                         if ((value.exports || value.init) && !value.exportsFn) {
01527                             value.exportsFn = context.makeShimExports(value);
01528                         }
01529                         shim[id] = value;
01530                     });
01531                     config.shim = shim;
01532                 }
01533 
01534                 //Adjust packages if necessary.
01535                 if (cfg.packages) {
01536                     each(cfg.packages, function (pkgObj) {
01537                         var location;
01538 
01539                         pkgObj = typeof pkgObj === 'string' ? { name: pkgObj } : pkgObj;
01540                         location = pkgObj.location;
01541 
01542                         //Create a brand new object on pkgs, since currentPackages can
01543                         //be passed in again, and config.pkgs is the internal transformed
01544                         //state for all package configs.
01545                         pkgs[pkgObj.name] = {
01546                             name: pkgObj.name,
01547                             location: location || pkgObj.name,
01548                             //Remove leading dot in main, so main paths are normalized,
01549                             //and remove any trailing .js, since different package
01550                             //envs have different conventions: some use a module name,
01551                             //some use a file name.
01552                             main: (pkgObj.main || 'main')
01553                                   .replace(currDirRegExp, '')
01554                                   .replace(jsSuffixRegExp, '')
01555                         };
01556                     });
01557 
01558                     //Done with modifications, assing packages back to context config
01559                     config.pkgs = pkgs;
01560                 }
01561 
01562                 //If there are any "waiting to execute" modules in the registry,
01563                 //update the maps for them, since their info, like URLs to load,
01564                 //may have changed.
01565                 eachProp(registry, function (mod, id) {
01566                     //If module already has init called, since it is too
01567                     //late to modify them, and ignore unnormalized ones
01568                     //since they are transient.
01569                     if (!mod.inited && !mod.map.unnormalized) {
01570                         mod.map = makeModuleMap(id);
01571                     }
01572                 });
01573 
01574                 //If a deps array or a config callback is specified, then call
01575                 //require with those args. This is useful when require is defined as a
01576                 //config object before require.js is loaded.
01577                 if (cfg.deps || cfg.callback) {
01578                     context.require(cfg.deps || [], cfg.callback);
01579                 }
01580             },
01581 
01582             makeShimExports: function (value) {
01583                 function fn() {
01584                     var ret;
01585                     if (value.init) {
01586                         ret = value.init.apply(global, arguments);
01587                     }
01588                     return ret || (value.exports && getGlobal(value.exports));
01589                 }
01590                 return fn;
01591             },
01592 
01593             makeRequire: function (relMap, options) {
01594                 options = options || {};
01595 
01596                 function localRequire(deps, callback, errback) {
01597                     var id, map, requireMod;
01598 
01599                     if (options.enableBuildCallback && callback && isFunction(callback)) {
01600                         callback.__requireJsBuild = true;
01601                     }
01602 
01603                     if (typeof deps === 'string') {
01604                         if (isFunction(callback)) {
01605                             //Invalid call
01606                             return onError(makeError('requireargs', 'Invalid require call'), errback);
01607                         }
01608 
01609                         //If require|exports|module are requested, get the
01610                         //value for them from the special handlers. Caveat:
01611                         //this only works while module is being defined.
01612                         if (relMap && hasProp(handlers, deps)) {
01613                             return handlers[deps](registry[relMap.id]);
01614                         }
01615 
01616                         //Synchronous access to one module. If require.get is
01617                         //available (as in the Node adapter), prefer that.
01618                         if (req.get) {
01619                             return req.get(context, deps, relMap, localRequire);
01620                         }
01621 
01622                         //Normalize module name, if it contains . or ..
01623                         map = makeModuleMap(deps, relMap, false, true);
01624                         id = map.id;
01625 
01626                         if (!hasProp(defined, id)) {
01627                             return onError(makeError('notloaded', 'Module name "' +
01628                                         id +
01629                                         '" has not been loaded yet for context: ' +
01630                                         contextName +
01631                                         (relMap ? '' : '. Use require([])')));
01632                         }
01633                         return defined[id];
01634                     }
01635 
01636                     //Grab defines waiting in the global queue.
01637                     intakeDefines();
01638 
01639                     //Mark all the dependencies as needing to be loaded.
01640                     context.nextTick(function () {
01641                         //Some defines could have been added since the
01642                         //require call, collect them.
01643                         intakeDefines();
01644 
01645                         requireMod = getModule(makeModuleMap(null, relMap));
01646 
01647                         //Store if map config should be applied to this require
01648                         //call for dependencies.
01649                         requireMod.skipMap = options.skipMap;
01650 
01651                         requireMod.init(deps, callback, errback, {
01652                             enabled: true
01653                         });
01654 
01655                         checkLoaded();
01656                     });
01657 
01658                     return localRequire;
01659                 }
01660 
01661                 mixin(localRequire, {
01662                     isBrowser: isBrowser,
01663 
01669                     toUrl: function (moduleNamePlusExt) {
01670                         var ext,
01671                             index = moduleNamePlusExt.lastIndexOf('.'),
01672                             segment = moduleNamePlusExt.split('/')[0],
01673                             isRelative = segment === '.' || segment === '..';
01674 
01675                         //Have a file extension alias, and it is not the
01676                         //dots from a relative path.
01677                         if (index !== -1 && (!isRelative || index > 1)) {
01678                             ext = moduleNamePlusExt.substring(index, moduleNamePlusExt.length);
01679                             moduleNamePlusExt = moduleNamePlusExt.substring(0, index);
01680                         }
01681 
01682                         return context.nameToUrl(normalize(moduleNamePlusExt,
01683                                                 relMap && relMap.id, true), ext,  true);
01684                     },
01685 
01686                     defined: function (id) {
01687                         return hasProp(defined, makeModuleMap(id, relMap, false, true).id);
01688                     },
01689 
01690                     specified: function (id) {
01691                         id = makeModuleMap(id, relMap, false, true).id;
01692                         return hasProp(defined, id) || hasProp(registry, id);
01693                     }
01694                 });
01695 
01696                 //Only allow undef on top level require calls
01697                 if (!relMap) {
01698                     localRequire.undef = function (id) {
01699                         //Bind any waiting define() calls to this context,
01700                         //fix for #408
01701                         takeGlobalQueue();
01702 
01703                         var map = makeModuleMap(id, relMap, true),
01704                             mod = getOwn(registry, id);
01705 
01706                         delete defined[id];
01707                         delete urlFetched[map.url];
01708                         delete undefEvents[id];
01709 
01710                         if (mod) {
01711                             //Hold on to listeners in case the
01712                             //module will be attempted to be reloaded
01713                             //using a different config.
01714                             if (mod.events.defined) {
01715                                 undefEvents[id] = mod.events;
01716                             }
01717 
01718                             cleanRegistry(id);
01719                         }
01720                     };
01721                 }
01722 
01723                 return localRequire;
01724             },
01725 
01732             enable: function (depMap) {
01733                 var mod = getOwn(registry, depMap.id);
01734                 if (mod) {
01735                     getModule(depMap).enable();
01736                 }
01737             },
01738 
01745             completeLoad: function (moduleName) {
01746                 var found, args, mod,
01747                     shim = getOwn(config.shim, moduleName) || {},
01748                     shExports = shim.exports;
01749 
01750                 takeGlobalQueue();
01751 
01752                 while (defQueue.length) {
01753                     args = defQueue.shift();
01754                     if (args[0] === null) {
01755                         args[0] = moduleName;
01756                         //If already found an anonymous module and bound it
01757                         //to this name, then this is some other anon module
01758                         //waiting for its completeLoad to fire.
01759                         if (found) {
01760                             break;
01761                         }
01762                         found = true;
01763                     } else if (args[0] === moduleName) {
01764                         //Found matching define call for this script!
01765                         found = true;
01766                     }
01767 
01768                     callGetModule(args);
01769                 }
01770 
01771                 //Do this after the cycle of callGetModule in case the result
01772                 //of those calls/init calls changes the registry.
01773                 mod = getOwn(registry, moduleName);
01774 
01775                 if (!found && !hasProp(defined, moduleName) && mod && !mod.inited) {
01776                     if (config.enforceDefine && (!shExports || !getGlobal(shExports))) {
01777                         if (hasPathFallback(moduleName)) {
01778                             return;
01779                         } else {
01780                             return onError(makeError('nodefine',
01781                                              'No define call for ' + moduleName,
01782                                              null,
01783                                              [moduleName]));
01784                         }
01785                     } else {
01786                         //A script that does not call define(), so just simulate
01787                         //the call for it.
01788                         callGetModule([moduleName, (shim.deps || []), shim.exportsFn]);
01789                     }
01790                 }
01791 
01792                 checkLoaded();
01793             },
01794 
01802             nameToUrl: function (moduleName, ext, skipExt) {
01803                 var paths, pkgs, pkg, pkgPath, syms, i, parentModule, url,
01804                     parentPath;
01805 
01806                 //If a colon is in the URL, it indicates a protocol is used and it is just
01807                 //an URL to a file, or if it starts with a slash, contains a query arg (i.e. ?)
01808                 //or ends with .js, then assume the user meant to use an url and not a module id.
01809                 //The slash is important for protocol-less URLs as well as full paths.
01810                 if (req.jsExtRegExp.test(moduleName)) {
01811                     //Just a plain path, not module name lookup, so just return it.
01812                     //Add extension if it is included. This is a bit wonky, only non-.js things pass
01813                     //an extension, this method probably needs to be reworked.
01814                     url = moduleName + (ext || '');
01815                 } else {
01816                     //A module that needs to be converted to a path.
01817                     paths = config.paths;
01818                     pkgs = config.pkgs;
01819 
01820                     syms = moduleName.split('/');
01821                     //For each module name segment, see if there is a path
01822                     //registered for it. Start with most specific name
01823                     //and work up from it.
01824                     for (i = syms.length; i > 0; i -= 1) {
01825                         parentModule = syms.slice(0, i).join('/');
01826                         pkg = getOwn(pkgs, parentModule);
01827                         parentPath = getOwn(paths, parentModule);
01828                         if (parentPath) {
01829                             //If an array, it means there are a few choices,
01830                             //Choose the one that is desired
01831                             if (isArray(parentPath)) {
01832                                 parentPath = parentPath[0];
01833                             }
01834                             syms.splice(0, i, parentPath);
01835                             break;
01836                         } else if (pkg) {
01837                             //If module name is just the package name, then looking
01838                             //for the main module.
01839                             if (moduleName === pkg.name) {
01840                                 pkgPath = pkg.location + '/' + pkg.main;
01841                             } else {
01842                                 pkgPath = pkg.location;
01843                             }
01844                             syms.splice(0, i, pkgPath);
01845                             break;
01846                         }
01847                     }
01848 
01849                     //Join the path parts together, then figure out if baseUrl is needed.
01850                     url = syms.join('/');
01851                     url += (ext || (/\?/.test(url) || skipExt ? '' : '.js'));
01852                     url = (url.charAt(0) === '/' || url.match(/^[\w\+\.\-]+:/) ? '' : config.baseUrl) + url;
01853                 }
01854 
01855                 return config.urlArgs ? url +
01856                                         ((url.indexOf('?') === -1 ? '?' : '&') +
01857                                          config.urlArgs) : url;
01858             },
01859 
01860             //Delegates to req.load. Broken out as a separate function to
01861             //allow overriding in the optimizer.
01862             load: function (id, url) {
01863                 req.load(context, id, url);
01864             },
01865 
01873             execCb: function (name, callback, args, exports) {
01874                 return callback.apply(exports, args);
01875             },
01876 
01883             onScriptLoad: function (evt) {
01884                 //Using currentTarget instead of target for Firefox 2.0's sake. Not
01885                 //all old browsers will be supported, but this one was easy enough
01886                 //to support and still makes sense.
01887                 if (evt.type === 'load' ||
