01888                         (readyRegExp.test((evt.currentTarget || evt.srcElement).readyState))) {
01889                     //Reset interactive script so a script node is not held onto for
01890                     //to long.
01891                     interactiveScript = null;
01892 
01893                     //Pull out the name of the module and the context.
01894                     var data = getScriptData(evt);
01895                     context.completeLoad(data.id);
01896                 }
01897             },
01898 
01902             onScriptError: function (evt) {
01903                 var data = getScriptData(evt);
01904                 if (!hasPathFallback(data.id)) {
01905                     return onError(makeError('scripterror', 'Script error for: ' + data.id, evt, [data.id]));
01906                 }
01907             }
01908         };
01909 
01910         context.require = context.makeRequire();
01911         return context;
01912     }
01913 
01928     req = requirejs = function (deps, callback, errback, optional) {
01929 
01930         //Find the right context, use default
01931         var context, config,
01932             contextName = defContextName;
01933 
01934         // Determine if have config object in the call.
01935         if (!isArray(deps) && typeof deps !== 'string') {
01936             // deps is a config object
01937             config = deps;
01938             if (isArray(callback)) {
01939                 // Adjust args if there are dependencies
01940                 deps = callback;
01941                 callback = errback;
01942                 errback = optional;
01943             } else {
01944                 deps = [];
01945             }
01946         }
01947 
01948         if (config && config.context) {
01949             contextName = config.context;
01950         }
01951 
01952         context = getOwn(contexts, contextName);
01953         if (!context) {
01954             context = contexts[contextName] = req.s.newContext(contextName);
01955         }
01956 
01957         if (config) {
01958             context.configure(config);
01959         }
01960 
01961         return context.require(deps, callback, errback);
01962     };
01963 
01968     req.config = function (config) {
01969         return req(config);
01970     };
01971 
01978     req.nextTick = typeof setTimeout !== 'undefined' ? function (fn) {
01979         setTimeout(fn, 4);
01980     } : function (fn) { fn(); };
01981 
01985     if (!require) {
01986         require = req;
01987     }
01988 
01989     req.version = version;
01990 
01991     //Used to filter out dependencies that are already paths.
01992     req.jsExtRegExp = /^\/|:|\?|\.js$/;
01993     req.isBrowser = isBrowser;
01994     s = req.s = {
01995         contexts: contexts,
01996         newContext: newContext
01997     };
01998 
01999     //Create default context.
02000     req({});
02001 
02002     //Exports some context-sensitive methods on global require.
02003     each([
02004         'toUrl',
02005         'undef',
02006         'defined',
02007         'specified'
02008     ], function (prop) {
02009         //Reference from contexts instead of early binding to default context,
02010         //so that during builds, the latest instance of the default context
02011         //with its config gets used.
02012         req[prop] = function () {
02013             var ctx = contexts[defContextName];
02014             return ctx.require[prop].apply(ctx, arguments);
02015         };
02016     });
02017 
02018     if (isBrowser) {
02019         head = s.head = document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0];
02020         //If BASE tag is in play, using appendChild is a problem for IE6.
02021         //When that browser dies, this can be removed. Details in this jQuery bug:
02022         //http://dev.jquery.com/ticket/2709
02023         baseElement = document.getElementsByTagName('base')[0];
02024         if (baseElement) {
02025             head = s.head = baseElement.parentNode;
02026         }
02027     }
02028 
02034     req.onError = defaultOnError;
02035 
02039     req.createNode = function (config, moduleName, url) {
02040         var node = config.xhtml ?
02041                 document.createElementNS('http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml', 'html:script') :
02042                 document.createElement('script');
02043         node.type = config.scriptType || 'text/javascript';
02044         node.charset = 'utf-8';
02045         node.async = true;
02046         return node;
02047     };
02048 
02058     req.load = function (context, moduleName, url) {
02059         var config = (context && context.config) || {},
02060             node;
02061         if (isBrowser) {
02062             //In the browser so use a script tag
02063             node = req.createNode(config, moduleName, url);
02064 
02065             node.setAttribute('data-requirecontext', context.contextName);
02066             node.setAttribute('data-requiremodule', moduleName);
02067 
02068             //Set up load listener. Test attachEvent first because IE9 has
02069             //a subtle issue in its addEventListener and script onload firings
02070             //that do not match the behavior of all other browsers with
02071             //addEventListener support, which fire the onload event for a
02072             //script right after the script execution. See:
02073             //https://connect.microsoft.com/IE/feedback/details/648057/script-onload-event-is-not-fired-immediately-after-script-execution
02074             //UNFORTUNATELY Opera implements attachEvent but does not follow the script
02075             //script execution mode.
02076             if (node.attachEvent &&
02077                     //Check if node.attachEvent is artificially added by custom script or
02078                     //natively supported by browser
02079                     //read https://github.com/jrburke/requirejs/issues/187
02080                     //if we can NOT find [native code] then it must NOT natively supported.
02081                     //in IE8, node.attachEvent does not have toString()
02082                     //Note the test for "[native code" with no closing brace, see:
02083                     //https://github.com/jrburke/requirejs/issues/273
02084                     !(node.attachEvent.toString && node.attachEvent.toString().indexOf('[native code') < 0) &&
02085                     !isOpera) {
02086                 //Probably IE. IE (at least 6-8) do not fire
02087                 //script onload right after executing the script, so
02088                 //we cannot tie the anonymous define call to a name.
02089                 //However, IE reports the script as being in 'interactive'
02090                 //readyState at the time of the define call.
02091                 useInteractive = true;
02092 
02093                 node.attachEvent('onreadystatechange', context.onScriptLoad);
02094                 //It would be great to add an error handler here to catch
02095                 //404s in IE9+. However, onreadystatechange will fire before
02096                 //the error handler, so that does not help. If addEventListener
02097                 //is used, then IE will fire error before load, but we cannot
02098                 //use that pathway given the connect.microsoft.com issue
02099                 //mentioned above about not doing the 'script execute,
02100                 //then fire the script load event listener before execute
02101                 //next script' that other browsers do.
02102                 //Best hope: IE10 fixes the issues,
02103                 //and then destroys all installs of IE 6-9.
02104                 //node.attachEvent('onerror', context.onScriptError);
02105             } else {
02106                 node.addEventListener('load', context.onScriptLoad, false);
02107                 node.addEventListener('error', context.onScriptError, false);
02108             }
02109             node.src = url;
02110 
02111             //For some cache cases in IE 6-8, the script executes before the end
02112             //of the appendChild execution, so to tie an anonymous define
02113             //call to the module name (which is stored on the node), hold on
02114             //to a reference to this node, but clear after the DOM insertion.
02115             currentlyAddingScript = node;
02116             if (baseElement) {
02117                 head.insertBefore(node, baseElement);
02118             } else {
02119                 head.appendChild(node);
02120             }
02121             currentlyAddingScript = null;
02122 
02123             return node;
02124         } else if (isWebWorker) {
02125             try {
02126                 //In a web worker, use importScripts. This is not a very
02127                 //efficient use of importScripts, importScripts will block until
02128                 //its script is downloaded and evaluated. However, if web workers
02129                 //are in play, the expectation that a build has been done so that
02130                 //only one script needs to be loaded anyway. This may need to be
02131                 //reevaluated if other use cases become common.
02132                 importScripts(url);
02133 
02134                 //Account for anonymous modules
02135                 context.completeLoad(moduleName);
02136             } catch (e) {
02137                 context.onError(makeError('importscripts',
02138                                 'importScripts failed for ' +
02139                                     moduleName + ' at ' + url,
02140                                 e,
02141                                 [moduleName]));
02142             }
02143         }
02144     };
02145 
02146     function getInteractiveScript() {
02147         if (interactiveScript && interactiveScript.readyState === 'interactive') {
02148             return interactiveScript;
02149         }
02150 
02151         eachReverse(scripts(), function (script) {
02152             if (script.readyState === 'interactive') {
02153                 return (interactiveScript = script);
02154             }
02155         });
02156         return interactiveScript;
02157     }
02158 
02159     //Look for a data-main script attribute, which could also adjust the baseUrl.
02160     if (isBrowser) {
02161         //Figure out baseUrl. Get it from the script tag with require.js in it.
02162         eachReverse(scripts(), function (script) {
02163             //Set the 'head' where we can append children by
02164             //using the script's parent.
02165             if (!head) {
02166                 head = script.parentNode;
02167             }
02168 
02169             //Look for a data-main attribute to set main script for the page
02170             //to load. If it is there, the path to data main becomes the
02171             //baseUrl, if it is not already set.
02172             dataMain = script.getAttribute('data-main');
02173             if (dataMain) {
02174                 //Preserve dataMain in case it is a path (i.e. contains '?')
02175                 mainScript = dataMain;
02176 
02177                 //Set final baseUrl if there is not already an explicit one.
02178                 if (!cfg.baseUrl) {
02179                     //Pull off the directory of data-main for use as the
02180                     //baseUrl.
02181                     src = mainScript.split('/');
02182                     mainScript = src.pop();
02183                     subPath = src.length ? src.join('/')  + '/' : './';
02184 
02185                     cfg.baseUrl = subPath;
02186                 }
02187 
02188                 //Strip off any trailing .js since mainScript is now
02189                 //like a module name.
02190                 mainScript = mainScript.replace(jsSuffixRegExp, '');
02191 
02192                  //If mainScript is still a path, fall back to dataMain
02193                 if (req.jsExtRegExp.test(mainScript)) {
02194                     mainScript = dataMain;
02195                 }
02196 
02197                 //Put the data-main script in the files to load.
02198                 cfg.deps = cfg.deps ? cfg.deps.concat(mainScript) : [mainScript];
02199 
02200                 return true;
02201             }
02202         });
02203     }
02204 
02212     define = function (name, deps, callback) {
02213         var node, context;
02214 
02215         //Allow for anonymous modules
02216         if (typeof name !== 'string') {
02217             //Adjust args appropriately
02218             callback = deps;
02219             deps = name;
02220             name = null;
02221         }
02222 
02223         //This module may not have dependencies
02224         if (!isArray(deps)) {
02225             callback = deps;
02226             deps = null;
02227         }
02228 
02229         //If no name, and callback is a function, then figure out if it a
02230         //CommonJS thing with dependencies.
02231         if (!deps && isFunction(callback)) {
02232             deps = [];
02233             //Remove comments from the callback string,
02234             //look for require calls, and pull them into the dependencies,
02235             //but only if there are function args.
02236             if (callback.length) {
02237                 callback
02238                     .toString()
02239                     .replace(commentRegExp, '')
02240                     .replace(cjsRequireRegExp, function (match, dep) {
02241                         deps.push(dep);
02242                     });
02243 
02244                 //May be a CommonJS thing even without require calls, but still
02245                 //could use exports, and module. Avoid doing exports and module
02246                 //work though if it just needs require.
02247                 //REQUIRES the function to expect the CommonJS variables in the
02248                 //order listed below.
02249                 deps = (callback.length === 1 ? ['require'] : ['require', 'exports', 'module']).concat(deps);
02250             }
02251         }
02252 
02253         //If in IE 6-8 and hit an anonymous define() call, do the interactive
02254         //work.
02255         if (useInteractive) {
02256             node = currentlyAddingScript || getInteractiveScript();
02257             if (node) {
02258                 if (!name) {
02259                     name = node.getAttribute('data-requiremodule');
02260                 }
02261                 context = contexts[node.getAttribute('data-requirecontext')];
02262             }
02263         }
02264 
02265         //Always save off evaluating the def call until the script onload handler.
02266         //This allows multiple modules to be in a file without prematurely
02267         //tracing dependencies, and allows for anonymous module support,
02268         //where the module name is not known until the script onload event
02269         //occurs. If no context, use the global queue, and get it processed
02270         //in the onscript load callback.
02271         (context ? context.defQueue : globalDefQueue).push([name, deps, callback]);
02272     };
02273 
02274     define.amd = {
02275         jQuery: true
02276     };
02277 
02278 
02285     req.exec = function (text) {
02286         /*jslint evil: true */
02287         return eval(text);
02288     };
02289 
02290     //Set up with config info.
02291     req(cfg);
02292 }(this));
02293 
02294 
02295 
02296     this.requirejsVars = {
02297         require: require,
02298         requirejs: require,
02299         define: define
02300     };
02301 
02302     if (env === 'browser') {
02309 //sloppy since eval enclosed with use strict causes problems if the source
02310 //text is not strict-compliant.
02311 /*jslint sloppy: true, evil: true */
02312 /*global require, XMLHttpRequest */
02313 
02314 (function () {
02315     require.load = function (context, moduleName, url) {
02316         var xhr = new XMLHttpRequest();
02317 
02318         xhr.open('GET', url, true);
02319         xhr.send();
02320 
02321         xhr.onreadystatechange = function () {
02322             if (xhr.readyState === 4) {
02323                 eval(xhr.responseText);
02324 
02325                 //Support anonymous modules.
02326                 context.completeLoad(moduleName);
02327             }
02328         };
02329     };
02330 }());
02331     } else if (env === 'rhino') {
02338 /*jslint */
02339 /*global require: false, java: false, load: false */
02340 
02341 (function () {
02342     'use strict';
02343     require.load = function (context, moduleName, url) {
02344 
02345         load(url);
02346 
02347         //Support anonymous modules.
02348         context.completeLoad(moduleName);
02349     };
02350 
02351 }());
02352     } else if (env === 'node') {
02353         this.requirejsVars.nodeRequire = nodeRequire;
02354         require.nodeRequire = nodeRequire;
02355 
02362 /*jslint regexp: false */
02363 /*global require: false, define: false, requirejsVars: false, process: false */
02364 
02372 (function () {
02373     'use strict';
02374 
02375     var nodeReq = requirejsVars.nodeRequire,
02376         req = requirejsVars.require,
02377         def = requirejsVars.define,
02378         fs = nodeReq('fs'),
02379         path = nodeReq('path'),
02380         vm = nodeReq('vm'),
02381         //In Node 0.7+ existsSync is on fs.
02382         exists = fs.existsSync || path.existsSync,
02383         hasOwn = Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty;
02384 
02385     function hasProp(obj, prop) {
02386         return hasOwn.call(obj, prop);
02387     }
02388 
02389     function syncTick(fn) {
02390         fn();
02391     }
02392 
02393     //Supply an implementation that allows synchronous get of a module.
02394     req.get = function (context, moduleName, relModuleMap, localRequire) {
02395         if (moduleName === "require" || moduleName === "exports" || moduleName === "module") {
02396             req.onError(new Error("Explicit require of " + moduleName + " is not allowed."));
02397         }
02398 
02399         var ret, oldTick,
02400             moduleMap = context.makeModuleMap(moduleName, relModuleMap, false, true);
02401 
02402         //Normalize module name, if it contains . or ..
02403         moduleName = moduleMap.id;
02404 
02405         if (hasProp(context.defined, moduleName)) {
02406             ret = context.defined[moduleName];
02407         } else {
02408             if (ret === undefined) {
02409                 //Make sure nextTick for this type of call is sync-based.
02410                 oldTick = context.nextTick;
02411                 context.nextTick = syncTick;
02412                 try {
02413                     if (moduleMap.prefix) {
02414                         //A plugin, call requirejs to handle it. Now that
02415                         //nextTick is syncTick, the require will complete
02416                         //synchronously.
02417                         localRequire([moduleMap.originalName]);
02418 
02419                         //Now that plugin is loaded, can regenerate the moduleMap
02420                         //to get the final, normalized ID.
02421                         moduleMap = context.makeModuleMap(moduleMap.originalName, relModuleMap, false, true);
02422                         moduleName = moduleMap.id;
02423                     } else {
02424                         //Try to dynamically fetch it.
02425                         req.load(context, moduleName, moduleMap.url);
02426 
02427                         //Enable the module
02428                         context.enable(moduleMap, relModuleMap);
02429                     }
02430 
02431                     //Break any cycles by requiring it normally, but this will
02432                     //finish synchronously
02433                     require([moduleName]);
02434 
02435                     //The above calls are sync, so can do the next thing safely.
02436                     ret = context.defined[moduleName];
02437                 } finally {
02438                     context.nextTick = oldTick;
02439                 }
02440             }
02441         }
02442 
02443         return ret;
02444     };
02445 
02446     req.nextTick = function (fn) {
02447         process.nextTick(fn);
02448     };
02449 
02450     //Add wrapper around the code so that it gets the requirejs
02451     //API instead of the Node API, and it is done lexically so
02452     //that it survives later execution.
02453     req.makeNodeWrapper = function (contents) {
02454         return '(function (require, requirejs, define) { ' +
02455                 contents +
02456                 '\n}(requirejsVars.require, requirejsVars.requirejs, requirejsVars.define));';
02457     };
02458 
02459     req.load = function (context, moduleName, url) {
02460         var contents, err,
02461             config = context.config;
02462 
02463         if (config.shim[moduleName] && (!config.suppress || !config.suppress.nodeShim)) {
02464             console.warn('Shim config not supported in Node, may or may not work. Detected ' +
02465                             'for module: ' + moduleName);
02466         }
02467 
02468         if (exists(url)) {
02469             contents = fs.readFileSync(url, 'utf8');
02470 
02471             contents = req.makeNodeWrapper(contents);
02472             try {
02473                 vm.runInThisContext(contents, fs.realpathSync(url));
02474             } catch (e) {
02475                 err = new Error('Evaluating ' + url + ' as module "' +
02476                                 moduleName + '" failed with error: ' + e);
02477                 err.originalError = e;
02478                 err.moduleName = moduleName;
02479                 err.fileName = url;
02480                 return req.onError(err);
02481             }
02482         } else {
02483             def(moduleName, function () {
02484                 //Get the original name, since relative requires may be
02485                 //resolved differently in node (issue #202). Also, if relative,
02486                 //make it relative to the URL of the item requesting it
02487                 //(issue #393)
02488                 var dirName,
02489                     map = hasProp(context.registry, moduleName) &&
02490                             context.registry[moduleName].map,
02491                     parentMap = map && map.parentMap,
02492                     originalName = map && map.originalName;
02493 
02494                 if (originalName.charAt(0) === '.' && parentMap) {
02495                     dirName = parentMap.url.split('/');
02496                     dirName.pop();
02497                     originalName = dirName.join('/') + '/' + originalName;
02498                 }
02499 
02500                 try {
02501                     return (context.config.nodeRequire || req.nodeRequire)(originalName);
02502                 } catch (e) {
02503                     err = new Error('Tried loading "' + moduleName + '" at ' +
02504                                      url + ' then tried node\'s require("' +
02505                                         originalName + '") and it failed ' +
02506                                      'with error: ' + e);
02507                     err.originalError = e;
02508                     err.moduleName = originalName;
02509                     return req.onError(err);
02510                 }
02511             });
02512         }
02513 
02514         //Support anonymous modules.
02515         context.completeLoad(moduleName);
02516     };
02517 
02518     //Override to provide the function wrapper for define/require.
02519     req.exec = function (text) {
02520         /*jslint evil: true */
02521         text = req.makeNodeWrapper(text);
02522         return eval(text);
02523     };
02524 }());
02525 
02526     } else if (env === 'xpconnect') {
02533 /*jslint */
02534 /*global require, load */
02535 
02536 (function () {
02537     'use strict';
02538     require.load = function (context, moduleName, url) {
02539 
02540         load(url);
02541 
02542         //Support anonymous modules.
02543         context.completeLoad(moduleName);
02544     };
02545 
02546 }());
02547 
02548     }
02549 
02550     //Support a default file name to execute. Useful for hosted envs
02551     //like Joyent where it defaults to a server.js as the only executed
02552     //script. But only do it if this is not an optimization run.
02553     if (commandOption !== 'o' && (!fileName || !jsSuffixRegExp.test(fileName))) {
02554         fileName = 'main.js';
02555     }
02556 
02561     function loadLib() {
02568 /*jslint strict: false */
02569 /*global Packages: false, process: false, window: false, navigator: false,
02570   document: false, define: false */
02571 
02576 (function () {
02577     var pathRegExp = /(\/|^)env\/|\{env\}/,
02578         env = 'unknown';
02579 
02580     if (typeof Packages !== 'undefined') {
02581         env = 'rhino';
02582     } else if (typeof process !== 'undefined' && process.versions && !!process.versions.node) {
02583         env = 'node';
02584     } else if ((typeof navigator !== 'undefined' && typeof document !== 'undefined') ||
02585             (typeof importScripts !== 'undefined' && typeof self !== 'undefined')) {
02586         env = 'browser';
02587     } else if (typeof Components !== 'undefined' && Components.classes && Components.interfaces) {
02588         env = 'xpconnect';
02589     }
02590 
02591     define('env', {
02592         get: function () {
02593             return env;
02594         },
02595 
02596         load: function (name, req, load, config) {
02597             //Allow override in the config.
02598             if (config.env) {
02599                 env = config.env;
02600             }
02601 
02602             name = name.replace(pathRegExp, function (match, prefix) {
02603                 if (match.indexOf('{') === -1) {
02604                     return prefix + env + '/';
02605                 } else {
02606                     return env;
02607                 }
02608             });
02609 
02610             req([name], function (mod) {
02611                 load(mod);
02612             });
02613         }
02614     });
02615 }());/**
02616  * @license Copyright (c) 2010-2011, The Dojo Foundation All Rights Reserved.
02617  * Available via the MIT or new BSD license.
02618  * see: http://github.com/jrburke/requirejs for details
02619  */
02620 
02621 /*jslint plusplus: true */
02622 /*global define */
02623 
02624 define('lang', function () {
02625     'use strict';
02626 
02627     var lang,
02628         hasOwn = Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty;
02629 
02630     function hasProp(obj, prop) {
02631         return hasOwn.call(obj, prop);
02632     }
02633 
02634     lang = {
02635         backSlashRegExp: /\\/g,
02636         ostring: Object.prototype.toString,
02637 
02638         isArray: Array.isArray || function (it) {
02639             return lang.ostring.call(it) === "[object Array]";
02640         },
02641 
02642         isFunction: function(it) {
02643             return lang.ostring.call(it) === "[object Function]";
02644         },
02645 
02646         isRegExp: function(it) {
02647             return it && it instanceof RegExp;
02648         },
02649 
02650         hasProp: hasProp,
02651 
02652         //returns true if the object does not have an own property prop,
02653         //or if it does, it is a falsy value.
02654         falseProp: function (obj, prop) {
02655             return !hasProp(obj, prop) || !obj[prop];
02656         },
02657 
02658         //gets own property value for given prop on object
02659         getOwn: function (obj, prop) {
02660             return hasProp(obj, prop) && obj[prop];
02661         },
02662 
02663         _mixin: function(dest, source, override){
02664             var name;
02665             for (name in source) {
02666                 if(source.hasOwnProperty(name)
02667                     && (override || !dest.hasOwnProperty(name))) {
02668                     dest[name] = source[name];
02669                 }
02670             }
02671 
02672             return dest; // Object
02673         },
02674 
02679         mixin: function(dest){
02680             var parameters = Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments),
02681                 override, i, l;
02682 
02683             if (!dest) { dest = {}; }
02684 
02685             if (parameters.length > 2 && typeof arguments[parameters.length-1] === 'boolean') {
02686                 override = parameters.pop();
02687             }
02688 
02689             for (i = 1, l = parameters.length; i < l; i++) {
02690                 lang._mixin(dest, parameters[i], override);
02691             }
02692             return dest; // Object
02693         },
02694 
02695         delegate: (function () {
02696             // boodman/crockford delegation w/ cornford optimization
02697             function TMP() {}
02698             return function (obj, props) {
02699                 TMP.prototype = obj;
02700                 var tmp = new TMP();
02701                 TMP.prototype = null;
02702                 if (props) {
02703                     lang.mixin(tmp, props);
02704                 }
02705                 return tmp; // Object
02706             };
02707         }()),
02708 
02713         each: function each(ary, func) {
02714             if (ary) {
02715                 var i;
02716                 for (i = 0; i < ary.length; i += 1) {
02717                     if (func(ary[i], i, ary)) {
02718                         break;
02719                     }
02720                 }
02721             }
02722         },
02723 
02729         eachProp: function eachProp(obj, func) {
02730             var prop;
02731             for (prop in obj) {
02732                 if (hasProp(obj, prop)) {
02733                     if (func(obj[prop], prop)) {
02734                         break;
02735                     }
02736                 }
02737             }
02738         },
02739 
02740         //Similar to Function.prototype.bind, but the "this" object is specified
02741         //first, since it is easier to read/figure out what "this" will be.
02742         bind: function bind(obj, fn) {
02743             return function () {
02744                 return fn.apply(obj, arguments);
02745             };
02746         },
02747 
02748         //Escapes a content string to be be a string that has characters escaped
02749         //for inclusion as part of a JS string.
02750         jsEscape: function (content) {
02751             return content.replace(/(["'\\])/g, '\\$1')
02752                 .replace(/[\f]/g, "\\f")
02753                 .replace(/[\b]/g, "\\b")
02754                 .replace(/[\n]/g, "\\n")
02755                 .replace(/[\t]/g, "\\t")
02756                 .replace(/[\r]/g, "\\r");
02757         }
02758     };
02759     return lang;
02760 });
02767 /*global setImmediate, process, setTimeout, define, module */
02768 
02769 //Set prime.hideResolutionConflict = true to allow "resolution-races"
02770 //in promise-tests to pass.
02771 //Since the goal of prim is to be a small impl for trusted code, it is
02772 //more important to normally throw in this case so that we can find
02773 //logic errors quicker.
02774 
02775 var prim;
02776 (function () {
02777     'use strict';
02778     var op = Object.prototype,
02779         hasOwn = op.hasOwnProperty;
02780 
02781     function hasProp(obj, prop) {
02782         return hasOwn.call(obj, prop);
02783     }
02784 
02789     function each(ary, func) {
02790         if (ary) {
02791             var i;
02792             for (i = 0; i < ary.length; i += 1) {
02793                 if (ary[i]) {
02794                     func(ary[i], i, ary);
02795                 }
02796             }
02797         }
02798     }
02799 
02800     function check(p) {
02801         if (hasProp(p, 'e') || hasProp(p, 'v')) {
02802             if (!prim.hideResolutionConflict) {
02803                 throw new Error('nope');
02804             }
02805             return false;
02806         }
02807         return true;
02808     }
02809 
02810     function notify(ary, value) {
02811         prim.nextTick(function () {
02812             each(ary, function (item) {
02813                 item(value);
02814             });
02815         });
02816     }
02817 
02818     prim = function prim() {
02819         var p,
02820             ok = [],
02821             fail = [];
02822 
02823         return (p = {
02824             callback: function (yes, no) {
02825                 if (no) {
02826                     p.errback(no);
02827                 }
02828 
02829                 if (hasProp(p, 'v')) {
02830                     prim.nextTick(function () {
02831                         yes(p.v);
02832                     });
02833                 } else {
02834                     ok.push(yes);
02835                 }
02836             },
02837 
02838             errback: function (no) {
02839                 if (hasProp(p, 'e')) {
02840                     prim.nextTick(function () {
02841                         no(p.e);
02842                     });
02843                 } else {
02844                     fail.push(no);
02845                 }
02846             },
02847 
02848             finished: function () {
02849                 return hasProp(p, 'e') || hasProp(p, 'v');
02850             },
02851 
02852             rejected: function () {
02853                 return hasProp(p, 'e');
02854             },
02855 
02856             resolve: function (v) {
02857                 if (check(p)) {
02858                     p.v = v;
02859                     notify(ok, v);
02860                 }
02861                 return p;
02862             },
02863             reject: function (e) {
02864                 if (check(p)) {
02865                     p.e = e;
02866                     notify(fail, e);
02867                 }
02868                 return p;
02869             },
02870 
02871             start: function (fn) {
02872                 p.resolve();
02873                 return p.promise.then(fn);
02874             },
02875 
02876             promise: {
02877                 then: function (yes, no) {
02878                     var next = prim();
02879 
02880                     p.callback(function (v) {
02881                         try {
02882                             if (yes && typeof yes === 'function') {
02883                                 v = yes(v);
02884                             }
02885 
02886                             if (v && v.then) {
02887                                 v.then(next.resolve, next.reject);
02888                             } else {
02889                                 next.resolve(v);
02890                             }
02891                         } catch (e) {
02892                             next.reject(e);
02893                         }
02894                     }, function (e) {
02895                         var err;
02896 
02897                         try {
02898                             if (!no || typeof no !== 'function') {
02899                                 next.reject(e);
02900                             } else {
02901                                 err = no(e);
02902 
02903                                 if (err && err.then) {
02904                                     err.then(next.resolve, next.reject);
02905                                 } else {
02906                                     next.resolve(err);
02907                                 }
02908                             }
02909                         } catch (e2) {
02910                             next.reject(e2);
02911                         }
02912                     });
02913 
02914                     return next.promise;
02915                 },
02916 
02917                 fail: function (no) {
02918                     return p.promise.then(null, no);
02919                 },
02920 
02921                 end: function () {
02922                     p.errback(function (e) {
02923                         throw e;
02924                     });
02925                 }
02926             }
02927         });
02928     };
02929 
02930     prim.serial = function (ary) {
02931         var result = prim().resolve().promise;
02932         each(ary, function (item) {
02933             result = result.then(function () {
02934                 return item();
02935             });
02936         });
02937         return result;
02938     };
02939 
02940     prim.nextTick = typeof setImmediate === 'function' ? setImmediate :
02941         (typeof process !== 'undefined' && process.nextTick ?
02942             process.nextTick : (typeof setTimeout !== 'undefined' ?
02943                 function (fn) {
02944                 setTimeout(fn, 0);
02945             } : function (fn) {
02946         fn();
02947     }));
02948 
02949     if (typeof define === 'function' && define.amd) {
02950         define('prim', function () { return prim; });
02951     } else if (typeof module !== 'undefined' && module.exports) {
02952         module.exports = prim;
02953     }
02954 }());
02955 if(env === 'browser') {
02962 /*jslint strict: false */
02963 /*global define: false, load: false */
02964 
02965 //Just a stub for use with uglify's consolidator.js
02966 define('browser/assert', function () {
02967     return {};
02968 });
02969 
02970 }
02971 
02972 if(env === 'node') {
02979 /*jslint strict: false */
02980 /*global define: false, load: false */
02981 
02982 //Needed so that rhino/assert can return a stub for uglify's consolidator.js
02983 define('node/assert', ['assert'], function (assert) {
02984     return assert;
02985 });
02986 
02987 }
02988 
02989 if(env === 'rhino') {
02996 /*jslint strict: false */
02997 /*global define: false, load: false */
02998 
02999 //Just a stub for use with uglify's consolidator.js
03000 define('rhino/assert', function () {
03001     return {};
03002 });
03003 
03004 }
03005 
03006 if(env === 'xpconnect') {
03013 /*jslint strict: false */
03014 /*global define: false, load: false */
03015 
03016 //Just a stub for use with uglify's consolidator.js
03017 define('xpconnect/assert', function () {
03018     return {};
03019 });
03020 
03021 }
03022 
03023 if(env === 'browser') {
03030 /*jslint strict: false */
03031 /*global define: false, process: false */
03032 
03033 define('browser/args', function () {
03034     //Always expect config via an API call
03035     return [];
03036 });
03037 
03038 }
03039 
03040 if(env === 'node') {
03047 /*jslint strict: false */
03048 /*global define: false, process: false */
03049 
03050 define('node/args', function () {
03051     //Do not return the "node" or "r.js" arguments
03052     var args = process.argv.slice(2);
03053 
03054     //Ignore any command option used for main x.js branching
03055     if (args[0] && args[0].indexOf('-') === 0) {
03056         args = args.slice(1);
03057     }
03058 
03059     return args;
03060 });
03061 
03062 }
03063 
03064 if(env === 'rhino') {
03071 /*jslint strict: false */
03072 /*global define: false, process: false */
03073 
03074 var jsLibRhinoArgs = (typeof rhinoArgs !== 'undefined' && rhinoArgs) || [].concat(Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments, 0));
03075 
03076 define('rhino/args', function () {
03077     var args = jsLibRhinoArgs;
03078 
03079     //Ignore any command option used for main x.js branching
03080     if (args[0] && args[0].indexOf('-') === 0) {
03081         args = args.slice(1);
03082     }
03083 
03084     return args;
03085 });
03086 
03087 }
03088 
03089 if(env === 'xpconnect') {
03096 /*jslint strict: false */
03097 /*global define, xpconnectArgs */
03098 
03099 var jsLibXpConnectArgs = (typeof xpconnectArgs !== 'undefined' && xpconnectArgs) || [].concat(Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments, 0));
03100 
03101 define('xpconnect/args', function () {
03102     var args = jsLibXpConnectArgs;
03103 
03104     //Ignore any command option used for main x.js branching
03105     if (args[0] && args[0].indexOf('-') === 0) {
03106         args = args.slice(1);
03107     }
03108 
03109     return args;
03110 });
03111 
03112 }
03113 
03114 if(env === 'browser') {
03121 /*jslint strict: false */
03122 /*global define: false, console: false */
03123 
03124 define('browser/load', ['./file'], function (file) {
03125     function load(fileName) {
03126         eval(file.readFile(fileName));
03127     }
03128 
03129     return load;
03130 });
03131 
03132 }
03133 
03134 if(env === 'node') {
03141 /*jslint strict: false */
03142 /*global define: false, console: false */
03143 
03144 define('node/load', ['fs'], function (fs) {
03145     function load(fileName) {
03146         var contents = fs.readFileSync(fileName, 'utf8');
03147         process.compile(contents, fileName);
03148     }
03149 
03150     return load;
03151 });
03152 
03153 }
03154 
03155 if(env === 'rhino') {
03162 /*jslint strict: false */
03163 /*global define: false, load: false */
03164 
03165 define('rhino/load', function () {
03166     return load;
03167 });
03168 
03169 }
03170 
03171 if(env === 'xpconnect') {
03178 /*jslint strict: false */
03179 /*global define: false, load: false */
03180 
03181 define('xpconnect/load', function () {
03182     return load;
03183 });
03184 
03185 }
03186 
03187 if(env === 'browser') {
03194 /*jslint sloppy: true, nomen: true */
03195 /*global require, define, console, XMLHttpRequest, requirejs, location */
03196 
03197 define('browser/file', ['prim'], function (prim) {
03198 
03199     var file,
03200         currDirRegExp = /^\.(\/|$)/;
03201 
03202     function frontSlash(path) {
03203         return path.replace(/\\/g, '/');
03204     }
03205 
03206     function exists(path) {
03207         var status, xhr = new XMLHttpRequest();
03208 
03209         //Oh yeah, that is right SYNC IO. Behold its glory
03210         //and horrible blocking behavior.
03211         xhr.open('HEAD', path, false);
03212         xhr.send();
03213         status = xhr.status;
03214 
03215         return status === 200 || status === 304;
03216     }
03217 
03218     function mkDir(dir) {
03219         console.log('mkDir is no-op in browser');
03220     }
03221 
03222     function mkFullDir(dir) {
03223         console.log('mkFullDir is no-op in browser');
03224     }
03225 
03226     file = {
03227         backSlashRegExp: /\\/g,
03228         exclusionRegExp: /^\./,
03229         getLineSeparator: function () {
03230             return '/';
03231         },
03232 
03233         exists: function (fileName) {
03234             return exists(fileName);
03235         },
03236 
03237         parent: function (fileName) {
03238             var parts = fileName.split('/');
03239             parts.pop();
03240             return parts.join('/');
03241         },
03242 
03248         absPath: function (fileName) {
03249             var dir;
03250             if (currDirRegExp.test(fileName)) {
03251                 dir = frontSlash(location.href);
03252                 if (dir.indexOf('/') !== -1) {
03253                     dir = dir.split('/');
03254 
03255                     //Pull off protocol and host, just want
03256                     //to allow paths (other build parts, like
03257                     //require._isSupportedBuildUrl do not support
03258                     //full URLs), but a full path from
03259                     //the root.
03260                     dir.splice(0, 3);
03261 
03262                     dir.pop();
03263                     dir = '/' + dir.join('/');
03264                 }
03265 
03266                 fileName = dir + fileName.substring(1);
03267             }
03268 
03269             return fileName;
03270         },
03271 
03272         normalize: function (fileName) {
03273             return fileName;
03274         },
03275 
03276         isFile: function (path) {
03277             return true;
03278         },
03279 
03280         isDirectory: function (path) {
03281             return false;
03282         },
03283 
03284         getFilteredFileList: function (startDir, regExpFilters, makeUnixPaths) {
03285             console.log('file.getFilteredFileList is no-op in browser');
03286         },
03287 
03288         copyDir: function (srcDir, destDir, regExpFilter, onlyCopyNew) {
03289             console.log('file.copyDir is no-op in browser');
03290 
03291         },
03292 
03293         copyFile: function (srcFileName, destFileName, onlyCopyNew) {
03294             console.log('file.copyFile is no-op in browser');
03295         },
03296 
03300         renameFile: function (from, to) {
03301             console.log('file.renameFile is no-op in browser');
03302         },
03303 
03307         readFile: function (path, encoding) {
03308             var xhr = new XMLHttpRequest();
03309 
03310             //Oh yeah, that is right SYNC IO. Behold its glory
03311             //and horrible blocking behavior.
03312             xhr.open('GET', path, false);
03313             xhr.send();
03314 
03315             return xhr.responseText;
03316         },
03317 
03318         readFileAsync: function (path, encoding) {
03319             var xhr = new XMLHttpRequest(),
03320                 d = prim();
03321 
03322             xhr.open('GET', path, true);
03323             xhr.send();
03324 
03325             xhr.onreadystatechange = function () {
03326                 if (xhr.readyState === 4) {
03327                     if (xhr.status > 400) {
03328                         d.reject(new Error('Status: ' + xhr.status + ': ' + xhr.statusText));
03329                     } else {
03330                         d.resolve(xhr.responseText);
03331                     }
03332                 }
03333             };
03334 
03335             return d.promise;
03336         },
03337 
03338         saveUtf8File: function (fileName, fileContents) {
03339             //summary: saves a *text* file using UTF-8 encoding.
03340             file.saveFile(fileName, fileContents, "utf8");
03341         },
03342 
03343         saveFile: function (fileName, fileContents, encoding) {
03344             requirejs.browser.saveFile(fileName, fileContents, encoding);
03345         },
03346 
03347         deleteFile: function (fileName) {
03348             console.log('file.deleteFile is no-op in browser');
03349         },
03350 
03354         deleteEmptyDirs: function (startDir) {
03355             console.log('file.deleteEmptyDirs is no-op in browser');
03356         }
03357     };
03358 
03359     return file;
03360 
03361 });
03362 
03363 }
03364 
03365 if(env === 'node') {
03372 /*jslint plusplus: false, octal:false, strict: false */
03373 /*global define: false, process: false */
03374 
03375 define('node/file', ['fs', 'path', 'prim'], function (fs, path, prim) {
03376 
03377     var isWindows = process.platform === 'win32',
03378         windowsDriveRegExp = /^[a-zA-Z]\:\/$/,
03379         file;
03380 
03381     function frontSlash(path) {
03382         return path.replace(/\\/g, '/');
03383     }
03384 
03385     function exists(path) {
03386         if (isWindows && path.charAt(path.length - 1) === '/' &&
03387             path.charAt(path.length - 2) !== ':') {
03388             path = path.substring(0, path.length - 1);
03389         }
03390 
03391         try {
03392             fs.statSync(path);
03393             return true;
03394         } catch (e) {
03395             return false;
03396         }
03397     }
03398 
03399     function mkDir(dir) {
03400         if (!exists(dir) && (!isWindows || !windowsDriveRegExp.test(dir))) {
03401             fs.mkdirSync(dir, 511);
03402         }
03403     }
03404 
03405     function mkFullDir(dir) {
03406         var parts = dir.split('/'),
03407             currDir = '',
03408             first = true;
03409 
03410         parts.forEach(function (part) {
03411             //First part may be empty string if path starts with a slash.
03412             currDir += part + '/';
03413             first = false;
03414 
03415             if (part) {
03416                 mkDir(currDir);
03417             }
03418         });
03419     }
03420 
03421     file = {
03422         backSlashRegExp: /\\/g,
03423         exclusionRegExp: /^\./,
03424         getLineSeparator: function () {
03425             return '/';
03426         },
03427 
03428         exists: function (fileName) {
03429             return exists(fileName);
03430         },
03431 
03432         parent: function (fileName) {
03433             var parts = fileName.split('/');
03434             parts.pop();
03435             return parts.join('/');
03436         },
03437 
03443         absPath: function (fileName) {
03444             return frontSlash(path.normalize(frontSlash(fs.realpathSync(fileName))));
03445         },
03446 
03447         normalize: function (fileName) {
03448             return frontSlash(path.normalize(fileName));
03449         },
03450 
03451         isFile: function (path) {
03452             return fs.statSync(path).isFile();
03453         },
03454 
03455         isDirectory: function (path) {
03456             return fs.statSync(path).isDirectory();
03457         },
03458 
03459         getFilteredFileList: function (/*String*/startDir, /*RegExp*/regExpFilters, /*boolean?*/makeUnixPaths) {
03460             //summary: Recurses startDir and finds matches to the files that match regExpFilters.include
03461             //and do not match regExpFilters.exclude. Or just one regexp can be passed in for regExpFilters,
03462             //and it will be treated as the "include" case.
03463             //Ignores files/directories that start with a period (.) unless exclusionRegExp
03464             //is set to another value.
03465             var files = [], topDir, regExpInclude, regExpExclude, dirFileArray,
03466                 i, stat, filePath, ok, dirFiles, fileName;
03467 
03468             topDir = startDir;
03469 
03470             regExpInclude = regExpFilters.include || regExpFilters;
03471             regExpExclude = regExpFilters.exclude || null;
03472 
03473             if (file.exists(topDir)) {
03474                 dirFileArray = fs.readdirSync(topDir);
03475                 for (i = 0; i < dirFileArray.length; i++) {
03476                     fileName = dirFileArray[i];
03477                     filePath = path.join(topDir, fileName);
03478                     stat = fs.statSync(filePath);
03479                     if (stat.isFile()) {
03480                         if (makeUnixPaths) {
03481                             //Make sure we have a JS string.
03482                             if (filePath.indexOf("/") === -1) {
03483                                 filePath = frontSlash(filePath);
03484                             }
03485                         }
03486 
03487                         ok = true;
03488                         if (regExpInclude) {
03489                             ok = filePath.match(regExpInclude);
03490                         }
03491                         if (ok && regExpExclude) {
03492                             ok = !filePath.match(regExpExclude);
03493                         }
03494 
03495                         if (ok && (!file.exclusionRegExp ||
03496                             !file.exclusionRegExp.test(fileName))) {
03497                             files.push(filePath);
03498                         }
03499                     } else if (stat.isDirectory() &&
03500                               (!file.exclusionRegExp || !file.exclusionRegExp.test(fileName))) {
03501                         dirFiles = this.getFilteredFileList(filePath, regExpFilters, makeUnixPaths);
03502                         files.push.apply(files, dirFiles);
03503                     }
03504                 }
03505             }
03506 
03507             return files; //Array
03508         },
03509 
03510         copyDir: function (/*String*/srcDir, /*String*/destDir, /*RegExp?*/regExpFilter, /*boolean?*/onlyCopyNew) {
03511             //summary: copies files from srcDir to destDir using the regExpFilter to determine if the
03512             //file should be copied. Returns a list file name strings of the destinations that were copied.
03513             regExpFilter = regExpFilter || /\w/;
03514 
03515             //Normalize th directory names, but keep front slashes.
03516             //path module on windows now returns backslashed paths.
03517             srcDir = frontSlash(path.normalize(srcDir));
03518             destDir = frontSlash(path.normalize(destDir));
03519 
03520             var fileNames = file.getFilteredFileList(srcDir, regExpFilter, true),
03521             copiedFiles = [], i, srcFileName, destFileName;
03522 
03523             for (i = 0; i < fileNames.length; i++) {
03524                 srcFileName = fileNames[i];
03525                 destFileName = srcFileName.replace(srcDir, destDir);
03526 
03527                 if (file.copyFile(srcFileName, destFileName, onlyCopyNew)) {
03528                     copiedFiles.push(destFileName);
03529                 }
03530             }
03531 
03532             return copiedFiles.length ? copiedFiles : null; //Array or null
03533         },
03534 
03535         copyFile: function (/*String*/srcFileName, /*String*/destFileName, /*boolean?*/onlyCopyNew) {
03536             //summary: copies srcFileName to destFileName. If onlyCopyNew is set, it only copies the file if
03537             //srcFileName is newer than destFileName. Returns a boolean indicating if the copy occurred.
03538             var parentDir;
03539 
03540             //logger.trace("Src filename: " + srcFileName);
03541             //logger.trace("Dest filename: " + destFileName);
03542 
03543             //If onlyCopyNew is true, then compare dates and only copy if the src is newer
03544             //than dest.
03545             if (onlyCopyNew) {
03546                 if (file.exists(destFileName) && fs.statSync(destFileName).mtime.getTime() >= fs.statSync(srcFileName).mtime.getTime()) {
03547                     return false; //Boolean
03548                 }
03549             }
03550 
03551             //Make sure destination dir exists.
03552             parentDir = path.dirname(destFileName);
03553             if (!file.exists(parentDir)) {
03554                 mkFullDir(parentDir);
03555             }
03556 
03557             fs.writeFileSync(destFileName, fs.readFileSync(srcFileName, 'binary'), 'binary');
03558 
03559             return true; //Boolean
03560         },
03561 
03565         renameFile: function (from, to) {
03566             return fs.renameSync(from, to);
03567         },
03568 
03572         readFile: function (/*String*/path, /*String?*/encoding) {
03573             if (encoding === 'utf-8') {
03574                 encoding = 'utf8';
03575             }
03576             if (!encoding) {
03577                 encoding = 'utf8';
03578             }
03579 
03580             var text = fs.readFileSync(path, encoding);
03581 
03582             //Hmm, would not expect to get A BOM, but it seems to happen,
03583             //remove it just in case.
03584             if (text.indexOf('\uFEFF') === 0) {
03585                 text = text.substring(1, text.length);
03586             }
03587 
03588             return text;
03589         },
03590 
03591         readFileAsync: function (path, encoding) {
03592             var d = prim();
03593             try {
03594                 d.resolve(file.readFile(path, encoding));
03595             } catch (e) {
03596                 d.reject(e);
03597             }
03598             return d.promise;
03599         },
03600 
03601         saveUtf8File: function (/*String*/fileName, /*String*/fileContents) {
03602             //summary: saves a *text* file using UTF-8 encoding.
03603             file.saveFile(fileName, fileContents, "utf8");
03604         },
03605 
03606         saveFile: function (/*String*/fileName, /*String*/fileContents, /*String?*/encoding) {
03607             //summary: saves a *text* file.
03608             var parentDir;
03609 
03610             if (encoding === 'utf-8') {
03611                 encoding = 'utf8';
03612             }
03613             if (!encoding) {
03614                 encoding = 'utf8';
03615             }
03616 
03617             //Make sure destination directories exist.
03618             parentDir = path.dirname(fileName);
03619             if (!file.exists(parentDir)) {
03620                 mkFullDir(parentDir);
03621             }
03622 
03623             fs.writeFileSync(fileName, fileContents, encoding);
03624         },
03625 
03626         deleteFile: function (/*String*/fileName) {
03627             //summary: deletes a file or directory if it exists.
03628             var files, i, stat;
03629             if (file.exists(fileName)) {
03630                 stat = fs.statSync(fileName);
03631                 if (stat.isDirectory()) {
03632                     files = fs.readdirSync(fileName);
03633                     for (i = 0; i < files.length; i++) {
03634                         this.deleteFile(path.join(fileName, files[i]));
03635                     }
03636                     fs.rmdirSync(fileName);
03637                 } else {
03638                     fs.unlinkSync(fileName);
03639                 }
03640             }
03641         },
03642 
03643 
03647         deleteEmptyDirs: function (startDir) {
03648             var dirFileArray, i, fileName, filePath, stat;
03649 
03650             if (file.exists(startDir)) {
03651                 dirFileArray = fs.readdirSync(startDir);
03652                 for (i = 0; i < dirFileArray.length; i++) {
03653                     fileName = dirFileArray[i];
03654                     filePath = path.join(startDir, fileName);
03655                     stat = fs.statSync(filePath);
03656                     if (stat.isDirectory()) {
03657                         file.deleteEmptyDirs(filePath);
03658                     }
03659                 }
03660 
03661                 //If directory is now empty, remove it.
03662                 if (fs.readdirSync(startDir).length ===  0) {
03663                     file.deleteFile(startDir);
03664                 }
03665             }
03666         }
03667     };
03668 
03669     return file;
03670 
03671 });
03672 
03673 }
03674 
03675 if(env === 'rhino') {
03681 //Helper functions to deal with file I/O.
03682 
03683 /*jslint plusplus: false */
03684 /*global java: false, define: false */
03685 
03686 define('rhino/file', ['prim'], function (prim) {
03687     var file = {
03688         backSlashRegExp: /\\/g,
03689 
03690         exclusionRegExp: /^\./,
03691 
03692         getLineSeparator: function () {
03693             return file.lineSeparator;
03694         },
03695 
03696         lineSeparator: java.lang.System.getProperty("line.separator"), //Java String
03697 
03698         exists: function (fileName) {
03699             return (new java.io.File(fileName)).exists();
03700         },
03701 
03702         parent: function (fileName) {
03703             return file.absPath((new java.io.File(fileName)).getParentFile());
03704         },
03705 
03706         normalize: function (fileName) {
03707             return file.absPath(fileName);
03708         },
03709 
03710         isFile: function (path) {
03711             return (new java.io.File(path)).isFile();
03712         },
03713 
03714         isDirectory: function (path) {
03715             return (new java.io.File(path)).isDirectory();
03716         },
03717 
03723         absPath: function (fileObj) {
03724             if (typeof fileObj === "string") {
03725                 fileObj = new java.io.File(fileObj);
03726             }
03727             return (fileObj.getCanonicalPath() + "").replace(file.backSlashRegExp, "/");
03728         },
03729 
03730         getFilteredFileList: function (/*String*/startDir, /*RegExp*/regExpFilters, /*boolean?*/makeUnixPaths, /*boolean?*/startDirIsJavaObject) {
03731             //summary: Recurses startDir and finds matches to the files that match regExpFilters.include
03732             //and do not match regExpFilters.exclude. Or just one regexp can be passed in for regExpFilters,
03733             //and it will be treated as the "include" case.
03734             //Ignores files/directories that start with a period (.) unless exclusionRegExp
03735             //is set to another value.
03736             var files = [], topDir, regExpInclude, regExpExclude, dirFileArray,
03737                 i, fileObj, filePath, ok, dirFiles;
03738 
03739             topDir = startDir;
03740             if (!startDirIsJavaObject) {
03741                 topDir = new java.io.File(startDir);
03742             }
03743 
03744             regExpInclude = regExpFilters.include || regExpFilters;
03745             regExpExclude = regExpFilters.exclude || null;
03746 
03747             if (topDir.exists()) {
03748                 dirFileArray = topDir.listFiles();
03749                 for (i = 0; i < dirFileArray.length; i++) {
03750                     fileObj = dirFileArray[i];
03751                     if (fileObj.isFile()) {
03752                         filePath = fileObj.getPath();
03753                         if (makeUnixPaths) {
03754                             //Make sure we have a JS string.
03755                             filePath = String(filePath);
03756                             if (filePath.indexOf("/") === -1) {
03757                                 filePath = filePath.replace(/\\/g, "/");
03758                             }
03759                         }
03760 
03761                         ok = true;
03762                         if (regExpInclude) {
03763                             ok = filePath.match(regExpInclude);
03764                         }
03765                         if (ok && regExpExclude) {
03766                             ok = !filePath.match(regExpExclude);
03767                         }
03768 
03769                         if (ok && (!file.exclusionRegExp ||
03770                             !file.exclusionRegExp.test(fileObj.getName()))) {
03771                             files.push(filePath);
03772                         }
03773                     } else if (fileObj.isDirectory() &&
03774                               (!file.exclusionRegExp || !file.exclusionRegExp.test(fileObj.getName()))) {
03775                         dirFiles = this.getFilteredFileList(fileObj, regExpFilters, makeUnixPaths, true);
03776                         files.push.apply(files, dirFiles);
03777                     }
03778                 }
03779             }
03780 
03781             return files; //Array
03782         },
03783 
03784         copyDir: function (/*String*/srcDir, /*String*/destDir, /*RegExp?*/regExpFilter, /*boolean?*/onlyCopyNew) {
03785             //summary: copies files from srcDir to destDir using the regExpFilter to determine if the
03786             //file should be copied. Returns a list file name strings of the destinations that were copied.
03787             regExpFilter = regExpFilter || /\w/;
03788 
03789             var fileNames = file.getFilteredFileList(srcDir, regExpFilter, true),
03790             copiedFiles = [], i, srcFileName, destFileName;
03791 
03792             for (i = 0; i < fileNames.length; i++) {
03793                 srcFileName = fileNames[i];
03794                 destFileName = srcFileName.replace(srcDir, destDir);
03795 
03796                 if (file.copyFile(srcFileName, destFileName, onlyCopyNew)) {
03797                     copiedFiles.push(destFileName);
03798                 }
03799             }
03800 
03801             return copiedFiles.length ? copiedFiles : null; //Array or null
03802         },
03803 
03804         copyFile: function (/*String*/srcFileName, /*String*/destFileName, /*boolean?*/onlyCopyNew) {
03805             //summary: copies srcFileName to destFileName. If onlyCopyNew is set, it only copies the file if
03806             //srcFileName is newer than destFileName. Returns a boolean indicating if the copy occurred.
03807             var destFile = new java.io.File(destFileName), srcFile, parentDir,
03808             srcChannel, destChannel;
03809 
03810             //logger.trace("Src filename: " + srcFileName);
03811             //logger.trace("Dest filename: " + destFileName);
03812 
03813             //If onlyCopyNew is true, then compare dates and only copy if the src is newer
03814             //than dest.
03815             if (onlyCopyNew) {
03816                 srcFile = new java.io.File(srcFileName);
03817                 if (destFile.exists() && destFile.lastModified() >= srcFile.lastModified()) {
03818                     return false; //Boolean
03819                 }
03820             }
03821 
03822             //Make sure destination dir exists.
03823             parentDir = destFile.getParentFile();
03824             if (!parentDir.exists()) {
03825                 if (!parentDir.mkdirs()) {
03826                     throw "Could not create directory: " + parentDir.getCanonicalPath();
03827                 }
03828             }
03829 
03830             //Java's version of copy file.
03831             srcChannel = new java.io.FileInputStream(srcFileName).getChannel();
03832             destChannel = new java.io.FileOutputStream(destFileName).getChannel();
03833             destChannel.transferFrom(srcChannel, 0, srcChannel.size());
03834             srcChannel.close();
03835             destChannel.close();
03836 
03837             return true; //Boolean
03838         },
03839 
03843         renameFile: function (from, to) {
03844             return (new java.io.File(from)).renameTo((new java.io.File(to)));
03845         },
03846 
03847         readFile: function (/*String*/path, /*String?*/encoding) {
03848             //A file read function that can deal with BOMs
03849             encoding = encoding || "utf-8";
03850             var fileObj = new java.io.File(path),
03851                     input = new java.io.BufferedReader(new java.io.InputStreamReader(new java.io.FileInputStream(fileObj), encoding)),
03852                     stringBuffer, line;
03853             try {
03854                 stringBuffer = new java.lang.StringBuffer();
03855                 line = input.readLine();
03856 
03857                 // Byte Order Mark (BOM) - The Unicode Standard, version 3.0, page 324
03858                 // http://www.unicode.org/faq/utf_bom.html
03859 
03860                 // Note that when we use utf-8, the BOM should appear as "EF BB BF", but it doesn't due to this bug in the JDK:
03861                 // http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=4508058
03862                 if (line && line.length() && line.charAt(0) === 0xfeff) {
03863                     // Eat the BOM, since we've already found the encoding on this file,
03864                     // and we plan to concatenating this buffer with others; the BOM should
03865                     // only appear at the top of a file.
03866                     line = line.substring(1);
03867                 }
03868                 while (line !== null) {
03869                     stringBuffer.append(line);
03870                     stringBuffer.append(file.lineSeparator);
03871                     line = input.readLine();
03872                 }
03873                 //Make sure we return a JavaScript string and not a Java string.
03874                 return String(stringBuffer.toString()); //String
03875             } finally {
03876                 input.close();
03877             }
03878         },
03879 
03880         readFileAsync: function (path, encoding) {
03881             var d = prim();
03882             try {
03883                 d.resolve(file.readFile(path, encoding));
03884             } catch (e) {
03885                 d.reject(e);
03886             }
03887             return d.promise;
03888         },
03889 
03890         saveUtf8File: function (/*String*/fileName, /*String*/fileContents) {
03891             //summary: saves a file using UTF-8 encoding.
03892             file.saveFile(fileName, fileContents, "utf-8");
03893         },
03894 
03895         saveFile: function (/*String*/fileName, /*String*/fileContents, /*String?*/encoding) {
03896             //summary: saves a file.
03897             var outFile = new java.io.File(fileName), outWriter, parentDir, os;
03898 
03899             parentDir = outFile.getAbsoluteFile().getParentFile();
03900             if (!parentDir.exists()) {
03901                 if (!parentDir.mkdirs()) {
03902                     throw "Could not create directory: " + parentDir.getAbsolutePath();
03903                 }
03904             }
03905 
03906             if (encoding) {
03907                 outWriter = new java.io.OutputStreamWriter(new java.io.FileOutputStream(outFile), encoding);
03908             } else {
03909                 outWriter = new java.io.OutputStreamWriter(new java.io.FileOutputStream(outFile));
03910             }
03911 
03912             os = new java.io.BufferedWriter(outWriter);
03913             try {
03914                 os.write(fileContents);
03915             } finally {
03916                 os.close();
03917             }
03918         },
03919 
03920         deleteFile: function (/*String*/fileName) {
03921             //summary: deletes a file or directory if it exists.
03922             var fileObj = new java.io.File(fileName), files, i;
03923             if (fileObj.exists()) {
03924                 if (fileObj.isDirectory()) {
03925                     files = fileObj.listFiles();
03926                     for (i = 0; i < files.length; i++) {
03927                         this.deleteFile(files[i]);
03928                     }
03929                 }
03930                 fileObj["delete"]();
03931             }
03932         },
03933 
03939         deleteEmptyDirs: function (startDir, startDirIsJavaObject) {
03940             var topDir = startDir,
03941                 dirFileArray, i, fileObj;
03942 
03943             if (!startDirIsJavaObject) {
03944                 topDir = new java.io.File(startDir);
03945             }
03946 
03947             if (topDir.exists()) {
03948                 dirFileArray = topDir.listFiles();
03949                 for (i = 0; i < dirFileArray.length; i++) {
03950                     fileObj = dirFileArray[i];
03951                     if (fileObj.isDirectory()) {
03952                         file.deleteEmptyDirs(fileObj, true);
03953                     }
03954                 }
03955 
03956                 //If the directory is empty now, delete it.
03957                 if (topDir.listFiles().length === 0) {
03958                     file.deleteFile(String(topDir.getPath()));
03959                 }
03960             }
03961         }
03962     };
03963 
03964     return file;
03965 });
03966 
03967 }
03968 
03969 if(env === 'xpconnect') {
03975 //Helper functions to deal with file I/O.
03976 
03977 /*jslint plusplus: false */
03978 /*global define, Components, xpcUtil */
03979 
03980 define('xpconnect/file', ['prim'], function (prim) {
03981     var file,
03982         Cc = Components.classes,
03983         Ci = Components.interfaces,
03984         //Depends on xpcUtil which is set up in x.js
03985         xpfile = xpcUtil.xpfile;
03986 
03987     function mkFullDir(dirObj) {
03988         //1 is DIRECTORY_TYPE, 511 is 0777 permissions
03989         if (!dirObj.exists()) {
03990             dirObj.create(1, 511);
03991         }
03992     }
03993 
03994     file = {
03995         backSlashRegExp: /\\/g,
03996 
03997         exclusionRegExp: /^\./,
03998 
03999         getLineSeparator: function () {
04000             return file.lineSeparator;
04001         },
04002 
04003         lineSeparator: ('@mozilla.org/windows-registry-key;1' in Cc) ?
04004                         '\r\n' : '\n',
04005 
04006         exists: function (fileName) {
04007             return xpfile(fileName).exists();
04008         },
04009 
04010         parent: function (fileName) {
04011             return xpfile(fileName).parent;
04012         },
04013 
04014         normalize: function (fileName) {
04015             return file.absPath(fileName);
04016         },
04017 
04018         isFile: function (path) {
04019             return xpfile(path).isFile();
04020         },
04021 
04022         isDirectory: function (path) {
04023             return xpfile(path).isDirectory();
04024         },
04025 
04031         absPath: function (fileObj) {
04032             if (typeof fileObj === "string") {
04033                 fileObj = xpfile(fileObj);
04034             }
04035             return fileObj.path;
04036         },
04037 
04038         getFilteredFileList: function (/*String*/startDir, /*RegExp*/regExpFilters, /*boolean?*/makeUnixPaths, /*boolean?*/startDirIsObject) {
04039             //summary: Recurses startDir and finds matches to the files that match regExpFilters.include
04040             //and do not match regExpFilters.exclude. Or just one regexp can be passed in for regExpFilters,
04041             //and it will be treated as the "include" case.
04042             //Ignores files/directories that start with a period (.) unless exclusionRegExp
04043             //is set to another value.
04044             var files = [], topDir, regExpInclude, regExpExclude, dirFileArray,
04045                 fileObj, filePath, ok, dirFiles;
04046 
04047             topDir = startDir;
04048             if (!startDirIsObject) {
04049                 topDir = xpfile(startDir);
04050             }
04051 
04052             regExpInclude = regExpFilters.include || regExpFilters;
04053             regExpExclude = regExpFilters.exclude || null;
04054 
04055             if (topDir.exists()) {
04056                 dirFileArray = topDir.directoryEntries;
04057                 while (dirFileArray.hasMoreElements()) {
04058                     fileObj = dirFileArray.getNext().QueryInterface(Ci.nsILocalFile);
04059                     if (fileObj.isFile()) {
04060                         filePath = fileObj.path;
04061                         if (makeUnixPaths) {
04062                             if (filePath.indexOf("/") === -1) {
04063                                 filePath = filePath.replace(/\\/g, "/");
04064                             }
04065                         }
04066 
04067                         ok = true;
04068                         if (regExpInclude) {
04069                             ok = filePath.match(regExpInclude);
04070                         }
04071                         if (ok && regExpExclude) {
04072                             ok = !filePath.match(regExpExclude);
04073                         }
04074 
04075                         if (ok && (!file.exclusionRegExp ||
04076                             !file.exclusionRegExp.test(fileObj.leafName))) {
04077                             files.push(filePath);
04078                         }
04079                     } else if (fileObj.isDirectory() &&
04080                               (!file.exclusionRegExp || !file.exclusionRegExp.test(fileObj.leafName))) {
04081                         dirFiles = this.getFilteredFileList(fileObj, regExpFilters, makeUnixPaths, true);
04082                         files.push.apply(files, dirFiles);
04083                     }
04084                 }
04085             }
04086 
04087             return files; //Array
04088         },
04089 
04090         copyDir: function (/*String*/srcDir, /*String*/destDir, /*RegExp?*/regExpFilter, /*boolean?*/onlyCopyNew) {
04091             //summary: copies files from srcDir to destDir using the regExpFilter to determine if the
04092             //file should be copied. Returns a list file name strings of the destinations that were copied.
04093             regExpFilter = regExpFilter || /\w/;
04094 
04095             var fileNames = file.getFilteredFileList(srcDir, regExpFilter, true),
04096             copiedFiles = [], i, srcFileName, destFileName;
04097 
04098             for (i = 0; i < fileNames.length; i += 1) {
04099                 srcFileName = fileNames[i];
04100                 destFileName = srcFileName.replace(srcDir, destDir);
04101 
04102                 if (file.copyFile(srcFileName, destFileName, onlyCopyNew)) {
04103                     copiedFiles.push(destFileName);
04104                 }
04105             }
04106 
04107             return copiedFiles.length ? copiedFiles : null; //Array or null
04108         },
04109 
04110         copyFile: function (/*String*/srcFileName, /*String*/destFileName, /*boolean?*/onlyCopyNew) {
04111             //summary: copies srcFileName to destFileName. If onlyCopyNew is set, it only copies the file if
04112             //srcFileName is newer than destFileName. Returns a boolean indicating if the copy occurred.
04113             var destFile = xpfile(destFileName),
04114             srcFile = xpfile(srcFileName);
04115 
04116             //logger.trace("Src filename: " + srcFileName);
04117             //logger.trace("Dest filename: " + destFileName);
04118 
04119             //If onlyCopyNew is true, then compare dates and only copy if the src is newer
04120             //than dest.
04121             if (onlyCopyNew) {
04122                 if (destFile.exists() && destFile.lastModifiedTime >= srcFile.lastModifiedTime) {
04123                     return false; //Boolean
04124                 }
04125             }
04126 
04127             srcFile.copyTo(destFile.parent, destFile.leafName);
04128 
04129             return true; //Boolean
04130         },
04131 
04135         renameFile: function (from, to) {
04136             var toFile = xpfile(to);
04137             return xpfile(from).moveTo(toFile.parent, toFile.leafName);
04138         },
04139 
04140         readFile: xpcUtil.readFile,
04141 
04142         readFileAsync: function (path, encoding) {
04143             var d = prim();
04144             try {
04145                 d.resolve(file.readFile(path, encoding));
04146             } catch (e) {
04147                 d.reject(e);
04148             }
04149             return d.promise;
04150         },
04151 
04152         saveUtf8File: function (/*String*/fileName, /*String*/fileContents) {
04153             //summary: saves a file using UTF-8 encoding.
04154             file.saveFile(fileName, fileContents, "utf-8");
04155         },
04156 
04157         saveFile: function (/*String*/fileName, /*String*/fileContents, /*String?*/encoding) {
04158             var outStream, convertStream,
04159                 fileObj = xpfile(fileName);
04160 
04161             mkFullDir(fileObj.parent);
04162 
04163             try {
04164                 outStream = Cc['@mozilla.org/network/file-output-stream;1']
04165                              .createInstance(Ci.nsIFileOutputStream);
04166                 //438 is decimal for 0777
04167                 outStream.init(fileObj, 0x02 | 0x08 | 0x20, 511, 0);
04168 
04169                 convertStream = Cc['@mozilla.org/intl/converter-output-stream;1']
04170                                   .createInstance(Ci.nsIConverterOutputStream);
04171 
04172                 convertStream.init(outStream, encoding, 0, 0);
04173                 convertStream.writeString(fileContents);
04174             } catch (e) {
04175                 throw new Error((fileObj && fileObj.path || '') + ': ' + e);
04176             } finally {
04177                 if (convertStream) {
04178                     convertStream.close();
04179                 }
