04180                 if (outStream) {
04181                     outStream.close();
04182                 }
04183             }
04184         },
04185 
04186         deleteFile: function (/*String*/fileName) {
04187             //summary: deletes a file or directory if it exists.
04188             var fileObj = xpfile(fileName);
04189             if (fileObj.exists()) {
04190                 fileObj.remove(true);
04191             }
04192         },
04193 
04199         deleteEmptyDirs: function (startDir, startDirIsObject) {
04200             var topDir = startDir,
04201                 dirFileArray, fileObj;
04202 
04203             if (!startDirIsObject) {
04204                 topDir = xpfile(startDir);
04205             }
04206 
04207             if (topDir.exists()) {
04208                 dirFileArray = topDir.directoryEntries;
04209                 while (dirFileArray.hasMoreElements()) {
04210                     fileObj = dirFileArray.getNext().QueryInterface(Ci.nsILocalFile);
04211 
04212                     if (fileObj.isDirectory()) {
04213                         file.deleteEmptyDirs(fileObj, true);
04214                     }
04215                 }
04216 
04217                 //If the directory is empty now, delete it.
04218                 dirFileArray = topDir.directoryEntries;
04219                 if (!dirFileArray.hasMoreElements()) {
04220                     file.deleteFile(topDir.path);
04221                 }
04222             }
04223         }
04224     };
04225 
04226     return file;
04227 });
04228 
04229 }
04230 
04231 if(env === 'browser') {
04232 /*global process */
04233 define('browser/quit', function () {
04234     'use strict';
04235     return function (code) {
04236     };
04237 });
04238 }
04239 
04240 if(env === 'node') {
04241 /*global process */
04242 define('node/quit', function () {
04243     'use strict';
04244     return function (code) {
04245         var draining = 0;
04246         var exit = function () {
04247             if (draining === 0) {
04248                 process.exit(code);
04249             } else {
04250                 draining -= 1;
04251             }
04252         };
04253         if (process.stdout.bufferSize) {
04254             draining += 1;
04255             process.stdout.once('drain', exit);
04256         }
04257         if (process.stderr.bufferSize) {
04258             draining += 1;
04259             process.stderr.once('drain', exit);
04260         }
04261         exit();
04262     };
04263 });
04264 
04265 }
04266 
04267 if(env === 'rhino') {
04268 /*global quit */
04269 define('rhino/quit', function () {
04270     'use strict';
04271     return function (code) {
04272         return quit(code);
04273     };
04274 });
04275 
04276 }
04277 
04278 if(env === 'xpconnect') {
04279 /*global quit */
04280 define('xpconnect/quit', function () {
04281     'use strict';
04282     return function (code) {
04283         return quit(code);
04284     };
04285 });
04286 
04287 }

04301         console.log(msg);
04302     }
04303 
04304     return print;
04305 });

04329 if(env === 'rhino') {
04336 /*jslint strict: false */

04344 
04345 if(env === 'xpconnect') {
04352 /*jslint strict: false */
04353 /*global define: false, print: false */
04354 
04355 define('xpconnect/print', function () {
04356     return print;
04357 });
04358 
04359 }
04366 /*jslint nomen: false, strict: false */
04367 /*global define: false */
04368 
04369 define('logger', ['env!env/print'], function (print) {
04370     var logger = {
04371         TRACE: 0,
04372         INFO: 1,
04373         WARN: 2,
04374         ERROR: 3,
04375         SILENT: 4,
04376         level: 0,
04377         logPrefix: "",
04378 
04379         logLevel: function( level ) {
04380             this.level = level;
04381         },
04382 
04383         trace: function (message) {
04384             if (this.level <= this.TRACE) {
04385                 this._print(message);
04386             }
04387         },
04388 
04389         info: function (message) {
04390             if (this.level <= this.INFO) {
04391                 this._print(message);
04392             }
04393         },
04394 
04395         warn: function (message) {
04396             if (this.level <= this.WARN) {
04397                 this._print(message);
04398             }
04399         },
04400 
04401         error: function (message) {
04402             if (this.level <= this.ERROR) {
04403                 this._print(message);
04404             }
04405         },
04406 
04407         _print: function (message) {
04408             this._sysPrint((this.logPrefix ? (this.logPrefix + " ") : "") + message);
04409         },
04410 
04411         _sysPrint: function (message) {
04412             print(message);
04413         }
04414     };
04415 
04416     return logger;
04417 });
04418 //Just a blank file to use when building the optimizer with the optimizer,
04419 //so that the build does not attempt to inline some env modules,
04420 //like Node's fs and path.
04421

04425   Copyright (C) 2012 Joost-Wim Boekesteijn <joost-wim@boekesteijn.nl>
04426   Copyright (C) 2012 Kris Kowal <kris.kowal@cixar.com>
04427   Copyright (C) 2012 Yusuke Suzuki <utatane.tea@gmail.com>
04428   Copyright (C) 2012 Arpad Borsos <arpad.borsos@googlemail.com>
04429   Copyright (C) 2011 Ariya Hidayat <ariya.hidayat@gmail.com>
04430 
04431   Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without
04432   modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:

04435       notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer.

04437       notice, this list of conditions and the following disclaimer in the

04443   ARE DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL <COPYRIGHT HOLDER> BE LIABLE FOR ANY
04444   DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES
04445   (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES;

04451 
04452 /*jslint bitwise:true plusplus:true */
04453 /*global esprima:true, define:true, exports:true, window: true,
04454 throwError: true, createLiteral: true, generateStatement: true,
04455 parseAssignmentExpression: true, parseBlock: true, parseExpression: true,
04456 parseFunctionDeclaration: true, parseFunctionExpression: true,
04457 parseFunctionSourceElements: true, parseVariableIdentifier: true,
04458 parseLeftHandSideExpression: true,
04459 parseStatement: true, parseSourceElement: true */
04460 
04461 (function (root, factory) {
04462     'use strict';
04463 
04464     // Universal Module Definition (UMD) to support AMD, CommonJS/Node.js,
04465     // Rhino, and plain browser loading.
04466     if (typeof define === 'function' && define.amd) {
04467         define('esprima', ['exports'], factory);
04468     } else if (typeof exports !== 'undefined') {
04469         factory(exports);
04470     } else {
04471         factory((root.esprima = {}));
04472     }
04473 }(this, function (exports) {
04474     'use strict';
04475 
04476     var Token,
04477         TokenName,
04478         Syntax,
04479         PropertyKind,
04480         Messages,
04481         Regex,
04482         source,
04483         strict,
04484         index,
04485         lineNumber,
04486         lineStart,
04487         length,
04488         buffer,
04489         state,
04490         extra;
04491 
04492     Token = {
04493         BooleanLiteral: 1,
04494         EOF: 2,
04495         Identifier: 3,
04496         Keyword: 4,
04497         NullLiteral: 5,
04498         NumericLiteral: 6,
04499         Punctuator: 7,
04500         StringLiteral: 8
04501     };
04502 
04503     TokenName = {};
04504     TokenName[Token.BooleanLiteral] = 'Boolean';
04505     TokenName[Token.EOF] = '<end>';
04506     TokenName[Token.Identifier] = 'Identifier';
04507     TokenName[Token.Keyword] = 'Keyword';
04508     TokenName[Token.NullLiteral] = 'Null';
04509     TokenName[Token.NumericLiteral] = 'Numeric';
04510     TokenName[Token.Punctuator] = 'Punctuator';
04511     TokenName[Token.StringLiteral] = 'String';
04512 
04513     Syntax = {
04514         AssignmentExpression: 'AssignmentExpression',
04515         ArrayExpression: 'ArrayExpression',
04516         BlockStatement: 'BlockStatement',
04517         BinaryExpression: 'BinaryExpression',
04518         BreakStatement: 'BreakStatement',
04519         CallExpression: 'CallExpression',
04520         CatchClause: 'CatchClause',
04521         ConditionalExpression: 'ConditionalExpression',
04522         ContinueStatement: 'ContinueStatement',
04523         DoWhileStatement: 'DoWhileStatement',
04524         DebuggerStatement: 'DebuggerStatement',
04525         EmptyStatement: 'EmptyStatement',
04526         ExpressionStatement: 'ExpressionStatement',
04527         ForStatement: 'ForStatement',
04528         ForInStatement: 'ForInStatement',
04529         FunctionDeclaration: 'FunctionDeclaration',
04530         FunctionExpression: 'FunctionExpression',
04531         Identifier: 'Identifier',
04532         IfStatement: 'IfStatement',
04533         Literal: 'Literal',
04534         LabeledStatement: 'LabeledStatement',
04535         LogicalExpression: 'LogicalExpression',
04536         MemberExpression: 'MemberExpression',
04537         NewExpression: 'NewExpression',
04538         ObjectExpression: 'ObjectExpression',
04539         Program: 'Program',
04540         Property: 'Property',
04541         ReturnStatement: 'ReturnStatement',
04542         SequenceExpression: 'SequenceExpression',
04543         SwitchStatement: 'SwitchStatement',
04544         SwitchCase: 'SwitchCase',
04545         ThisExpression: 'ThisExpression',
04546         ThrowStatement: 'ThrowStatement',
04547         TryStatement: 'TryStatement',
04548         UnaryExpression: 'UnaryExpression',
04549         UpdateExpression: 'UpdateExpression',
04550         VariableDeclaration: 'VariableDeclaration',
04551         VariableDeclarator: 'VariableDeclarator',
04552         WhileStatement: 'WhileStatement',
04553         WithStatement: 'WithStatement'
04554     };
04555 
04556     PropertyKind = {
04557         Data: 1,
04558         Get: 2,
04559         Set: 4
04560     };
04561 
04562     // Error messages should be identical to V8.
04563     Messages = {
04564         UnexpectedToken:  'Unexpected token %0',
04565         UnexpectedNumber:  'Unexpected number',
04566         UnexpectedString:  'Unexpected string',
04567         UnexpectedIdentifier:  'Unexpected identifier',
04568         UnexpectedReserved:  'Unexpected reserved word',
04569         UnexpectedEOS:  'Unexpected end of input',
04570         NewlineAfterThrow:  'Illegal newline after throw',
04571         InvalidRegExp: 'Invalid regular expression',
04572         UnterminatedRegExp:  'Invalid regular expression: missing /',
04573         InvalidLHSInAssignment:  'Invalid left-hand side in assignment',
04574         InvalidLHSInForIn:  'Invalid left-hand side in for-in',
04575         MultipleDefaultsInSwitch: 'More than one default clause in switch statement',
04576         NoCatchOrFinally:  'Missing catch or finally after try',
04577         UnknownLabel: 'Undefined label \'%0\'',
04578         Redeclaration: '%0 \'%1\' has already been declared',
04579         IllegalContinue: 'Illegal continue statement',
04580         IllegalBreak: 'Illegal break statement',
04581         IllegalReturn: 'Illegal return statement',
04582         StrictModeWith:  'Strict mode code may not include a with statement',
04583         StrictCatchVariable:  'Catch variable may not be eval or arguments in strict mode',
04584         StrictVarName:  'Variable name may not be eval or arguments in strict mode',
04585         StrictParamName:  'Parameter name eval or arguments is not allowed in strict mode',
04586         StrictParamDupe: 'Strict mode function may not have duplicate parameter names',
04587         StrictFunctionName:  'Function name may not be eval or arguments in strict mode',
04588         StrictOctalLiteral:  'Octal literals are not allowed in strict mode.',
04589         StrictDelete:  'Delete of an unqualified identifier in strict mode.',
04590         StrictDuplicateProperty:  'Duplicate data property in object literal not allowed in strict mode',
04591         AccessorDataProperty:  'Object literal may not have data and accessor property with the same name',
04592         AccessorGetSet:  'Object literal may not have multiple get/set accessors with the same name',
04593         StrictLHSAssignment:  'Assignment to eval or arguments is not allowed in strict mode',
04594         StrictLHSPostfix:  'Postfix increment/decrement may not have eval or arguments operand in strict mode',
04595         StrictLHSPrefix:  'Prefix increment/decrement may not have eval or arguments operand in strict mode',
04596         StrictReservedWord:  'Use of future reserved word in strict mode'
04597     };
04598 
04599     // See also tools/generate-unicode-regex.py.
04600     Regex = {
04601         NonAsciiIdentifierStart: new RegExp('[\xaa\xb5\xba\xc0-\xd6\xd8-\xf6\xf8-\u02c1\u02c6-\u02d1\u02e0-\u02e4\u02ec\u02ee\u0370-\u0374\u0376\u0377\u037a-\u037d\u0386\u0388-\u038a\u038c\u038e-\u03a1\u03a3-\u03f5\u03f7-\u0481\u048a-\u0527\u0531-\u0556\u0559\u0561-\u0587\u05d0-\u05ea\u05f0-\u05f2\u0620-\u064a\u066e\u066f\u0671-\u06d3\u06d5\u06e5\u06e6\u06ee\u06ef\u06fa-\u06fc\u06ff\u0710\u0712-\u072f\u074d-\u07a5\u07b1\u07ca-\u07ea\u07f4\u07f5\u07fa\u0800-\u0815\u081a\u0824\u0828\u0840-\u0858\u08a0\u08a2-\u08ac\u0904-\u0939\u093d\u0950\u0958-\u0961\u0971-\u0977\u0979-\u097f\u0985-\u098c\u098f\u0990\u0993-\u09a8\u09aa-\u09b0\u09b2\u09b6-\u09b9\u09bd\u09ce\u09dc\u09dd\u09df-\u09e1\u09f0\u09f1\u0a05-\u0a0a\u0a0f\u0a10\u0a13-\u0a28\u0a2a-\u0a30\u0a32\u0a33\u0a35\u0a36\u0a38\u0a39\u0a59-\u0a5c\u0a5e\u0a72-\u0a74\u0a85-\u0a8d\u0a8f-\u0a91\u0a93-\u0aa8\u0aaa-\u0ab0\u0ab2\u0ab3\u0ab5-\u0ab9\u0abd\u0ad0\u0ae0\u0ae1\u0b05-\u0b0c\u0b0f\u0b10\u0b13-\u0b28\u0b2a-\u0b30\u0b32\u0b33\u0b35-\u0b39\u0b3d\u0b5c\u0b5d\u0b5f-\u0b61\u0b71\u0b83\u0b85-\u0b8a\u0b8e-\u0b90\u0b92-\u0b95\u0b99\u0b9a\u0b9c\u0b9e\u0b9f\u0ba3\u0ba4\u0ba8-\u0baa\u0bae-\u0bb9\u0bd0\u0c05-\u0c0c\u0c0e-\u0c10\u0c12-\u0c28\u0c2a-\u0c33\u0c35-\u0c39\u0c3d\u0c58\u0c59\u0c60\u0c61\u0c85-\u0c8c\u0c8e-\u0c90\u0c92-\u0ca8\u0caa-\u0cb3\u0cb5-\u0cb9\u0cbd\u0cde\u0ce0\u0ce1\u0cf1\u0cf2\u0d05-\u0d0c\u0d0e-\u0d10\u0d12-\u0d3a\u0d3d\u0d4e\u0d60\u0d61\u0d7a-\u0d7f\u0d85-\u0d96\u0d9a-\u0db1\u0db3-\u0dbb\u0dbd\u0dc0-\u0dc6\u0e01-\u0e30\u0e32\u0e33\u0e40-\u0e46\u0e81\u0e82\u0e84\u0e87\u0e88\u0e8a\u0e8d\u0e94-\u0e97\u0e99-\u0e9f\u0ea1-\u0ea3\u0ea5\u0ea7\u0eaa\u0eab\u0ead-\u0eb0\u0eb2\u0eb3\u0ebd\u0ec0-\u0ec4\u0ec6\u0edc-\u0edf\u0f00\u0f40-\u0f47\u0f49-\u0f6c\u0f88-\u0f8c\u1000-\u102a\u103f\u1050-\u1055\u105a-\u105d\u1061\u1065\u1066\u106e-\u1070\u1075-\u1081\u108e\u10a0-\u10c5\u10c7\u10cd\u10d0-\u10fa\u10fc-\u1248\u124a-\u124d\u1250-\u1256\u1258\u125a-\u125d\u1260-\u1288\u128a-\u128d\u1290-\u12b0\u12b2-\u12b5\u12b8-\u12be\u12c0\u12c2-\u12c5\u12c8-\u12d6\u12d8-\u1310\u1312-\u1315\u1318-\u135a\u1380-\u138f\u13a0-\u13f4\u1401-\u166c\u166f-\u167f\u1681-\u169a\u16a0-\u16ea\u16ee-\u16f0\u1700-\u170c\u170e-\u1711\u1720-\u1731\u1740-\u1751\u1760-\u176c\u176e-\u1770\u1780-\u17b3\u17d7\u17dc\u1820-\u1877\u1880-\u18a8\u18aa\u18b0-\u18f5\u1900-\u191c\u1950-\u196d\u1970-\u1974\u1980-\u19ab\u19c1-\u19c7\u1a00-\u1a16\u1a20-\u1a54\u1aa7\u1b05-\u1b33\u1b45-\u1b4b\u1b83-\u1ba0\u1bae\u1baf\u1bba-\u1be5\u1c00-\u1c23\u1c4d-\u1c4f\u1c5a-\u1c7d\u1ce9-\u1cec\u1cee-\u1cf1\u1cf5\u1cf6\u1d00-\u1dbf\u1e00-\u1f15\u1f18-\u1f1d\u1f20-\u1f45\u1f48-\u1f4d\u1f50-\u1f57\u1f59\u1f5b\u1f5d\u1f5f-\u1f7d\u1f80-\u1fb4\u1fb6-\u1fbc\u1fbe\u1fc2-\u1fc4\u1fc6-\u1fcc\u1fd0-\u1fd3\u1fd6-\u1fdb\u1fe0-\u1fec\u1ff2-\u1ff4\u1ff6-\u1ffc\u2071\u207f\u2090-\u209c\u2102\u2107\u210a-\u2113\u2115\u2119-\u211d\u2124\u2126\u2128\u212a-\u212d\u212f-\u2139\u213c-\u213f\u2145-\u2149\u214e\u2160-\u2188\u2c00-\u2c2e\u2c30-\u2c5e\u2c60-\u2ce4\u2ceb-\u2cee\u2cf2\u2cf3\u2d00-\u2d25\u2d27\u2d2d\u2d30-\u2d67\u2d6f\u2d80-\u2d96\u2da0-\u2da6\u2da8-\u2dae\u2db0-\u2db6\u2db8-\u2dbe\u2dc0-\u2dc6\u2dc8-\u2dce\u2dd0-\u2dd6\u2dd8-\u2dde\u2e2f\u3005-\u3007\u3021-\u3029\u3031-\u3035\u3038-\u303c\u3041-\u3096\u309d-\u309f\u30a1-\u30fa\u30fc-\u30ff\u3105-\u312d\u3131-\u318e\u31a0-\u31ba\u31f0-\u31ff\u3400-\u4db5\u4e00-\u9fcc\ua000-\ua48c\ua4d0-\ua4fd\ua500-\ua60c\ua610-\ua61f\ua62a\ua62b\ua640-\ua66e\ua67f-\ua697\ua6a0-\ua6ef\ua717-\ua71f\ua722-\ua788\ua78b-\ua78e\ua790-\ua793\ua7a0-\ua7aa\ua7f8-\ua801\ua803-\ua805\ua807-\ua80a\ua80c-\ua822\ua840-\ua873\ua882-\ua8b3\ua8f2-\ua8f7\ua8fb\ua90a-\ua925\ua930-\ua946\ua960-\ua97c\ua984-\ua9b2\ua9cf\uaa00-\uaa28\uaa40-\uaa42\uaa44-\uaa4b\uaa60-\uaa76\uaa7a\uaa80-\uaaaf\uaab1\uaab5\uaab6\uaab9-\uaabd\uaac0\uaac2\uaadb-\uaadd\uaae0-\uaaea\uaaf2-\uaaf4\uab01-\uab06\uab09-\uab0e\uab11-\uab16\uab20-\uab26\uab28-\uab2e\uabc0-\uabe2\uac00-\ud7a3\ud7b0-\ud7c6\ud7cb-\ud7fb\uf900-\ufa6d\ufa70-\ufad9\ufb00-\ufb06\ufb13-\ufb17\ufb1d\ufb1f-\ufb28\ufb2a-\ufb36\ufb38-\ufb3c\ufb3e\ufb40\ufb41\ufb43\ufb44\ufb46-\ufbb1\ufbd3-\ufd3d\ufd50-\ufd8f\ufd92-\ufdc7\ufdf0-\ufdfb\ufe70-\ufe74\ufe76-\ufefc\uff21-\uff3a\uff41-\uff5a\uff66-\uffbe\uffc2-\uffc7\uffca-\uffcf\uffd2-\uffd7\uffda-\uffdc]'),
04602         NonAsciiIdentifierPart: new RegExp('[\xaa\xb5\xba\xc0-\xd6\xd8-\xf6\xf8-\u02c1\u02c6-\u02d1\u02e0-\u02e4\u02ec\u02ee\u0300-\u0374\u0376\u0377\u037a-\u037d\u0386\u0388-\u038a\u038c\u038e-\u03a1\u03a3-\u03f5\u03f7-\u0481\u0483-\u0487\u048a-\u0527\u0531-\u0556\u0559\u0561-\u0587\u0591-\u05bd\u05bf\u05c1\u05c2\u05c4\u05c5\u05c7\u05d0-\u05ea\u05f0-\u05f2\u0610-\u061a\u0620-\u0669\u066e-\u06d3\u06d5-\u06dc\u06df-\u06e8\u06ea-\u06fc\u06ff\u0710-\u074a\u074d-\u07b1\u07c0-\u07f5\u07fa\u0800-\u082d\u0840-\u085b\u08a0\u08a2-\u08ac\u08e4-\u08fe\u0900-\u0963\u0966-\u096f\u0971-\u0977\u0979-\u097f\u0981-\u0983\u0985-\u098c\u098f\u0990\u0993-\u09a8\u09aa-\u09b0\u09b2\u09b6-\u09b9\u09bc-\u09c4\u09c7\u09c8\u09cb-\u09ce\u09d7\u09dc\u09dd\u09df-\u09e3\u09e6-\u09f1\u0a01-\u0a03\u0a05-\u0a0a\u0a0f\u0a10\u0a13-\u0a28\u0a2a-\u0a30\u0a32\u0a33\u0a35\u0a36\u0a38\u0a39\u0a3c\u0a3e-\u0a42\u0a47\u0a48\u0a4b-\u0a4d\u0a51\u0a59-\u0a5c\u0a5e\u0a66-\u0a75\u0a81-\u0a83\u0a85-\u0a8d\u0a8f-\u0a91\u0a93-\u0aa8\u0aaa-\u0ab0\u0ab2\u0ab3\u0ab5-\u0ab9\u0abc-\u0ac5\u0ac7-\u0ac9\u0acb-\u0acd\u0ad0\u0ae0-\u0ae3\u0ae6-\u0aef\u0b01-\u0b03\u0b05-\u0b0c\u0b0f\u0b10\u0b13-\u0b28\u0b2a-\u0b30\u0b32\u0b33\u0b35-\u0b39\u0b3c-\u0b44\u0b47\u0b48\u0b4b-\u0b4d\u0b56\u0b57\u0b5c\u0b5d\u0b5f-\u0b63\u0b66-\u0b6f\u0b71\u0b82\u0b83\u0b85-\u0b8a\u0b8e-\u0b90\u0b92-\u0b95\u0b99\u0b9a\u0b9c\u0b9e\u0b9f\u0ba3\u0ba4\u0ba8-\u0baa\u0bae-\u0bb9\u0bbe-\u0bc2\u0bc6-\u0bc8\u0bca-\u0bcd\u0bd0\u0bd7\u0be6-\u0bef\u0c01-\u0c03\u0c05-\u0c0c\u0c0e-\u0c10\u0c12-\u0c28\u0c2a-\u0c33\u0c35-\u0c39\u0c3d-\u0c44\u0c46-\u0c48\u0c4a-\u0c4d\u0c55\u0c56\u0c58\u0c59\u0c60-\u0c63\u0c66-\u0c6f\u0c82\u0c83\u0c85-\u0c8c\u0c8e-\u0c90\u0c92-\u0ca8\u0caa-\u0cb3\u0cb5-\u0cb9\u0cbc-\u0cc4\u0cc6-\u0cc8\u0cca-\u0ccd\u0cd5\u0cd6\u0cde\u0ce0-\u0ce3\u0ce6-\u0cef\u0cf1\u0cf2\u0d02\u0d03\u0d05-\u0d0c\u0d0e-\u0d10\u0d12-\u0d3a\u0d3d-\u0d44\u0d46-\u0d48\u0d4a-\u0d4e\u0d57\u0d60-\u0d63\u0d66-\u0d6f\u0d7a-\u0d7f\u0d82\u0d83\u0d85-\u0d96\u0d9a-\u0db1\u0db3-\u0dbb\u0dbd\u0dc0-\u0dc6\u0dca\u0dcf-\u0dd4\u0dd6\u0dd8-\u0ddf\u0df2\u0df3\u0e01-\u0e3a\u0e40-\u0e4e\u0e50-\u0e59\u0e81\u0e82\u0e84\u0e87\u0e88\u0e8a\u0e8d\u0e94-\u0e97\u0e99-\u0e9f\u0ea1-\u0ea3\u0ea5\u0ea7\u0eaa\u0eab\u0ead-\u0eb9\u0ebb-\u0ebd\u0ec0-\u0ec4\u0ec6\u0ec8-\u0ecd\u0ed0-\u0ed9\u0edc-\u0edf\u0f00\u0f18\u0f19\u0f20-\u0f29\u0f35\u0f37\u0f39\u0f3e-\u0f47\u0f49-\u0f6c\u0f71-\u0f84\u0f86-\u0f97\u0f99-\u0fbc\u0fc6\u1000-\u1049\u1050-\u109d\u10a0-\u10c5\u10c7\u10cd\u10d0-\u10fa\u10fc-\u1248\u124a-\u124d\u1250-\u1256\u1258\u125a-\u125d\u1260-\u1288\u128a-\u128d\u1290-\u12b0\u12b2-\u12b5\u12b8-\u12be\u12c0\u12c2-\u12c5\u12c8-\u12d6\u12d8-\u1310\u1312-\u1315\u1318-\u135a\u135d-\u135f\u1380-\u138f\u13a0-\u13f4\u1401-\u166c\u166f-\u167f\u1681-\u169a\u16a0-\u16ea\u16ee-\u16f0\u1700-\u170c\u170e-\u1714\u1720-\u1734\u1740-\u1753\u1760-\u176c\u176e-\u1770\u1772\u1773\u1780-\u17d3\u17d7\u17dc\u17dd\u17e0-\u17e9\u180b-\u180d\u1810-\u1819\u1820-\u1877\u1880-\u18aa\u18b0-\u18f5\u1900-\u191c\u1920-\u192b\u1930-\u193b\u1946-\u196d\u1970-\u1974\u1980-\u19ab\u19b0-\u19c9\u19d0-\u19d9\u1a00-\u1a1b\u1a20-\u1a5e\u1a60-\u1a7c\u1a7f-\u1a89\u1a90-\u1a99\u1aa7\u1b00-\u1b4b\u1b50-\u1b59\u1b6b-\u1b73\u1b80-\u1bf3\u1c00-\u1c37\u1c40-\u1c49\u1c4d-\u1c7d\u1cd0-\u1cd2\u1cd4-\u1cf6\u1d00-\u1de6\u1dfc-\u1f15\u1f18-\u1f1d\u1f20-\u1f45\u1f48-\u1f4d\u1f50-\u1f57\u1f59\u1f5b\u1f5d\u1f5f-\u1f7d\u1f80-\u1fb4\u1fb6-\u1fbc\u1fbe\u1fc2-\u1fc4\u1fc6-\u1fcc\u1fd0-\u1fd3\u1fd6-\u1fdb\u1fe0-\u1fec\u1ff2-\u1ff4\u1ff6-\u1ffc\u200c\u200d\u203f\u2040\u2054\u2071\u207f\u2090-\u209c\u20d0-\u20dc\u20e1\u20e5-\u20f0\u2102\u2107\u210a-\u2113\u2115\u2119-\u211d\u2124\u2126\u2128\u212a-\u212d\u212f-\u2139\u213c-\u213f\u2145-\u2149\u214e\u2160-\u2188\u2c00-\u2c2e\u2c30-\u2c5e\u2c60-\u2ce4\u2ceb-\u2cf3\u2d00-\u2d25\u2d27\u2d2d\u2d30-\u2d67\u2d6f\u2d7f-\u2d96\u2da0-\u2da6\u2da8-\u2dae\u2db0-\u2db6\u2db8-\u2dbe\u2dc0-\u2dc6\u2dc8-\u2dce\u2dd0-\u2dd6\u2dd8-\u2dde\u2de0-\u2dff\u2e2f\u3005-\u3007\u3021-\u302f\u3031-\u3035\u3038-\u303c\u3041-\u3096\u3099\u309a\u309d-\u309f\u30a1-\u30fa\u30fc-\u30ff\u3105-\u312d\u3131-\u318e\u31a0-\u31ba\u31f0-\u31ff\u3400-\u4db5\u4e00-\u9fcc\ua000-\ua48c\ua4d0-\ua4fd\ua500-\ua60c\ua610-\ua62b\ua640-\ua66f\ua674-\ua67d\ua67f-\ua697\ua69f-\ua6f1\ua717-\ua71f\ua722-\ua788\ua78b-\ua78e\ua790-\ua793\ua7a0-\ua7aa\ua7f8-\ua827\ua840-\ua873\ua880-\ua8c4\ua8d0-\ua8d9\ua8e0-\ua8f7\ua8fb\ua900-\ua92d\ua930-\ua953\ua960-\ua97c\ua980-\ua9c0\ua9cf-\ua9d9\uaa00-\uaa36\uaa40-\uaa4d\uaa50-\uaa59\uaa60-\uaa76\uaa7a\uaa7b\uaa80-\uaac2\uaadb-\uaadd\uaae0-\uaaef\uaaf2-\uaaf6\uab01-\uab06\uab09-\uab0e\uab11-\uab16\uab20-\uab26\uab28-\uab2e\uabc0-\uabea\uabec\uabed\uabf0-\uabf9\uac00-\ud7a3\ud7b0-\ud7c6\ud7cb-\ud7fb\uf900-\ufa6d\ufa70-\ufad9\ufb00-\ufb06\ufb13-\ufb17\ufb1d-\ufb28\ufb2a-\ufb36\ufb38-\ufb3c\ufb3e\ufb40\ufb41\ufb43\ufb44\ufb46-\ufbb1\ufbd3-\ufd3d\ufd50-\ufd8f\ufd92-\ufdc7\ufdf0-\ufdfb\ufe00-\ufe0f\ufe20-\ufe26\ufe33\ufe34\ufe4d-\ufe4f\ufe70-\ufe74\ufe76-\ufefc\uff10-\uff19\uff21-\uff3a\uff3f\uff41-\uff5a\uff66-\uffbe\uffc2-\uffc7\uffca-\uffcf\uffd2-\uffd7\uffda-\uffdc]')
04603     };
04604 
04605     // Ensure the condition is true, otherwise throw an error.
04606     // This is only to have a better contract semantic, i.e. another safety net
04607     // to catch a logic error. The condition shall be fulfilled in normal case.
04608     // Do NOT use this to enforce a certain condition on any user input.
04609 
04610     function assert(condition, message) {
04611         if (!condition) {
04612             throw new Error('ASSERT: ' + message);
04613         }
04614     }
04615 
04616     function sliceSource(from, to) {
04617         return source.slice(from, to);
04618     }
04619 
04620     if (typeof 'esprima'[0] === 'undefined') {
04621         sliceSource = function sliceArraySource(from, to) {
04622             return source.slice(from, to).join('');
04623         };
04624     }
04625 
04626     function isDecimalDigit(ch) {
04627         return '0123456789'.indexOf(ch) >= 0;
04628     }
04629 
04630     function isHexDigit(ch) {
04631         return '0123456789abcdefABCDEF'.indexOf(ch) >= 0;
04632     }
04633 
04634     function isOctalDigit(ch) {
04635         return '01234567'.indexOf(ch) >= 0;
04636     }
04637 
04638 
04639     // 7.2 White Space
04640 
04641     function isWhiteSpace(ch) {
04642         return (ch === ' ') || (ch === '\u0009') || (ch === '\u000B') ||
04643             (ch === '\u000C') || (ch === '\u00A0') ||
04644             (ch.charCodeAt(0) >= 0x1680 &&
04645              '\u1680\u180E\u2000\u2001\u2002\u2003\u2004\u2005\u2006\u2007\u2008\u2009\u200A\u202F\u205F\u3000\uFEFF'.indexOf(ch) >= 0);
04646     }
04647 
04648     // 7.3 Line Terminators
04649 
04650     function isLineTerminator(ch) {
04651         return (ch === '\n' || ch === '\r' || ch === '\u2028' || ch === '\u2029');
04652     }
04653 
04654     // 7.6 Identifier Names and Identifiers
04655 
04656     function isIdentifierStart(ch) {
04657         return (ch === '$') || (ch === '_') || (ch === '\\') ||
04658             (ch >= 'a' && ch <= 'z') || (ch >= 'A' && ch <= 'Z') ||
04659             ((ch.charCodeAt(0) >= 0x80) && Regex.NonAsciiIdentifierStart.test(ch));
04660     }
04661 
04662     function isIdentifierPart(ch) {
04663         return (ch === '$') || (ch === '_') || (ch === '\\') ||
04664             (ch >= 'a' && ch <= 'z') || (ch >= 'A' && ch <= 'Z') ||
04665             ((ch >= '0') && (ch <= '9')) ||
04666             ((ch.charCodeAt(0) >= 0x80) && Regex.NonAsciiIdentifierPart.test(ch));
04667     }
04668 
04669     // 7.6.1.2 Future Reserved Words
04670 
04671     function isFutureReservedWord(id) {
04672         switch (id) {
04673 
04674         // Future reserved words.
04675         case 'class':
04676         case 'enum':
04677         case 'export':
04678         case 'extends':
04679         case 'import':
04680         case 'super':
04681             return true;
04682         }
04683 
04684         return false;
04685     }
04686 
04687     function isStrictModeReservedWord(id) {
04688         switch (id) {
04689 
04690         // Strict Mode reserved words.
04691         case 'implements':
04692         case 'interface':
04693         case 'package':
04694         case 'private':
04695         case 'protected':
04696         case 'public':
04697         case 'static':
04698         case 'yield':
04699         case 'let':
04700             return true;
04701         }
04702 
04703         return false;
04704     }
04705 
04706     function isRestrictedWord(id) {
04707         return id === 'eval' || id === 'arguments';
04708     }
04709 
04710     // 7.6.1.1 Keywords
04711 
04712     function isKeyword(id) {
04713         var keyword = false;
04714         switch (id.length) {
04715         case 2:
04716             keyword = (id === 'if') || (id === 'in') || (id === 'do');
04717             break;
04718         case 3:
04719             keyword = (id === 'var') || (id === 'for') || (id === 'new') || (id === 'try');
04720             break;
04721         case 4:
04722             keyword = (id === 'this') || (id === 'else') || (id === 'case') || (id === 'void') || (id === 'with');
04723             break;
04724         case 5:
04725             keyword = (id === 'while') || (id === 'break') || (id === 'catch') || (id === 'throw');
04726             break;
04727         case 6:
04728             keyword = (id === 'return') || (id === 'typeof') || (id === 'delete') || (id === 'switch');
04729             break;
04730         case 7:
04731             keyword = (id === 'default') || (id === 'finally');
04732             break;
04733         case 8:
04734             keyword = (id === 'function') || (id === 'continue') || (id === 'debugger');
04735             break;
04736         case 10:
04737             keyword = (id === 'instanceof');
04738             break;
04739         }
04740 
04741         if (keyword) {
04742             return true;
04743         }
04744 
04745         switch (id) {
04746         // Future reserved words.
04747         // 'const' is specialized as Keyword in V8.
04748         case 'const':
04749             return true;
04750 
04751         // For compatiblity to SpiderMonkey and ES.next
04752         case 'yield':
04753         case 'let':
04754             return true;
04755         }
04756 
04757         if (strict && isStrictModeReservedWord(id)) {
04758             return true;
04759         }
04760 
04761         return isFutureReservedWord(id);
04762     }
04763 
04764     // 7.4 Comments
04765 
04766     function skipComment() {
04767         var ch, blockComment, lineComment;
04768 
04769         blockComment = false;
04770         lineComment = false;
04771 
04772         while (index < length) {
04773             ch = source[index];
04774 
04775             if (lineComment) {
04776                 ch = source[index++];
04777                 if (isLineTerminator(ch)) {
04778                     lineComment = false;
04779                     if (ch === '\r' && source[index] === '\n') {
04780                         ++index;
04781                     }
04782                     ++lineNumber;
04783                     lineStart = index;
04784                 }
04785             } else if (blockComment) {
04786                 if (isLineTerminator(ch)) {
04787                     if (ch === '\r' && source[index + 1] === '\n') {
04788                         ++index;
04789                     }
04790                     ++lineNumber;
04791                     ++index;
04792                     lineStart = index;
04793                     if (index >= length) {
04794                         throwError({}, Messages.UnexpectedToken, 'ILLEGAL');
04795                     }
04796                 } else {
04797                     ch = source[index++];
04798                     if (index >= length) {
04799                         throwError({}, Messages.UnexpectedToken, 'ILLEGAL');
04800                     }
04801                     if (ch === '*') {
04802                         ch = source[index];
04803                         if (ch === '/') {
04804                             ++index;
04805                             blockComment = false;
04806                         }
04807                     }
04808                 }
04809             } else if (ch === '/') {
04810                 ch = source[index + 1];
04811                 if (ch === '/') {
04812                     index += 2;
04813                     lineComment = true;
04814                 } else if (ch === '*') {
04815                     index += 2;
04816                     blockComment = true;
04817                     if (index >= length) {
04818                         throwError({}, Messages.UnexpectedToken, 'ILLEGAL');
04819                     }
04820                 } else {
04821                     break;
04822                 }
04823             } else if (isWhiteSpace(ch)) {
04824                 ++index;
04825             } else if (isLineTerminator(ch)) {
04826                 ++index;
04827                 if (ch ===  '\r' && source[index] === '\n') {
04828                     ++index;
04829                 }
04830                 ++lineNumber;
04831                 lineStart = index;
04832             } else {
04833                 break;
04834             }
04835         }
04836     }
04837 
04838     function scanHexEscape(prefix) {
04839         var i, len, ch, code = 0;
04840 
04841         len = (prefix === 'u') ? 4 : 2;
04842         for (i = 0; i < len; ++i) {
04843             if (index < length && isHexDigit(source[index])) {
04844                 ch = source[index++];
04845                 code = code * 16 + '0123456789abcdef'.indexOf(ch.toLowerCase());
04846             } else {
04847                 return '';
04848             }
04849         }
04850         return String.fromCharCode(code);
04851     }
04852 
04853     function scanIdentifier() {
04854         var ch, start, id, restore;
04855 
04856         ch = source[index];
04857         if (!isIdentifierStart(ch)) {
04858             return;
04859         }
04860 
04861         start = index;
04862         if (ch === '\\') {
04863             ++index;
04864             if (source[index] !== 'u') {
04865                 return;
04866             }
04867             ++index;
04868             restore = index;
04869             ch = scanHexEscape('u');
04870             if (ch) {
04871                 if (ch === '\\' || !isIdentifierStart(ch)) {
04872                     return;
04873                 }
04874                 id = ch;
04875             } else {
04876                 index = restore;
04877                 id = 'u';
04878             }
04879         } else {
04880             id = source[index++];
04881         }
04882 
04883         while (index < length) {
04884             ch = source[index];
04885             if (!isIdentifierPart(ch)) {
04886                 break;
04887             }
04888             if (ch === '\\') {
04889                 ++index;
04890                 if (source[index] !== 'u') {
04891                     return;
04892                 }
04893                 ++index;
04894                 restore = index;
04895                 ch = scanHexEscape('u');
04896                 if (ch) {
04897                     if (ch === '\\' || !isIdentifierPart(ch)) {
04898                         return;
04899                     }
04900                     id += ch;
04901                 } else {
04902                     index = restore;
04903                     id += 'u';
04904                 }
04905             } else {
04906                 id += source[index++];
04907             }
04908         }
04909 
04910         // There is no keyword or literal with only one character.
04911         // Thus, it must be an identifier.
04912         if (id.length === 1) {
04913             return {
04914                 type: Token.Identifier,
04915                 value: id,
04916                 lineNumber: lineNumber,
04917                 lineStart: lineStart,
04918                 range: [start, index]
04919             };
04920         }
04921 
04922         if (isKeyword(id)) {
04923             return {
04924                 type: Token.Keyword,
04925                 value: id,
04926                 lineNumber: lineNumber,
04927                 lineStart: lineStart,
04928                 range: [start, index]
04929             };
04930         }
04931 
04932         // 7.8.1 Null Literals
04933 
04934         if (id === 'null') {
04935             return {
04936                 type: Token.NullLiteral,
04937                 value: id,
04938                 lineNumber: lineNumber,
04939                 lineStart: lineStart,
04940                 range: [start, index]
04941             };
04942         }
04943 
04944         // 7.8.2 Boolean Literals
04945 
04946         if (id === 'true' || id === 'false') {
04947             return {
04948                 type: Token.BooleanLiteral,
04949                 value: id,
04950                 lineNumber: lineNumber,
04951                 lineStart: lineStart,
04952                 range: [start, index]
04953             };
04954         }
04955 
04956         return {
04957             type: Token.Identifier,
04958             value: id,
04959             lineNumber: lineNumber,
04960             lineStart: lineStart,
04961             range: [start, index]
04962         };
04963     }
04964 
04965     // 7.7 Punctuators
04966 
04967     function scanPunctuator() {
04968         var start = index,
04969             ch1 = source[index],
04970             ch2,
04971             ch3,
04972             ch4;
04973 
04974         // Check for most common single-character punctuators.
04975 
04976         if (ch1 === ';' || ch1 === '{' || ch1 === '}') {
04977             ++index;
04978             return {
04979                 type: Token.Punctuator,
04980                 value: ch1,
04981                 lineNumber: lineNumber,
04982                 lineStart: lineStart,
04983                 range: [start, index]
04984             };
04985         }
04986 
04987         if (ch1 === ',' || ch1 === '(' || ch1 === ')') {
04988             ++index;
04989             return {
04990                 type: Token.Punctuator,
04991                 value: ch1,
04992                 lineNumber: lineNumber,
04993                 lineStart: lineStart,
04994                 range: [start, index]
04995             };
04996         }
04997 
04998         // Dot (.) can also start a floating-point number, hence the need
04999         // to check the next character.
05000 
05001         ch2 = source[index + 1];
05002         if (ch1 === '.' && !isDecimalDigit(ch2)) {
05003             return {
05004                 type: Token.Punctuator,
05005                 value: source[index++],
05006                 lineNumber: lineNumber,
05007                 lineStart: lineStart,
05008                 range: [start, index]
05009             };
05010         }
05011 
05012         // Peek more characters.
05013 
05014         ch3 = source[index + 2];
05015         ch4 = source[index + 3];
05016 
05017         // 4-character punctuator: >>>=
05018 
05019         if (ch1 === '>' && ch2 === '>' && ch3 === '>') {
05020             if (ch4 === '=') {
05021                 index += 4;
05022                 return {
05023                     type: Token.Punctuator,
05024                     value: '>>>=',
05025                     lineNumber: lineNumber,
05026                     lineStart: lineStart,
05027                     range: [start, index]
05028                 };
05029             }
05030         }
05031 
05032         // 3-character punctuators: === !== >>> <<= >>=
05033 
05034         if (ch1 === '=' && ch2 === '=' && ch3 === '=') {
05035             index += 3;
05036             return {
05037                 type: Token.Punctuator,
05038                 value: '===',
05039                 lineNumber: lineNumber,
05040                 lineStart: lineStart,
05041                 range: [start, index]
05042             };
05043         }
05044 
05045         if (ch1 === '!' && ch2 === '=' && ch3 === '=') {
05046             index += 3;
05047             return {
05048                 type: Token.Punctuator,
05049                 value: '!==',
05050                 lineNumber: lineNumber,
05051                 lineStart: lineStart,
05052                 range: [start, index]
05053             };
05054         }
05055 
05056         if (ch1 === '>' && ch2 === '>' && ch3 === '>') {
05057             index += 3;
05058             return {
05059                 type: Token.Punctuator,
05060                 value: '>>>',
05061                 lineNumber: lineNumber,
05062                 lineStart: lineStart,
05063                 range: [start, index]
05064             };
05065         }
05066 
05067         if (ch1 === '<' && ch2 === '<' && ch3 === '=') {
05068             index += 3;
05069             return {
05070                 type: Token.Punctuator,
05071                 value: '<<=',
05072                 lineNumber: lineNumber,
05073                 lineStart: lineStart,
05074                 range: [start, index]
05075             };
05076         }
05077 
05078         if (ch1 === '>' && ch2 === '>' && ch3 === '=') {
05079             index += 3;
05080             return {
05081                 type: Token.Punctuator,
05082                 value: '>>=',
05083                 lineNumber: lineNumber,
05084                 lineStart: lineStart,
05085                 range: [start, index]
05086             };
05087         }
05088 
05089         // 2-character punctuators: <= >= == != ++ -- << >> && ||
05090         // += -= *= %= &= |= ^= /=
05091 
05092         if (ch2 === '=') {
05093             if ('<>=!+-*%&|^/'.indexOf(ch1) >= 0) {
05094                 index += 2;
05095                 return {
05096                     type: Token.Punctuator,
05097                     value: ch1 + ch2,
05098                     lineNumber: lineNumber,
05099                     lineStart: lineStart,
05100                     range: [start, index]
05101                 };
05102             }
05103         }
05104 
05105         if (ch1 === ch2 && ('+-<>&|'.indexOf(ch1) >= 0)) {
05106             if ('+-<>&|'.indexOf(ch2) >= 0) {
05107                 index += 2;
05108                 return {
05109                     type: Token.Punctuator,
05110                     value: ch1 + ch2,
05111                     lineNumber: lineNumber,
05112                     lineStart: lineStart,
05113                     range: [start, index]
05114                 };
05115             }
05116         }
05117 
05118         // The remaining 1-character punctuators.
05119 
05120         if ('[]<>+-*%&|^!~?:=/'.indexOf(ch1) >= 0) {
05121             return {
05122                 type: Token.Punctuator,
05123                 value: source[index++],
05124                 lineNumber: lineNumber,
05125                 lineStart: lineStart,
05126                 range: [start, index]
05127             };
05128         }
05129     }
05130 
05131     // 7.8.3 Numeric Literals
05132 
05133     function scanNumericLiteral() {
05134         var number, start, ch;
05135 
05136         ch = source[index];
05137         assert(isDecimalDigit(ch) || (ch === '.'),
05138             'Numeric literal must start with a decimal digit or a decimal point');
05139 
05140         start = index;
05141         number = '';
05142         if (ch !== '.') {
05143             number = source[index++];
05144             ch = source[index];
05145 
05146             // Hex number starts with '0x'.
05147             // Octal number starts with '0'.
05148             if (number === '0') {
05149                 if (ch === 'x' || ch === 'X') {
05150                     number += source[index++];
05151                     while (index < length) {
05152                         ch = source[index];
05153                         if (!isHexDigit(ch)) {
05154                             break;
05155                         }
05156                         number += source[index++];
05157                     }
05158 
05159                     if (number.length <= 2) {
05160                         // only 0x
05161                         throwError({}, Messages.UnexpectedToken, 'ILLEGAL');
05162                     }
05163 
05164                     if (index < length) {
05165                         ch = source[index];
05166                         if (isIdentifierStart(ch)) {
05167                             throwError({}, Messages.UnexpectedToken, 'ILLEGAL');
05168                         }
05169                     }
05170                     return {
05171                         type: Token.NumericLiteral,
05172                         value: parseInt(number, 16),
05173                         lineNumber: lineNumber,
05174                         lineStart: lineStart,
05175                         range: [start, index]
05176                     };
05177                 } else if (isOctalDigit(ch)) {
05178                     number += source[index++];
05179                     while (index < length) {
05180                         ch = source[index];
05181                         if (!isOctalDigit(ch)) {
05182                             break;
05183                         }
05184                         number += source[index++];
05185                     }
05186 
05187                     if (index < length) {
05188                         ch = source[index];
05189                         if (isIdentifierStart(ch) || isDecimalDigit(ch)) {
05190                             throwError({}, Messages.UnexpectedToken, 'ILLEGAL');
05191                         }
05192                     }
05193                     return {
05194                         type: Token.NumericLiteral,
05195                         value: parseInt(number, 8),
05196                         octal: true,
05197                         lineNumber: lineNumber,
05198                         lineStart: lineStart,
05199                         range: [start, index]
05200                     };
05201                 }
05202 
05203                 // decimal number starts with '0' such as '09' is illegal.
05204                 if (isDecimalDigit(ch)) {
05205                     throwError({}, Messages.UnexpectedToken, 'ILLEGAL');
05206                 }
05207             }
05208 
05209             while (index < length) {
05210                 ch = source[index];
05211                 if (!isDecimalDigit(ch)) {
05212                     break;
05213                 }
05214                 number += source[index++];
05215             }
05216         }
05217 
05218         if (ch === '.') {
05219             number += source[index++];
05220             while (index < length) {
05221                 ch = source[index];
05222                 if (!isDecimalDigit(ch)) {
05223                     break;
05224                 }
05225                 number += source[index++];
05226             }
05227         }
05228 
05229         if (ch === 'e' || ch === 'E') {
05230             number += source[index++];
05231 
05232             ch = source[index];
05233             if (ch === '+' || ch === '-') {
05234                 number += source[index++];
05235             }
05236 
05237             ch = source[index];
05238             if (isDecimalDigit(ch)) {
05239                 number += source[index++];
05240                 while (index < length) {
05241                     ch = source[index];
05242                     if (!isDecimalDigit(ch)) {
05243                         break;
05244                     }
05245                     number += source[index++];
05246                 }
05247             } else {
05248                 ch = 'character ' + ch;
05249                 if (index >= length) {
05250                     ch = '<end>';
05251                 }
05252                 throwError({}, Messages.UnexpectedToken, 'ILLEGAL');
05253             }
05254         }
05255 
05256         if (index < length) {
05257             ch = source[index];
05258             if (isIdentifierStart(ch)) {
05259                 throwError({}, Messages.UnexpectedToken, 'ILLEGAL');
05260             }
05261         }
05262 
05263         return {
05264             type: Token.NumericLiteral,
05265             value: parseFloat(number),
05266             lineNumber: lineNumber,
05267             lineStart: lineStart,
05268             range: [start, index]
05269         };
05270     }
05271 
05272     // 7.8.4 String Literals
05273 
05274     function scanStringLiteral() {
05275         var str = '', quote, start, ch, code, unescaped, restore, octal = false;
05276 
05277         quote = source[index];
05278         assert((quote === '\'' || quote === '"'),
05279             'String literal must starts with a quote');
05280 
05281         start = index;
05282         ++index;
05283 
05284         while (index < length) {
05285             ch = source[index++];
05286 
05287             if (ch === quote) {
05288                 quote = '';
05289                 break;
05290             } else if (ch === '\\') {
05291                 ch = source[index++];
05292                 if (!isLineTerminator(ch)) {
05293                     switch (ch) {
05294                     case 'n':
05295                         str += '\n';
05296                         break;
05297                     case 'r':
05298                         str += '\r';
05299                         break;
05300                     case 't':
05301                         str += '\t';
05302                         break;
05303                     case 'u':
05304                     case 'x':
05305                         restore = index;
05306                         unescaped = scanHexEscape(ch);
05307                         if (unescaped) {
05308                             str += unescaped;
05309                         } else {
05310                             index = restore;
05311                             str += ch;
05312                         }
05313                         break;
05314                     case 'b':
05315                         str += '\b';
05316                         break;
05317                     case 'f':
05318                         str += '\f';
05319                         break;
05320                     case 'v':
05321                         str += '\x0B';
05322                         break;
05323 
05324                     default:
05325                         if (isOctalDigit(ch)) {
05326                             code = '01234567'.indexOf(ch);
05327 
05328                             // \0 is not octal escape sequence
05329                             if (code !== 0) {
05330                                 octal = true;
05331                             }
05332 
05333                             if (index < length && isOctalDigit(source[index])) {
05334                                 octal = true;
05335                                 code = code * 8 + '01234567'.indexOf(source[index++]);
05336 
05337                                 // 3 digits are only allowed when string starts
05338                                 // with 0, 1, 2, 3
05339                                 if ('0123'.indexOf(ch) >= 0 &&
05340                                         index < length &&
05341                                         isOctalDigit(source[index])) {
05342                                     code = code * 8 + '01234567'.indexOf(source[index++]);
05343                                 }
05344                             }
05345                             str += String.fromCharCode(code);
05346                         } else {
05347                             str += ch;
05348                         }
05349                         break;
05350                     }
05351                 } else {
05352                     ++lineNumber;
05353                     if (ch ===  '\r' && source[index] === '\n') {
05354                         ++index;
05355                     }
05356                 }
05357             } else if (isLineTerminator(ch)) {
05358                 break;
05359             } else {
05360                 str += ch;
05361             }
05362         }
05363 
05364         if (quote !== '') {
05365             throwError({}, Messages.UnexpectedToken, 'ILLEGAL');
05366         }
05367 
05368         return {
05369             type: Token.StringLiteral,
05370             value: str,
05371             octal: octal,
05372             lineNumber: lineNumber,
05373             lineStart: lineStart,
05374             range: [start, index]
05375         };
05376     }
05377 
05378     function scanRegExp() {
05379         var str, ch, start, pattern, flags, value, classMarker = false, restore, terminated = false;
05380 
05381         buffer = null;
05382         skipComment();
05383 
05384         start = index;
05385         ch = source[index];
05386         assert(ch === '/', 'Regular expression literal must start with a slash');
05387         str = source[index++];
05388 
05389         while (index < length) {
05390             ch = source[index++];
05391             str += ch;
05392             if (classMarker) {
05393                 if (ch === ']') {
05394                     classMarker = false;
05395                 }
05396             } else {
05397                 if (ch === '\\') {
05398                     ch = source[index++];
05399                     // ECMA-262 7.8.5
05400                     if (isLineTerminator(ch)) {
05401                         throwError({}, Messages.UnterminatedRegExp);
05402                     }
05403                     str += ch;
05404                 } else if (ch === '/') {
05405                     terminated = true;
05406                     break;
05407                 } else if (ch === '[') {
05408                     classMarker = true;
05409                 } else if (isLineTerminator(ch)) {
05410                     throwError({}, Messages.UnterminatedRegExp);
05411                 }
05412             }
05413         }
05414 
05415         if (!terminated) {
05416             throwError({}, Messages.UnterminatedRegExp);
05417         }
05418 
05419         // Exclude leading and trailing slash.
05420         pattern = str.substr(1, str.length - 2);
05421 
05422         flags = '';
05423         while (index < length) {
05424             ch = source[index];
05425             if (!isIdentifierPart(ch)) {
05426                 break;
05427             }
05428 
05429             ++index;
05430             if (ch === '\\' && index < length) {
05431                 ch = source[index];
05432                 if (ch === 'u') {
05433                     ++index;
05434                     restore = index;
05435                     ch = scanHexEscape('u');
05436                     if (ch) {
05437                         flags += ch;
05438                         str += '\\u';
05439                         for (; restore < index; ++restore) {
05440                             str += source[restore];
05441                         }
05442                     } else {
05443                         index = restore;
05444                         flags += 'u';
05445                         str += '\\u';
05446                     }
05447                 } else {
05448                     str += '\\';
05449                 }
05450             } else {
05451                 flags += ch;
05452                 str += ch;
05453             }
05454         }
05455 
05456         try {
05457             value = new RegExp(pattern, flags);
05458         } catch (e) {
05459             throwError({}, Messages.InvalidRegExp);
05460         }
05461 
05462         return {
05463             literal: str,
05464             value: value,
05465             range: [start, index]
05466         };
05467     }
05468 
05469     function isIdentifierName(token) {
05470         return token.type === Token.Identifier ||
05471             token.type === Token.Keyword ||
05472             token.type === Token.BooleanLiteral ||
05473             token.type === Token.NullLiteral;
05474     }
05475 
05476     function advance() {
05477         var ch, token;
05478 
05479         skipComment();
05480 
05481         if (index >= length) {
05482             return {
05483                 type: Token.EOF,
05484                 lineNumber: lineNumber,
05485                 lineStart: lineStart,
05486                 range: [index, index]
05487             };
05488         }
05489 
05490         token = scanPunctuator();
05491         if (typeof token !== 'undefined') {
05492             return token;
05493         }
05494 
05495         ch = source[index];
05496 
05497         if (ch === '\'' || ch === '"') {
05498             return scanStringLiteral();
05499         }
05500 
05501         if (ch === '.' || isDecimalDigit(ch)) {
05502             return scanNumericLiteral();
05503         }
05504 
05505         token = scanIdentifier();
05506         if (typeof token !== 'undefined') {
05507             return token;
05508         }
05509 
05510         throwError({}, Messages.UnexpectedToken, 'ILLEGAL');
05511     }
05512 
05513     function lex() {
05514         var token;
05515 
05516         if (buffer) {
05517             index = buffer.range[1];
05518             lineNumber = buffer.lineNumber;
05519             lineStart = buffer.lineStart;
05520             token = buffer;
05521             buffer = null;
05522             return token;
05523         }
05524 
05525         buffer = null;
05526         return advance();
05527     }
05528 
05529     function lookahead() {
05530         var pos, line, start;
05531 
05532         if (buffer !== null) {
05533             return buffer;
05534         }
05535 
05536         pos = index;
05537         line = lineNumber;
05538         start = lineStart;
05539         buffer = advance();
05540         index = pos;
05541         lineNumber = line;
05542         lineStart = start;
05543 
05544         return buffer;
05545     }
05546 
05547     // Return true if there is a line terminator before the next token.
05548 
05549     function peekLineTerminator() {
05550         var pos, line, start, found;
05551 
05552         pos = index;
05553         line = lineNumber;
05554         start = lineStart;
05555         skipComment();
05556         found = lineNumber !== line;
05557         index = pos;
05558         lineNumber = line;
05559         lineStart = start;
05560 
05561         return found;
05562     }
05563 
05564     // Throw an exception
05565 
05566     function throwError(token, messageFormat) {
05567         var error,
05568             args = Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments, 2),
05569             msg = messageFormat.replace(
05570                 /%(\d)/g,
05571                 function (whole, index) {
05572                     return args[index] || '';
05573                 }
05574             );
05575 
05576         if (typeof token.lineNumber === 'number') {
05577             error = new Error('Line ' + token.lineNumber + ': ' + msg);
05578             error.index = token.range[0];
05579             error.lineNumber = token.lineNumber;
05580             error.column = token.range[0] - lineStart + 1;
05581         } else {
05582             error = new Error('Line ' + lineNumber + ': ' + msg);
05583             error.index = index;
05584             error.lineNumber = lineNumber;
05585             error.column = index - lineStart + 1;
05586         }
05587 
05588         throw error;
05589     }
05590 
05591     function throwErrorTolerant() {
05592         try {
05593             throwError.apply(null, arguments);
05594         } catch (e) {
05595             if (extra.errors) {
05596                 extra.errors.push(e);
05597             } else {
05598                 throw e;
05599             }
05600         }
05601     }
05602 
05603 
05604     // Throw an exception because of the token.
05605 
05606     function throwUnexpected(token) {
05607         if (token.type === Token.EOF) {
05608             throwError(token, Messages.UnexpectedEOS);
05609         }
05610 
05611         if (token.type === Token.NumericLiteral) {
05612             throwError(token, Messages.UnexpectedNumber);
05613         }
05614 
05615         if (token.type === Token.StringLiteral) {
05616             throwError(token, Messages.UnexpectedString);
05617         }
05618 
05619         if (token.type === Token.Identifier) {
05620             throwError(token, Messages.UnexpectedIdentifier);
05621         }
05622 
05623         if (token.type === Token.Keyword) {
05624             if (isFutureReservedWord(token.value)) {
05625                 throwError(token, Messages.UnexpectedReserved);
05626             } else if (strict && isStrictModeReservedWord(token.value)) {
05627                 throwErrorTolerant(token, Messages.StrictReservedWord);
05628                 return;
05629             }
05630             throwError(token, Messages.UnexpectedToken, token.value);
05631         }
05632 
05633         // BooleanLiteral, NullLiteral, or Punctuator.
05634         throwError(token, Messages.UnexpectedToken, token.value);
05635     }
05636 
05637     // Expect the next token to match the specified punctuator.
05638     // If not, an exception will be thrown.
05639 
05640     function expect(value) {
05641         var token = lex();
05642         if (token.type !== Token.Punctuator || token.value !== value) {
05643             throwUnexpected(token);
05644         }
05645     }
05646 
05647     // Expect the next token to match the specified keyword.
05648     // If not, an exception will be thrown.
05649 
05650     function expectKeyword(keyword) {
05651         var token = lex();
05652         if (token.type !== Token.Keyword || token.value !== keyword) {
05653             throwUnexpected(token);
05654         }
05655     }
05656 
05657     // Return true if the next token matches the specified punctuator.
05658 
05659     function match(value) {
05660         var token = lookahead();
05661         return token.type === Token.Punctuator && token.value === value;
05662     }
05663 
05664     // Return true if the next token matches the specified keyword
05665 
05666     function matchKeyword(keyword) {
05667         var token = lookahead();
05668         return token.type === Token.Keyword && token.value === keyword;
05669     }
05670 
05671     // Return true if the next token is an assignment operator
05672 
05673     function matchAssign() {
05674         var token = lookahead(),
05675             op = token.value;
05676 
05677         if (token.type !== Token.Punctuator) {
05678             return false;
05679         }
05680         return op === '=' ||
05681             op === '*=' ||
05682             op === '/=' ||
05683             op === '%=' ||
05684             op === '+=' ||
05685             op === '-=' ||
05686             op === '<<=' ||
05687             op === '>>=' ||
05688             op === '>>>=' ||
05689             op === '&=' ||
05690             op === '^=' ||
05691             op === '|=';
05692     }
05693 
05694     function consumeSemicolon() {
05695         var token, line;
05696 
05697         // Catch the very common case first.
05698         if (source[index] === ';') {
05699             lex();
05700             return;
05701         }
05702 
05703         line = lineNumber;
05704         skipComment();
05705         if (lineNumber !== line) {
05706             return;
05707         }
05708 
05709         if (match(';')) {
05710             lex();
05711             return;
05712         }
05713 
05714         token = lookahead();
05715         if (token.type !== Token.EOF && !match('}')) {
05716             throwUnexpected(token);
05717         }
05718     }
05719 
05720     // Return true if provided expression is LeftHandSideExpression
05721 
05722     function isLeftHandSide(expr) {
05723         return expr.type === Syntax.Identifier || expr.type === Syntax.MemberExpression;
05724     }
05725 
05726     // 11.1.4 Array Initialiser
05727 
05728     function parseArrayInitialiser() {
05729         var elements = [];
05730 
05731         expect('[');
05732 
05733         while (!match(']')) {
05734             if (match(',')) {
05735                 lex();
05736                 elements.push(null);
05737             } else {
05738                 elements.push(parseAssignmentExpression());
05739 
05740                 if (!match(']')) {
05741                     expect(',');
05742                 }
05743             }
05744         }
05745 
05746         expect(']');
05747 
05748         return {
05749             type: Syntax.ArrayExpression,
05750             elements: elements
05751         };
05752     }
05753 
05754     // 11.1.5 Object Initialiser
05755 
05756     function parsePropertyFunction(param, first) {
05757         var previousStrict, body;
05758 
05759         previousStrict = strict;
05760         body = parseFunctionSourceElements();
05761         if (first && strict && isRestrictedWord(param[0].name)) {
05762             throwErrorTolerant(first, Messages.StrictParamName);
05763         }
05764         strict = previousStrict;
05765 
05766         return {
05767             type: Syntax.FunctionExpression,
05768             id: null,
05769             params: param,
05770             defaults: [],
05771             body: body,
05772             rest: null,
05773             generator: false,
05774             expression: false
05775         };
05776     }
05777 
05778     function parseObjectPropertyKey() {
05779         var token = lex();
05780 
05781         // Note: This function is called only from parseObjectProperty(), where
05782         // EOF and Punctuator tokens are already filtered out.
05783 
05784         if (token.type === Token.StringLiteral || token.type === Token.NumericLiteral) {
05785             if (strict && token.octal) {
05786                 throwErrorTolerant(token, Messages.StrictOctalLiteral);
05787             }
05788             return createLiteral(token);
05789         }
05790 
05791         return {
05792             type: Syntax.Identifier,
05793             name: token.value
05794         };
05795     }
05796 
05797     function parseObjectProperty() {
05798         var token, key, id, param;
05799 
05800         token = lookahead();
05801 
05802         if (token.type === Token.Identifier) {
05803 
05804             id = parseObjectPropertyKey();
05805 
05806             // Property Assignment: Getter and Setter.
05807 
05808             if (token.value === 'get' && !match(':')) {
05809                 key = parseObjectPropertyKey();
05810                 expect('(');
05811                 expect(')');
05812                 return {
05813                     type: Syntax.Property,
05814                     key: key,
05815                     value: parsePropertyFunction([]),
05816                     kind: 'get'
05817                 };
05818             } else if (token.value === 'set' && !match(':')) {
05819                 key = parseObjectPropertyKey();
05820                 expect('(');
05821                 token = lookahead();
05822                 if (token.type !== Token.Identifier) {
05823                     expect(')');
05824                     throwErrorTolerant(token, Messages.UnexpectedToken, token.value);
05825                     return {
05826                         type: Syntax.Property,
05827                         key: key,
05828                         value: parsePropertyFunction([]),
05829                         kind: 'set'
05830                     };
05831                 } else {
05832                     param = [ parseVariableIdentifier() ];
05833                     expect(')');
05834                     return {
05835                         type: Syntax.Property,
05836                         key: key,
05837                         value: parsePropertyFunction(param, token),
05838                         kind: 'set'
05839                     };
05840                 }
05841             } else {
05842                 expect(':');
05843                 return {
05844                     type: Syntax.Property,
05845                     key: id,
05846                     value: parseAssignmentExpression(),
05847                     kind: 'init'
05848                 };
05849             }
05850         } else if (token.type === Token.EOF || token.type === Token.Punctuator) {
05851             throwUnexpected(token);
05852         } else {
05853             key = parseObjectPropertyKey();
05854             expect(':');
05855             return {
05856                 type: Syntax.Property,
05857                 key: key,
05858                 value: parseAssignmentExpression(),
05859                 kind: 'init'
05860             };
05861         }
05862     }
05863 
05864     function parseObjectInitialiser() {
05865         var properties = [], property, name, kind, map = {}, toString = String;
05866 
05867         expect('{');
05868 
05869         while (!match('}')) {
05870             property = parseObjectProperty();
05871 
05872             if (property.key.type === Syntax.Identifier) {
05873                 name = property.key.name;
05874             } else {
05875                 name = toString(property.key.value);
05876             }
05877             kind = (property.kind === 'init') ? PropertyKind.Data : (property.kind === 'get') ? PropertyKind.Get : PropertyKind.Set;
05878             if (Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty.call(map, name)) {
05879                 if (map[name] === PropertyKind.Data) {
05880                     if (strict && kind === PropertyKind.Data) {
05881                         throwErrorTolerant({}, Messages.StrictDuplicateProperty);
05882                     } else if (kind !== PropertyKind.Data) {
05883                         throwErrorTolerant({}, Messages.AccessorDataProperty);
05884                     }
05885                 } else {
05886                     if (kind === PropertyKind.Data) {
05887                         throwErrorTolerant({}, Messages.AccessorDataProperty);
05888                     } else if (map[name] & kind) {
05889                         throwErrorTolerant({}, Messages.AccessorGetSet);
05890                     }
05891                 }
05892                 map[name] |= kind;
05893             } else {
05894                 map[name] = kind;
05895             }
05896 
05897             properties.push(property);
05898 
05899             if (!match('}')) {
05900                 expect(',');
05901             }
05902         }
05903 
05904         expect('}');
05905 
05906         return {
05907             type: Syntax.ObjectExpression,
05908             properties: properties
05909         };
05910     }
05911 
05912     // 11.1.6 The Grouping Operator
05913 
05914     function parseGroupExpression() {
05915         var expr;
05916 
05917         expect('(');
05918 
05919         expr = parseExpression();
05920 
05921         expect(')');
05922 
05923         return expr;
05924     }
05925 
05926 
05927     // 11.1 Primary Expressions
05928 
05929     function parsePrimaryExpression() {
05930         var token = lookahead(),
05931             type = token.type;
05932 
05933         if (type === Token.Identifier) {
05934             return {
05935                 type: Syntax.Identifier,
05936                 name: lex().value
05937             };
05938         }
05939 
05940         if (type === Token.StringLiteral || type === Token.NumericLiteral) {
05941             if (strict && token.octal) {
05942                 throwErrorTolerant(token, Messages.StrictOctalLiteral);
05943             }
05944             return createLiteral(lex());
05945         }
05946 
05947         if (type === Token.Keyword) {
05948             if (matchKeyword('this')) {
05949                 lex();
05950                 return {
05951                     type: Syntax.ThisExpression
05952                 };
05953             }
05954 
05955             if (matchKeyword('function')) {
05956                 return parseFunctionExpression();
05957             }
05958         }
05959 
05960         if (type === Token.BooleanLiteral) {
05961             lex();
05962             token.value = (token.value === 'true');
05963             return createLiteral(token);
05964         }
05965 
05966         if (type === Token.NullLiteral) {
05967             lex();
05968             token.value = null;
05969             return createLiteral(token);
05970         }
05971 
05972         if (match('[')) {
05973             return parseArrayInitialiser();
05974         }
05975 
05976         if (match('{')) {
05977             return parseObjectInitialiser();
05978         }
05979 
05980         if (match('(')) {
05981             return parseGroupExpression();
05982         }
05983 
05984         if (match('/') || match('/=')) {
05985             return createLiteral(scanRegExp());
05986         }
05987 
05988         return throwUnexpected(lex());
05989     }
05990 
05991     // 11.2 Left-Hand-Side Expressions
05992 
05993     function parseArguments() {
05994         var args = [];
05995 
05996         expect('(');
05997 
05998         if (!match(')')) {
05999             while (index < length) {
06000                 args.push(parseAssignmentExpression());
06001                 if (match(')')) {
06002                     break;
06003                 }
06004                 expect(',');
06005             }
06006         }
06007 
06008         expect(')');
06009 
06010         return args;
06011     }
06012 
06013     function parseNonComputedProperty() {
06014         var token = lex();
06015 
06016         if (!isIdentifierName(token)) {
06017             throwUnexpected(token);
06018         }
06019 
06020         return {
06021             type: Syntax.Identifier,
06022             name: token.value
06023         };
06024     }
06025 
06026     function parseNonComputedMember() {
06027         expect('.');
06028 
06029         return parseNonComputedProperty();
06030     }
06031 
06032     function parseComputedMember() {
06033         var expr;
06034 
06035         expect('[');
06036 
06037         expr = parseExpression();
06038 
06039         expect(']');
06040 
06041         return expr;
06042     }
06043 
06044     function parseNewExpression() {
06045         var expr;
06046 
06047         expectKeyword('new');
06048 
06049         expr = {
06050             type: Syntax.NewExpression,
06051             callee: parseLeftHandSideExpression(),
06052             'arguments': []
06053         };
06054 
06055         if (match('(')) {
06056             expr['arguments'] = parseArguments();
06057         }
06058 
06059         return expr;
06060     }
06061 
06062     function parseLeftHandSideExpressionAllowCall() {
06063         var expr;
06064 
06065         expr = matchKeyword('new') ? parseNewExpression() : parsePrimaryExpression();
06066 
06067         while (match('.') || match('[') || match('(')) {
06068             if (match('(')) {
06069                 expr = {
06070                     type: Syntax.CallExpression,
06071                     callee: expr,
06072                     'arguments': parseArguments()
06073                 };
06074             } else if (match('[')) {
06075                 expr = {
06076                     type: Syntax.MemberExpression,
06077                     computed: true,
06078                     object: expr,
06079                     property: parseComputedMember()
06080                 };
06081             } else {
06082                 expr = {
06083                     type: Syntax.MemberExpression,
06084                     computed: false,
06085                     object: expr,
06086                     property: parseNonComputedMember()
06087                 };
06088             }
06089         }
06090 
06091         return expr;
06092     }
06093 
06094 
06095     function parseLeftHandSideExpression() {
06096         var expr;
06097 
06098         expr = matchKeyword('new') ? parseNewExpression() : parsePrimaryExpression();
06099 
06100         while (match('.') || match('[')) {
06101             if (match('[')) {
06102                 expr = {
06103                     type: Syntax.MemberExpression,
06104                     computed: true,
06105                     object: expr,
06106                     property: parseComputedMember()
06107                 };
06108             } else {
06109                 expr = {
06110                     type: Syntax.MemberExpression,
06111                     computed: false,
06112                     object: expr,
06113                     property: parseNonComputedMember()
06114                 };
06115             }
06116         }
06117 
06118         return expr;
06119     }
06120 
06121     // 11.3 Postfix Expressions
06122 
06123     function parsePostfixExpression() {
06124         var expr = parseLeftHandSideExpressionAllowCall(), token;
06125 
06126         token = lookahead();
06127         if (token.type !== Token.Punctuator) {
06128             return expr;
06129         }
06130 
06131         if ((match('++') || match('--')) && !peekLineTerminator()) {
06132             // 11.3.1, 11.3.2
06133             if (strict && expr.type === Syntax.Identifier && isRestrictedWord(expr.name)) {
06134                 throwErrorTolerant({}, Messages.StrictLHSPostfix);
06135             }
06136 
06137             if (!isLeftHandSide(expr)) {
06138                 throwError({}, Messages.InvalidLHSInAssignment);
06139             }
06140 
06141             expr = {
06142                 type: Syntax.UpdateExpression,
06143                 operator: lex().value,
06144                 argument: expr,
06145                 prefix: false
06146             };
06147         }
06148 
06149         return expr;
06150     }
06151 
06152     // 11.4 Unary Operators
06153 
06154     function parseUnaryExpression() {
06155         var token, expr;
06156 
06157         token = lookahead();
06158         if (token.type !== Token.Punctuator && token.type !== Token.Keyword) {
06159             return parsePostfixExpression();
06160         }
06161 
06162         if (match('++') || match('--')) {
06163             token = lex();
06164             expr = parseUnaryExpression();
06165             // 11.4.4, 11.4.5
06166             if (strict && expr.type === Syntax.Identifier && isRestrictedWord(expr.name)) {
06167                 throwErrorTolerant({}, Messages.StrictLHSPrefix);
06168             }
06169 
06170             if (!isLeftHandSide(expr)) {
06171                 throwError({}, Messages.InvalidLHSInAssignment);
06172             }
06173 
06174             expr = {
06175                 type: Syntax.UpdateExpression,
06176                 operator: token.value,
06177                 argument: expr,
06178                 prefix: true
06179             };
06180             return expr;
06181         }
06182 
06183         if (match('+') || match('-') || match('~') || match('!')) {
06184             expr = {
06185                 type: Syntax.UnaryExpression,
06186                 operator: lex().value,
06187                 argument: parseUnaryExpression(),
06188                 prefix: true
06189             };
06190             return expr;
06191         }
06192 
06193         if (matchKeyword('delete') || matchKeyword('void') || matchKeyword('typeof')) {
06194             expr = {
06195                 type: Syntax.UnaryExpression,
06196                 operator: lex().value,
06197                 argument: parseUnaryExpression(),
06198                 prefix: true
06199             };
06200             if (strict && expr.operator === 'delete' && expr.argument.type === Syntax.Identifier) {
06201                 throwErrorTolerant({}, Messages.StrictDelete);
06202             }
06203             return expr;
06204         }
06205 
06206         return parsePostfixExpression();
06207     }
06208 
06209     // 11.5 Multiplicative Operators
06210 
06211     function parseMultiplicativeExpression() {
06212         var expr = parseUnaryExpression();
06213 
06214         while (match('*') || match('/') || match('%')) {
06215             expr = {
06216                 type: Syntax.BinaryExpression,
06217                 operator: lex().value,
06218                 left: expr,
06219                 right: parseUnaryExpression()
06220             };
06221         }
06222 
06223         return expr;
06224     }
06225 
06226     // 11.6 Additive Operators
06227 
06228     function parseAdditiveExpression() {
06229         var expr = parseMultiplicativeExpression();
06230 
06231         while (match('+') || match('-')) {
06232             expr = {
06233                 type: Syntax.BinaryExpression,
06234                 operator: lex().value,
06235                 left: expr,
06236                 right: parseMultiplicativeExpression()
06237             };
06238         }
06239 
06240         return expr;
06241     }
06242 
06243     // 11.7 Bitwise Shift Operators
06244 
06245     function parseShiftExpression() {
06246         var expr = parseAdditiveExpression();
06247 
06248         while (match('<<') || match('>>') || match('>>>')) {
06249             expr = {
06250                 type: Syntax.BinaryExpression,
06251                 operator: lex().value,
06252                 left: expr,
06253                 right: parseAdditiveExpression()
06254             };
06255         }
06256 
06257         return expr;
06258     }
06259     // 11.8 Relational Operators
06260 
06261     function parseRelationalExpression() {
06262         var expr, previousAllowIn;
06263 
06264         previousAllowIn = state.allowIn;
06265         state.allowIn = true;
06266 
06267         expr = parseShiftExpression();
06268 
06269         while (match('<') || match('>') || match('<=') || match('>=') || (previousAllowIn && matchKeyword('in')) || matchKeyword('instanceof')) {
06270             expr = {
06271                 type: Syntax.BinaryExpression,
06272                 operator: lex().value,
06273                 left: expr,
06274                 right: parseShiftExpression()
06275             };
06276         }
06277 
06278         state.allowIn = previousAllowIn;
06279         return expr;
06280     }
06281 
06282     // 11.9 Equality Operators
06283 
06284     function parseEqualityExpression() {
