08952          },
08957          fAddIdentifier = function(sIdentifier) {
08958            if (-1 === oSourceElementData.aIdentifiers.indexOf(sIdentifier)) {
08959              oSourceElementData.aIdentifiers.push(sIdentifier);
08960            }
08961          },
08967          fAddVariable = function(aVariableDeclaration) {
08968            fAddIdentifier( aVariableDeclaration[0]);
08969          },
08977          fCountPrimaryExpression = function(nCategory, sName) {
08978            if (!oSourceElementData.aCount[nCategory].hasOwnProperty(sName)) {
08979              oSourceElementData.aCount[nCategory][sName] = 0;
08980              if (-1 === oSourceElementData.aPrimitiveValues.indexOf(sName)) {
08981                oSourceElementData.aPrimitiveValues.push(sName);
08982              }
08983            }
08984            oSourceElementData.aCount[nCategory][sName] += 1;
08985          },
08999          fExamineSourceElements = function(nFrom, nTo, bEnclose) {
09000            var _,
09005                nIndex = oScope.cname,
09011                nPosition,
09019                oWalkersTransformers = {
09036                  'dot': function(oExpression, sIdentifierName) {
09043                    var sPrefixed = EValuePrefixes.S_STRING + sIdentifierName;
09044 
09045                    return oSolutionBest.oPrimitiveValues.hasOwnProperty(
09046                        sPrefixed) &&
09047                        oSolutionBest.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].nSaving > 0 ?
09048                        ['sub',
09049                         oWalker.walk(oExpression),
09050                         ['name',
09051                          oSolutionBest.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].sName]] :
09052                        ['dot', oWalker.walk(oExpression), sIdentifierName];
09053                  },
09064                  'name': function(sIdentifier) {
09069                    var sPrefixed = EValuePrefixes.S_SYMBOLIC + sIdentifier;
09070 
09071                    return [
09072                      'name',
09073                      oSolutionBest.oPrimitiveValues.hasOwnProperty(sPrefixed) &&
09074                      oSolutionBest.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].nSaving > 0 ?
09075                      oSolutionBest.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].sName :
09076                      sIdentifier
09077                    ];
09078                  },
09090                  'string': function(sStringValue) {
09096                    var sPrefixed =
09097                        EValuePrefixes.S_STRING + sStringValue;
09098 
09099                    return oSolutionBest.oPrimitiveValues.hasOwnProperty(
09100                        sPrefixed) &&
09101                        oSolutionBest.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].nSaving > 0 ?
09102                        ['name',
09103                         oSolutionBest.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].sName] :
09104                        ['string', sStringValue];
09105                  }
09106                },
09114                oSolutionBest = new TSolution(),
09123                oSolutionCandidate = new TSolution(),
09129                oSourceElementsData = new TSourceElementsData(),
09135                aVariableDeclarations = [],
09142                cAugmentList = function(aList) {
09148                  var fLambda = function(sPrefixed) {
09149                    if (-1 === aList.indexOf(sPrefixed)) {
09150                      aList.push(sPrefixed);
09151                    }
09152                  };
09153 
09154                  return fLambda;
09155                },
09170                cAddOccurrences = function(nPosition, nCategory) {
09175                  var fLambda = function(sPrefixed) {
09176                    if (!oSourceElementsData.aCount[nCategory].hasOwnProperty(
09177                            sPrefixed)) {
09178                      oSourceElementsData.aCount[nCategory][sPrefixed] = 0;
09179                    }
09180                    oSourceElementsData.aCount[nCategory][sPrefixed] +=
09181                        aSourceElementsData[nPosition].aCount[nCategory][
09182                            sPrefixed];
09183                  };
09184 
09185                  return fLambda;
09186                },
09199                cAddOccurrencesInCategory = function(nPosition) {
09204                  var fLambda = function(nCategory) {
09205                    Object.keys(
09206                        aSourceElementsData[nPosition].aCount[nCategory]
09207                    ).forEach(cAddOccurrences(nPosition, nCategory));
09208                  };
09209 
09210                  return fLambda;
09211                },
09221                fAddOccurrences = function(nPosition) {
09222                  Object.keys(aSourceElementsData[nPosition].aCount).forEach(
09223                      cAddOccurrencesInCategory(nPosition));
09224                },
09233                cAugmentVariableDeclarations = function(sPrefixed) {
09234                  if (oSolutionBest.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].nSaving > 0) {
09235                    aVariableDeclarations.push([
09236                      oSolutionBest.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].sName,
09237                      [0 === sPrefixed.indexOf(EValuePrefixes.S_SYMBOLIC) ?
09238                       'name' : 'string',
09239                       sPrefixed.substring(EValuePrefixes.S_SYMBOLIC.length)]
09240                    ]);
09241                  }
09242                },
09267                cSortPrimitiveValues = function(sPrefixed0, sPrefixed1) {
09280                  var nDifference =
09281                      oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed0].nSaving -
09282                      oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed1].nSaving;
09283 
09284                  return nDifference > 0 ? -1 : nDifference < 0 ? 1 : 0;
09285                },
09293                fEvaluatePrimitiveValue = function(sPrefixed) {
09294                  var _,
09299                      nIndex,
09305                      sName =
09306                          sPrefixed.substring(EValuePrefixes.S_SYMBOLIC.length),
09313                      nLengthOriginal = sName.length,
09321                      nLengthSubstitution,
09329                      nLengthString = oProcessor.make_string(sName).length;
09330 
09331                  oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed] =
09332                      new TPrimitiveValue();
09333                  do {  // Find an identifier unused in this or any nested scope.
09334                    nIndex = oScope.cname;
09335                    oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].sName =
09336                        oScope.next_mangled();
09337                  } while (-1 !== oSourceElementsData.aIdentifiers.indexOf(
09338                      oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].sName));
09339                  nLengthSubstitution = oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[
09340                      sPrefixed].sName.length;
09341                  if (0 === sPrefixed.indexOf(EValuePrefixes.S_SYMBOLIC)) {
09342                    // foo:null, or foo:null;
09343                    oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].nSaving -=
09344                        nLengthSubstitution + nLengthOriginal +
09345                        oWeights.N_VARIABLE_DECLARATION;
09346                    // null vs foo
09347                    oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].nSaving +=
09348                        oSourceElementsData.aCount[
09349                            EPrimaryExpressionCategories.
09350                                N_NULL_AND_BOOLEAN_LITERALS][sPrefixed] *
09351                        (nLengthOriginal - nLengthSubstitution);
09352                  } else {
09353                    // foo:'fromCharCode';
09354                    oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].nSaving -=
09355                        nLengthSubstitution + nLengthString +
09356                        oWeights.N_VARIABLE_DECLARATION;
09357                    // .fromCharCode vs [foo]
09358                    if (oSourceElementsData.aCount[
09359                            EPrimaryExpressionCategories.N_IDENTIFIER_NAMES
09360                        ].hasOwnProperty(sPrefixed)) {
09361                      oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].nSaving +=
09362                          oSourceElementsData.aCount[
09363                              EPrimaryExpressionCategories.N_IDENTIFIER_NAMES
09364                          ][sPrefixed] *
09365                          (nLengthOriginal - nLengthSubstitution -
09366                           oWeights.N_PROPERTY_ACCESSOR);
09367                    }
09368                    // 'fromCharCode' vs foo
09369                    if (oSourceElementsData.aCount[
09370                            EPrimaryExpressionCategories.N_STRING_LITERALS
09371                        ].hasOwnProperty(sPrefixed)) {
09372                      oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].nSaving +=
09373                          oSourceElementsData.aCount[
09374                              EPrimaryExpressionCategories.N_STRING_LITERALS
09375                          ][sPrefixed] *
09376                          (nLengthString - nLengthSubstitution);
09377                    }
09378                  }
09379                  if (oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].nSaving >
09380                      0) {
09381                    oSolutionCandidate.nSavings +=
09382                        oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues[sPrefixed].nSaving;
09383                  } else {
09384                    oScope.cname = nIndex; // Free the identifier name.
09385                  }
09386                },
09392                cAddVariableDeclaration = function(aVariableDeclaration) {
09393                  ( oSourceElements[nFrom][1]).unshift(
09394                      aVariableDeclaration);
09395                };
09396 
09397            if (nFrom > nTo) {
09398              return;
09399            }
09400            // If the range is a closure, reuse the closure.
09401            if (nFrom === nTo &&
09402                'stat' === oSourceElements[nFrom][0] &&
09403                'call' === oSourceElements[nFrom][1][0] &&
09404                'function' === oSourceElements[nFrom][1][1][0]) {
09405              fExamineSyntacticCodeUnit(oSourceElements[nFrom][1][1]);
09406              return;
09407            }
09408            // Create a list of all derived primitive values within the range.
09409            for (nPosition = nFrom; nPosition <= nTo; nPosition += 1) {
09410              aSourceElementsData[nPosition].aPrimitiveValues.forEach(
09411                  cAugmentList(oSourceElementsData.aPrimitiveValues));
09412            }
09413            if (0 === oSourceElementsData.aPrimitiveValues.length) {
09414              return;
09415            }
09416            for (nPosition = nFrom; nPosition <= nTo; nPosition += 1) {
09417              // Add the number of occurrences to the total count.
09418              fAddOccurrences(nPosition);
09419              // Add identifiers of this or any nested scope to the list.
09420              aSourceElementsData[nPosition].aIdentifiers.forEach(
09421                  cAugmentList(oSourceElementsData.aIdentifiers));
09422            }
09423            // Distribute identifier names among derived primitive values.
09424            do {  // If there was any progress, find a better distribution.
09425              oSolutionBest = oSolutionCandidate;
09426              if (Object.keys(oSolutionCandidate.oPrimitiveValues).length > 0) {
09427                // Sort primitive values descending by their worthwhileness.
09428                oSourceElementsData.aPrimitiveValues.sort(cSortPrimitiveValues);
09429              }
09430              oSolutionCandidate = new TSolution();
09431              oSourceElementsData.aPrimitiveValues.forEach(
09432                  fEvaluatePrimitiveValue);
09433              oScope.cname = nIndex;
09434            } while (oSolutionCandidate.nSavings > oSolutionBest.nSavings);
09435            // Take the necessity of adding a variable statement into account.
09436            if ('var' !== oSourceElements[nFrom][0]) {
09437              oSolutionBest.nSavings -= oWeights.N_VARIABLE_STATEMENT_AFFIXATION;
09438            }
09439            if (bEnclose) {
09440              // Take the necessity of forming a closure into account.
09441              oSolutionBest.nSavings -= oWeights.N_CLOSURE;
09442            }
09443            if (oSolutionBest.nSavings > 0) {
09444              // Create variable declarations suitable for UglifyJS.
09445              Object.keys(oSolutionBest.oPrimitiveValues).forEach(
09446                  cAugmentVariableDeclarations);
09447              // Rewrite expressions that contain worthwhile primitive values.
09448              for (nPosition = nFrom; nPosition <= nTo; nPosition += 1) {
09449                oWalker = oProcessor.ast_walker();
09450                oSourceElements[nPosition] =
09451                    oWalker.with_walkers(
09452                        oWalkersTransformers,
09453                        cContext(oWalker, oSourceElements[nPosition]));
09454              }
09455              if ('var' === oSourceElements[nFrom][0]) {  // Reuse the statement.
09456                ( aVariableDeclarations.reverse(
09457                    )).forEach(cAddVariableDeclaration);
09458              } else {  // Add a variable statement.
09459                Array.prototype.splice.call(
09460                    oSourceElements,
09461                    nFrom,
09462                    0,
09463                    ['var', aVariableDeclarations]);
09464                nTo += 1;
09465              }
09466              if (bEnclose) {
09467                // Add a closure.
09468                Array.prototype.splice.call(
09469                    oSourceElements,
09470                    nFrom,
09471                    0,
09472                    ['stat', ['call', ['function', null, [], []], []]]);
09473                // Copy source elements into the closure.
09474                for (nPosition = nTo + 1; nPosition > nFrom; nPosition -= 1) {
09475                  Array.prototype.unshift.call(
09476                      oSourceElements[nFrom][1][1][3],
09477                      oSourceElements[nPosition]);
09478                }
09479                // Remove source elements outside the closure.
09480                Array.prototype.splice.call(
09481                    oSourceElements,
09482                    nFrom + 1,
09483                    nTo - nFrom + 1);
09484              }
09485            }
09486            if (bEnclose) {
09487              // Restore the availability of identifier names.
09488              oScope.cname = nIndex;
09489            }
09490          };
09491 
09492      oSourceElements = (
09493          oSyntacticCodeUnit[bIsGlobal ? 1 : 3]);
09494      if (0 === oSourceElements.length) {
09495        return;
09496      }
09497      oScope = bIsGlobal ? oSyntacticCodeUnit.scope : oSourceElements.scope;
09498      // Skip a Directive Prologue.
09499      while (nAfterDirectivePrologue < oSourceElements.length &&
09500             'directive' === oSourceElements[nAfterDirectivePrologue][0]) {
09501        nAfterDirectivePrologue += 1;
09502        aSourceElementsData.push(null);
09503      }
09504      if (oSourceElements.length === nAfterDirectivePrologue) {
09505        return;
09506      }
09507      for (nPosition = nAfterDirectivePrologue;
09508           nPosition < oSourceElements.length;
09509           nPosition += 1) {
09510        oSourceElementData = new TSourceElementsData();
09511        oWalker = oProcessor.ast_walker();
09512        // Classify a source element.
09513        // Find its derived primitive values and count their occurrences.
09514        // Find all identifiers used (including nested scopes).
09515        oWalker.with_walkers(
09516            oWalkers.oSurveySourceElement,
09517            cContext(oWalker, oSourceElements[nPosition]));
09518        // Establish whether the scope is still wholly examinable.
09519        bIsWhollyExaminable = bIsWhollyExaminable &&
09520            ESourceElementCategories.N_WITH !== oSourceElementData.nCategory &&
09521            ESourceElementCategories.N_EVAL !== oSourceElementData.nCategory;
09522        aSourceElementsData.push(oSourceElementData);
09523      }
09524      if (bIsWhollyExaminable) {  // Examine the whole scope.
09525        fExamineSourceElements(
09526            nAfterDirectivePrologue,
09527            oSourceElements.length - 1,
09528            false);
09529      } else {  // Examine unexcluded ranges of source elements.
09530        for (nPosition = oSourceElements.length - 1;
09531             nPosition >= nAfterDirectivePrologue;
09532             nPosition -= 1) {
09533          oSourceElementData = (
09534              aSourceElementsData[nPosition]);
09535          if (ESourceElementCategories.N_OTHER ===
09536              oSourceElementData.nCategory) {
09537            if ('undefined' === typeof nTo) {
09538              nTo = nPosition;  // Indicate the end of a range.
09539            }
09540            // Examine the range if it immediately follows a Directive Prologue.
09541            if (nPosition === nAfterDirectivePrologue) {
09542              fExamineSourceElements(nPosition, nTo, true);
09543            }
09544          } else {
09545            if ('undefined' !== typeof nTo) {
09546              // Examine the range that immediately follows this source element.
09547              fExamineSourceElements(nPosition + 1, nTo, true);
09548              nTo = void 0;  // Obliterate the range.
09549            }
09550            // Examine nested functions.
09551            oWalker = oProcessor.ast_walker();
09552            oWalker.with_walkers(
09553                oWalkers.oExamineFunctions,
09554                cContext(oWalker, oSourceElements[nPosition]));
09555          }
09556        }
09557      }
09558    }(oAbstractSyntaxTree = oProcessor.ast_add_scope(oAbstractSyntaxTree)));
09559   return oAbstractSyntaxTree;
09560 };
09561 /*jshint sub:false */
09562 
09563 /* Local Variables:      */
09564 /* mode: js              */
09565 /* coding: utf-8         */
09566 /* indent-tabs-mode: nil */
09567 /* tab-width: 2          */
09568 /* End:                  */
09569 /* vim: set ft=javascript fenc=utf-8 et ts=2 sts=2 sw=2: */
09570 /* :mode=javascript:noTabs=true:tabSize=2:indentSize=2:deepIndent=true: */
09571 });
09572 define('uglifyjs/parse-js', ["exports"], function(exports) {
09573 /***********************************************************************
09574 
09575   A JavaScript tokenizer / parser / beautifier / compressor.
09576 
09577   This version is suitable for Node.js.  With minimal changes (the
09578   exports stuff) it should work on any JS platform.
09579 
09580   This file contains the tokenizer/parser.  It is a port to JavaScript
09581   of parse-js [1], a JavaScript parser library written in Common Lisp
09582   by Marijn Haverbeke.  Thank you Marijn!
09583 
09584   [1] http://marijn.haverbeke.nl/parse-js/
09585 
09586   Exported functions:
09587 
09588     - tokenizer(code) -- returns a function.  Call the returned
09589       function to fetch the next token.
09590 
09591     - parse(code) -- returns an AST of the given JavaScript code.
09592 
09593   -------------------------------- (C) ---------------------------------
09594 
09595                            Author: Mihai Bazon
09596                          <mihai.bazon@gmail.com>
09597                        http://mihai.bazon.net/blog
09598 
09599   Distributed under the BSD license:
09600 
09601     Copyright 2010 (c) Mihai Bazon <mihai.bazon@gmail.com>
09602     Based on parse-js (http://marijn.haverbeke.nl/parse-js/).
09603 
09604     Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without
09605     modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions
09606     are met:
09607 
09608         * Redistributions of source code must retain the above
09609           copyright notice, this list of conditions and the following
09610           disclaimer.
09611 
09612         * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above
09613           copyright notice, this list of conditions and the following
09614           disclaimer in the documentation and/or other materials
09615           provided with the distribution.
09616 
09617     THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER “AS IS” AND ANY
09618     EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE
09619     IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR
09620     PURPOSE ARE DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER BE
09621     LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY,
09622     OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO,
09623     PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR
09624     PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON ANY
09625     THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR
09626     TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF
09627     THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF
09628     SUCH DAMAGE.
09629 
09630  ***********************************************************************/
09631 
09632 /* -----[ Tokenizer (constants) ]----- */
09633 
09634 var KEYWORDS = array_to_hash([
09635     "break",
09636     "case",
09637     "catch",
09638     "const",
09639     "continue",
09640     "debugger",
09641     "default",
09642     "delete",
09643     "do",
09644     "else",
09645     "finally",
09646     "for",
09647     "function",
09648     "if",
09649     "in",
09650     "instanceof",
09651     "new",
09652     "return",
09653     "switch",
09654     "throw",
09655     "try",
09656     "typeof",
09657     "var",
09658     "void",
09659     "while",
09660     "with"
09661 ]);
09662 
09663 var RESERVED_WORDS = array_to_hash([
09664     "abstract",
09665     "boolean",
09666     "byte",
09667     "char",
09668     "class",
09669     "double",
09670     "enum",
09671     "export",

09673     "final",
09674     "float",
09675     "goto",
09676     "implements",
09677     "import",
09678     "int",
09679     "interface",
09680     "long",
09681     "native",
09682     "package",
09683     "private",
09684     "protected",
09685     "public",
09686     "short",
09687     "static",
09688     "super",
09689     "synchronized",
09690     "throws",
09691     "transient",
09692     "volatile"
09693 ]);
09694 
09695 var KEYWORDS_BEFORE_EXPRESSION = array_to_hash([
09696     "return",
09697     "new",
09698     "delete",
09699     "throw",
09700     "else",
09701     "case"
09702 ]);
09703 
09704 var KEYWORDS_ATOM = array_to_hash([
09705     "false",
09706     "null",
09707     "true",
09708     "undefined"
09709 ]);
09710 
09711 var OPERATOR_CHARS = array_to_hash(characters("+-*&%=<>!?|~^"));
09712 
09713 var RE_HEX_NUMBER = /^0x[0-9a-f]+$/i;
09714 var RE_OCT_NUMBER = /^0[0-7]+$/;
09715 var RE_DEC_NUMBER = /^\d*\.?\d*(?:e[+-]?\d*(?:\d\.?|\.?\d)\d*)?$/i;
09716 
09717 var OPERATORS = array_to_hash([
09718     "in",
09719     "instanceof",
09720     "typeof",
09721     "new",
09722     "void",
09723     "delete",
09724     "++",
09725     "--",
09726     "+",
09727     "-",
09728     "!",
09729     "~",
09730     "&",
09731     "|",
09732     "^",
09733     "*",
09734     "/",
09735     "%",
09736     ">>",
09737     "<<",
09738     ">>>",

09740     ">",

09742     ">=",
09743     "==",
09744     "===",
09745     "!=",
09746     "!==",
09747     "?",
09748     "=",
09749     "+=",
09750     "-=",
09751     "/=",
09752     "*=",
09753     "%=",
09754     ">>=",
09755     "<<=",
09756     ">>>=",
09757     "|=",
09758     "^=",
09759     "&=",
09760     "&&",
09761     "||"
09762 ]);
09763 
09764 var WHITESPACE_CHARS = array_to_hash(characters(" \u00a0\n\r\t\f\u000b\u200b\u180e\u2000\u2001\u2002\u2003\u2004\u2005\u2006\u2007\u2008\u2009\u200a\u202f\u205f\u3000\uFEFF"));
09765 
09766 var PUNC_BEFORE_EXPRESSION = array_to_hash(characters("[{(,.;:"));
09767 
09768 var PUNC_CHARS = array_to_hash(characters("[]{}(),;:"));
09769 
09770 var REGEXP_MODIFIERS = array_to_hash(characters("gmsiy"));
09771 
09772 /* -----[ Tokenizer ]----- */
09773 
09774 var UNICODE = {  // Unicode 6.1
09775     letter: new RegExp("[\\u0041-\\u005A\\u0061-\\u007A\\u00AA\\u00B5\\u00BA\\u00C0-\\u00D6\\u00D8-\\u00F6\\u00F8-\\u02C1\\u02C6-\\u02D1\\u02E0-\\u02E4\\u02EC\\u02EE\\u0370-\\u0374\\u0376\\u0377\\u037A-\\u037D\\u0386\\u0388-\\u038A\\u038C\\u038E-\\u03A1\\u03A3-\\u03F5\\u03F7-\\u0481\\u048A-\\u0527\\u0531-\\u0556\\u0559\\u0561-\\u0587\\u05D0-\\u05EA\\u05F0-\\u05F2\\u0620-\\u064A\\u066E\\u066F\\u0671-\\u06D3\\u06D5\\u06E5\\u06E6\\u06EE\\u06EF\\u06FA-\\u06FC\\u06FF\\u0710\\u0712-\\u072F\\u074D-\\u07A5\\u07B1\\u07CA-\\u07EA\\u07F4\\u07F5\\u07FA\\u0800-\\u0815\\u081A\\u0824\\u0828\\u0840-\\u0858\\u08A0\\u08A2-\\u08AC\\u0904-\\u0939\\u093D\\u0950\\u0958-\\u0961\\u0971-\\u0977\\u0979-\\u097F\\u0985-\\u098C\\u098F\\u0990\\u0993-\\u09A8\\u09AA-\\u09B0\\u09B2\\u09B6-\\u09B9\\u09BD\\u09CE\\u09DC\\u09DD\\u09DF-\\u09E1\\u09F0\\u09F1\\u0A05-\\u0A0A\\u0A0F\\u0A10\\u0A13-\\u0A28\\u0A2A-\\u0A30\\u0A32\\u0A33\\u0A35\\u0A36\\u0A38\\u0A39\\u0A59-\\u0A5C\\u0A5E\\u0A72-\\u0A74\\u0A85-\\u0A8D\\u0A8F-\\u0A91\\u0A93-\\u0AA8\\u0AAA-\\u0AB0\\u0AB2\\u0AB3\\u0AB5-\\u0AB9\\u0ABD\\u0AD0\\u0AE0\\u0AE1\\u0B05-\\u0B0C\\u0B0F\\u0B10\\u0B13-\\u0B28\\u0B2A-\\u0B30\\u0B32\\u0B33\\u0B35-\\u0B39\\u0B3D\\u0B5C\\u0B5D\\u0B5F-\\u0B61\\u0B71\\u0B83\\u0B85-\\u0B8A\\u0B8E-\\u0B90\\u0B92-\\u0B95\\u0B99\\u0B9A\\u0B9C\\u0B9E\\u0B9F\\u0BA3\\u0BA4\\u0BA8-\\u0BAA\\u0BAE-\\u0BB9\\u0BD0\\u0C05-\\u0C0C\\u0C0E-\\u0C10\\u0C12-\\u0C28\\u0C2A-\\u0C33\\u0C35-\\u0C39\\u0C3D\\u0C58\\u0C59\\u0C60\\u0C61\\u0C85-\\u0C8C\\u0C8E-\\u0C90\\u0C92-\\u0CA8\\u0CAA-\\u0CB3\\u0CB5-\\u0CB9\\u0CBD\\u0CDE\\u0CE0\\u0CE1\\u0CF1\\u0CF2\\u0D05-\\u0D0C\\u0D0E-\\u0D10\\u0D12-\\u0D3A\\u0D3D\\u0D4E\\u0D60\\u0D61\\u0D7A-\\u0D7F\\u0D85-\\u0D96\\u0D9A-\\u0DB1\\u0DB3-\\u0DBB\\u0DBD\\u0DC0-\\u0DC6\\u0E01-\\u0E30\\u0E32\\u0E33\\u0E40-\\u0E46\\u0E81\\u0E82\\u0E84\\u0E87\\u0E88\\u0E8A\\u0E8D\\u0E94-\\u0E97\\u0E99-\\u0E9F\\u0EA1-\\u0EA3\\u0EA5\\u0EA7\\u0EAA\\u0EAB\\u0EAD-\\u0EB0\\u0EB2\\u0EB3\\u0EBD\\u0EC0-\\u0EC4\\u0EC6\\u0EDC-\\u0EDF\\u0F00\\u0F40-\\u0F47\\u0F49-\\u0F6C\\u0F88-\\u0F8C\\u1000-\\u102A\\u103F\\u1050-\\u1055\\u105A-\\u105D\\u1061\\u1065\\u1066\\u106E-\\u1070\\u1075-\\u1081\\u108E\\u10A0-\\u10C5\\u10C7\\u10CD\\u10D0-\\u10FA\\u10FC-\\u1248\\u124A-\\u124D\\u1250-\\u1256\\u1258\\u125A-\\u125D\\u1260-\\u1288\\u128A-\\u128D\\u1290-\\u12B0\\u12B2-\\u12B5\\u12B8-\\u12BE\\u12C0\\u12C2-\\u12C5\\u12C8-\\u12D6\\u12D8-\\u1310\\u1312-\\u1315\\u1318-\\u135A\\u1380-\\u138F\\u13A0-\\u13F4\\u1401-\\u166C\\u166F-\\u167F\\u1681-\\u169A\\u16A0-\\u16EA\\u16EE-\\u16F0\\u1700-\\u170C\\u170E-\\u1711\\u1720-\\u1731\\u1740-\\u1751\\u1760-\\u176C\\u176E-\\u1770\\u1780-\\u17B3\\u17D7\\u17DC\\u1820-\\u1877\\u1880-\\u18A8\\u18AA\\u18B0-\\u18F5\\u1900-\\u191C\\u1950-\\u196D\\u1970-\\u1974\\u1980-\\u19AB\\u19C1-\\u19C7\\u1A00-\\u1A16\\u1A20-\\u1A54\\u1AA7\\u1B05-\\u1B33\\u1B45-\\u1B4B\\u1B83-\\u1BA0\\u1BAE\\u1BAF\\u1BBA-\\u1BE5\\u1C00-\\u1C23\\u1C4D-\\u1C4F\\u1C5A-\\u1C7D\\u1CE9-\\u1CEC\\u1CEE-\\u1CF1\\u1CF5\\u1CF6\\u1D00-\\u1DBF\\u1E00-\\u1F15\\u1F18-\\u1F1D\\u1F20-\\u1F45\\u1F48-\\u1F4D\\u1F50-\\u1F57\\u1F59\\u1F5B\\u1F5D\\u1F5F-\\u1F7D\\u1F80-\\u1FB4\\u1FB6-\\u1FBC\\u1FBE\\u1FC2-\\u1FC4\\u1FC6-\\u1FCC\\u1FD0-\\u1FD3\\u1FD6-\\u1FDB\\u1FE0-\\u1FEC\\u1FF2-\\u1FF4\\u1FF6-\\u1FFC\\u2071\\u207F\\u2090-\\u209C\\u2102\\u2107\\u210A-\\u2113\\u2115\\u2119-\\u211D\\u2124\\u2126\\u2128\\u212A-\\u212D\\u212F-\\u2139\\u213C-\\u213F\\u2145-\\u2149\\u214E\\u2160-\\u2188\\u2C00-\\u2C2E\\u2C30-\\u2C5E\\u2C60-\\u2CE4\\u2CEB-\\u2CEE\\u2CF2\\u2CF3\\u2D00-\\u2D25\\u2D27\\u2D2D\\u2D30-\\u2D67\\u2D6F\\u2D80-\\u2D96\\u2DA0-\\u2DA6\\u2DA8-\\u2DAE\\u2DB0-\\u2DB6\\u2DB8-\\u2DBE\\u2DC0-\\u2DC6\\u2DC8-\\u2DCE\\u2DD0-\\u2DD6\\u2DD8-\\u2DDE\\u2E2F\\u3005-\\u3007\\u3021-\\u3029\\u3031-\\u3035\\u3038-\\u303C\\u3041-\\u3096\\u309D-\\u309F\\u30A1-\\u30FA\\u30FC-\\u30FF\\u3105-\\u312D\\u3131-\\u318E\\u31A0-\\u31BA\\u31F0-\\u31FF\\u3400-\\u4DB5\\u4E00-\\u9FCC\\uA000-\\uA48C\\uA4D0-\\uA4FD\\uA500-\\uA60C\\uA610-\\uA61F\\uA62A\\uA62B\\uA640-\\uA66E\\uA67F-\\uA697\\uA6A0-\\uA6EF\\uA717-\\uA71F\\uA722-\\uA788\\uA78B-\\uA78E\\uA790-\\uA793\\uA7A0-\\uA7AA\\uA7F8-\\uA801\\uA803-\\uA805\\uA807-\\uA80A\\uA80C-\\uA822\\uA840-\\uA873\\uA882-\\uA8B3\\uA8F2-\\uA8F7\\uA8FB\\uA90A-\\uA925\\uA930-\\uA946\\uA960-\\uA97C\\uA984-\\uA9B2\\uA9CF\\uAA00-\\uAA28\\uAA40-\\uAA42\\uAA44-\\uAA4B\\uAA60-\\uAA76\\uAA7A\\uAA80-\\uAAAF\\uAAB1\\uAAB5\\uAAB6\\uAAB9-\\uAABD\\uAAC0\\uAAC2\\uAADB-\\uAADD\\uAAE0-\\uAAEA\\uAAF2-\\uAAF4\\uAB01-\\uAB06\\uAB09-\\uAB0E\\uAB11-\\uAB16\\uAB20-\\uAB26\\uAB28-\\uAB2E\\uABC0-\\uABE2\\uAC00-\\uD7A3\\uD7B0-\\uD7C6\\uD7CB-\\uD7FB\\uF900-\\uFA6D\\uFA70-\\uFAD9\\uFB00-\\uFB06\\uFB13-\\uFB17\\uFB1D\\uFB1F-\\uFB28\\uFB2A-\\uFB36\\uFB38-\\uFB3C\\uFB3E\\uFB40\\uFB41\\uFB43\\uFB44\\uFB46-\\uFBB1\\uFBD3-\\uFD3D\\uFD50-\\uFD8F\\uFD92-\\uFDC7\\uFDF0-\\uFDFB\\uFE70-\\uFE74\\uFE76-\\uFEFC\\uFF21-\\uFF3A\\uFF41-\\uFF5A\\uFF66-\\uFFBE\\uFFC2-\\uFFC7\\uFFCA-\\uFFCF\\uFFD2-\\uFFD7\\uFFDA-\\uFFDC]"),
09776     combining_mark: new RegExp("[\\u0300-\\u036F\\u0483-\\u0487\\u0591-\\u05BD\\u05BF\\u05C1\\u05C2\\u05C4\\u05C5\\u05C7\\u0610-\\u061A\\u064B-\\u065F\\u0670\\u06D6-\\u06DC\\u06DF-\\u06E4\\u06E7\\u06E8\\u06EA-\\u06ED\\u0711\\u0730-\\u074A\\u07A6-\\u07B0\\u07EB-\\u07F3\\u0816-\\u0819\\u081B-\\u0823\\u0825-\\u0827\\u0829-\\u082D\\u0859-\\u085B\\u08E4-\\u08FE\\u0900-\\u0903\\u093A-\\u093C\\u093E-\\u094F\\u0951-\\u0957\\u0962\\u0963\\u0981-\\u0983\\u09BC\\u09BE-\\u09C4\\u09C7\\u09C8\\u09CB-\\u09CD\\u09D7\\u09E2\\u09E3\\u0A01-\\u0A03\\u0A3C\\u0A3E-\\u0A42\\u0A47\\u0A48\\u0A4B-\\u0A4D\\u0A51\\u0A70\\u0A71\\u0A75\\u0A81-\\u0A83\\u0ABC\\u0ABE-\\u0AC5\\u0AC7-\\u0AC9\\u0ACB-\\u0ACD\\u0AE2\\u0AE3\\u0B01-\\u0B03\\u0B3C\\u0B3E-\\u0B44\\u0B47\\u0B48\\u0B4B-\\u0B4D\\u0B56\\u0B57\\u0B62\\u0B63\\u0B82\\u0BBE-\\u0BC2\\u0BC6-\\u0BC8\\u0BCA-\\u0BCD\\u0BD7\\u0C01-\\u0C03\\u0C3E-\\u0C44\\u0C46-\\u0C48\\u0C4A-\\u0C4D\\u0C55\\u0C56\\u0C62\\u0C63\\u0C82\\u0C83\\u0CBC\\u0CBE-\\u0CC4\\u0CC6-\\u0CC8\\u0CCA-\\u0CCD\\u0CD5\\u0CD6\\u0CE2\\u0CE3\\u0D02\\u0D03\\u0D3E-\\u0D44\\u0D46-\\u0D48\\u0D4A-\\u0D4D\\u0D57\\u0D62\\u0D63\\u0D82\\u0D83\\u0DCA\\u0DCF-\\u0DD4\\u0DD6\\u0DD8-\\u0DDF\\u0DF2\\u0DF3\\u0E31\\u0E34-\\u0E3A\\u0E47-\\u0E4E\\u0EB1\\u0EB4-\\u0EB9\\u0EBB\\u0EBC\\u0EC8-\\u0ECD\\u0F18\\u0F19\\u0F35\\u0F37\\u0F39\\u0F3E\\u0F3F\\u0F71-\\u0F84\\u0F86\\u0F87\\u0F8D-\\u0F97\\u0F99-\\u0FBC\\u0FC6\\u102B-\\u103E\\u1056-\\u1059\\u105E-\\u1060\\u1062-\\u1064\\u1067-\\u106D\\u1071-\\u1074\\u1082-\\u108D\\u108F\\u109A-\\u109D\\u135D-\\u135F\\u1712-\\u1714\\u1732-\\u1734\\u1752\\u1753\\u1772\\u1773\\u17B4-\\u17D3\\u17DD\\u180B-\\u180D\\u18A9\\u1920-\\u192B\\u1930-\\u193B\\u19B0-\\u19C0\\u19C8\\u19C9\\u1A17-\\u1A1B\\u1A55-\\u1A5E\\u1A60-\\u1A7C\\u1A7F\\u1B00-\\u1B04\\u1B34-\\u1B44\\u1B6B-\\u1B73\\u1B80-\\u1B82\\u1BA1-\\u1BAD\\u1BE6-\\u1BF3\\u1C24-\\u1C37\\u1CD0-\\u1CD2\\u1CD4-\\u1CE8\\u1CED\\u1CF2-\\u1CF4\\u1DC0-\\u1DE6\\u1DFC-\\u1DFF\\u20D0-\\u20DC\\u20E1\\u20E5-\\u20F0\\u2CEF-\\u2CF1\\u2D7F\\u2DE0-\\u2DFF\\u302A-\\u302F\\u3099\\u309A\\uA66F\\uA674-\\uA67D\\uA69F\\uA6F0\\uA6F1\\uA802\\uA806\\uA80B\\uA823-\\uA827\\uA880\\uA881\\uA8B4-\\uA8C4\\uA8E0-\\uA8F1\\uA926-\\uA92D\\uA947-\\uA953\\uA980-\\uA983\\uA9B3-\\uA9C0\\uAA29-\\uAA36\\uAA43\\uAA4C\\uAA4D\\uAA7B\\uAAB0\\uAAB2-\\uAAB4\\uAAB7\\uAAB8\\uAABE\\uAABF\\uAAC1\\uAAEB-\\uAAEF\\uAAF5\\uAAF6\\uABE3-\\uABEA\\uABEC\\uABED\\uFB1E\\uFE00-\\uFE0F\\uFE20-\\uFE26]"),
09777     connector_punctuation: new RegExp("[\\u005F\\u203F\\u2040\\u2054\\uFE33\\uFE34\\uFE4D-\\uFE4F\\uFF3F]"),
09778     digit: new RegExp("[\\u0030-\\u0039\\u0660-\\u0669\\u06F0-\\u06F9\\u07C0-\\u07C9\\u0966-\\u096F\\u09E6-\\u09EF\\u0A66-\\u0A6F\\u0AE6-\\u0AEF\\u0B66-\\u0B6F\\u0BE6-\\u0BEF\\u0C66-\\u0C6F\\u0CE6-\\u0CEF\\u0D66-\\u0D6F\\u0E50-\\u0E59\\u0ED0-\\u0ED9\\u0F20-\\u0F29\\u1040-\\u1049\\u1090-\\u1099\\u17E0-\\u17E9\\u1810-\\u1819\\u1946-\\u194F\\u19D0-\\u19D9\\u1A80-\\u1A89\\u1A90-\\u1A99\\u1B50-\\u1B59\\u1BB0-\\u1BB9\\u1C40-\\u1C49\\u1C50-\\u1C59\\uA620-\\uA629\\uA8D0-\\uA8D9\\uA900-\\uA909\\uA9D0-\\uA9D9\\uAA50-\\uAA59\\uABF0-\\uABF9\\uFF10-\\uFF19]")
09779 };
09780 
09781 function is_letter(ch) {
09782     return UNICODE.letter.test(ch);
09783 };
09784 
09785 function is_digit(ch) {
09786     ch = ch.charCodeAt(0);
09787     return ch >= 48 && ch <= 57;
09788 };
09789 
09790 function is_unicode_digit(ch) {
09791     return UNICODE.digit.test(ch);
09792 }
09793 
09794 function is_alphanumeric_char(ch) {
09795     return is_digit(ch) || is_letter(ch);
09796 };
09797 
09798 function is_unicode_combining_mark(ch) {
09799     return UNICODE.combining_mark.test(ch);
09800 };
09801 
09802 function is_unicode_connector_punctuation(ch) {
09803     return UNICODE.connector_punctuation.test(ch);
09804 };
09805 
09806 function is_identifier_start(ch) {
09807     return ch == "$" || ch == "_" || is_letter(ch);
09808 };
09809 
09810 function is_identifier_char(ch) {
09811     return is_identifier_start(ch)
09812         || is_unicode_combining_mark(ch)
09813         || is_unicode_digit(ch)
09814         || is_unicode_connector_punctuation(ch)
09815         || ch == "\u200c" // zero-width non-joiner <ZWNJ>
09816         || ch == "\u200d" // zero-width joiner <ZWJ> (in my ECMA-262 PDF, this is also 200c)
09817     ;
09818 };
09819 
09820 function parse_js_number(num) {
09821     if (RE_HEX_NUMBER.test(num)) {
09822         return parseInt(num.substr(2), 16);
09823     } else if (RE_OCT_NUMBER.test(num)) {
09824         return parseInt(num.substr(1), 8);
09825     } else if (RE_DEC_NUMBER.test(num)) {
09826         return parseFloat(num);
09827     }
09828 };
09829 
09830 function JS_Parse_Error(message, line, col, pos) {
09831     this.message = message;
09832     this.line = line + 1;
09833     this.col = col + 1;
09834     this.pos = pos + 1;
09835     this.stack = new Error().stack;
09836 };
09837 
09838 JS_Parse_Error.prototype.toString = function() {
09839     return this.message + " (line: " + this.line + ", col: " + this.col + ", pos: " + this.pos + ")" + "\n\n" + this.stack;
09840 };
09841 
09842 function js_error(message, line, col, pos) {
09843     throw new JS_Parse_Error(message, line, col, pos);
09844 };
09845 
09846 function is_token(token, type, val) {
09847     return token.type == type && (val == null || token.value == val);
09848 };
09849 
09850 var EX_EOF = {};
09851 
09852 function tokenizer($TEXT) {
09853 
09854     var S = {
09855         text            : $TEXT.replace(/\r\n?|[\n\u2028\u2029]/g, "\n").replace(/^\uFEFF/, ''),
09856         pos             : 0,
09857         tokpos          : 0,
09858         line            : 0,
09859         tokline         : 0,
09860         col             : 0,
09861         tokcol          : 0,
09862         newline_before  : false,
09863         regex_allowed   : false,
09864         comments_before : []
09865     };
09866 
09867     function peek() { return S.text.charAt(S.pos); };
09868 
09869     function next(signal_eof, in_string) {
09870         var ch = S.text.charAt(S.pos++);
09871         if (signal_eof && !ch)
09872             throw EX_EOF;
09873         if (ch == "\n") {
09874             S.newline_before = S.newline_before || !in_string;
09875             ++S.line;
09876             S.col = 0;
09877         } else {
09878             ++S.col;
09879         }
09880         return ch;
09881     };
09882 
09883     function eof() {
09884         return !S.peek();
09885     };
09886 
09887     function find(what, signal_eof) {
09888         var pos = S.text.indexOf(what, S.pos);
09889         if (signal_eof && pos == -1) throw EX_EOF;
09890         return pos;
09891     };
09892 
09893     function start_token() {
09894         S.tokline = S.line;
09895         S.tokcol = S.col;
09896         S.tokpos = S.pos;
09897     };
09898 
09899     function token(type, value, is_comment) {
09900         S.regex_allowed = ((type == "operator" && !HOP(UNARY_POSTFIX, value)) ||
09901                            (type == "keyword" && HOP(KEYWORDS_BEFORE_EXPRESSION, value)) ||
09902                            (type == "punc" && HOP(PUNC_BEFORE_EXPRESSION, value)));
09903         var ret = {
09904             type   : type,
09905             value  : value,
09906             line   : S.tokline,
09907             col    : S.tokcol,
09908             pos    : S.tokpos,
09909             endpos : S.pos,
09910             nlb    : S.newline_before
09911         };
09912         if (!is_comment) {
09913             ret.comments_before = S.comments_before;
09914             S.comments_before = [];
09915             // make note of any newlines in the comments that came before
09916             for (var i = 0, len = ret.comments_before.length; i < len; i++) {
09917                 ret.nlb = ret.nlb || ret.comments_before[i].nlb;
09918             }
09919         }
09920         S.newline_before = false;
09921         return ret;
09922     };
09923 
09924     function skip_whitespace() {
09925         while (HOP(WHITESPACE_CHARS, peek()))
09926             next();
09927     };
09928 
09929     function read_while(pred) {
09930         var ret = "", ch = peek(), i = 0;
09931         while (ch && pred(ch, i++)) {
09932             ret += next();
09933             ch = peek();
09934         }
09935         return ret;
09936     };
09937 
09938     function parse_error(err) {
09939         js_error(err, S.tokline, S.tokcol, S.tokpos);
09940     };
09941 
09942     function read_num(prefix) {
09943         var has_e = false, after_e = false, has_x = false, has_dot = prefix == ".";
09944         var num = read_while(function(ch, i){
09945             if (ch == "x" || ch == "X") {
09946                 if (has_x) return false;
09947                 return has_x = true;
09948             }
09949             if (!has_x && (ch == "E" || ch == "e")) {
09950                 if (has_e) return false;
09951                 return has_e = after_e = true;
09952             }
09953             if (ch == "-") {
09954                 if (after_e || (i == 0 && !prefix)) return true;
09955                 return false;
09956             }
09957             if (ch == "+") return after_e;
09958             after_e = false;
09959             if (ch == ".") {
09960                 if (!has_dot && !has_x && !has_e)
09961                     return has_dot = true;
09962                 return false;
09963             }
09964             return is_alphanumeric_char(ch);
09965         });
09966         if (prefix)
09967             num = prefix + num;
09968         var valid = parse_js_number(num);
09969         if (!isNaN(valid)) {
09970             return token("num", valid);
09971         } else {
09972             parse_error("Invalid syntax: " + num);
09973         }
09974     };
09975 
09976     function read_escaped_char(in_string) {
09977         var ch = next(true, in_string);
09978         switch (ch) {
09979           case "n" : return "\n";
09980           case "r" : return "\r";
09981           case "t" : return "\t";
09982           case "b" : return "\b";
09983           case "v" : return "\u000b";
09984           case "f" : return "\f";
09985           case "0" : return "\0";
09986           case "x" : return String.fromCharCode(hex_bytes(2));
09987           case "u" : return String.fromCharCode(hex_bytes(4));
09988           case "\n": return "";
09989           default  : return ch;
09990         }
09991     };
09992 
09993     function hex_bytes(n) {
09994         var num = 0;
09995         for (; n > 0; --n) {
09996             var digit = parseInt(next(true), 16);
09997             if (isNaN(digit))
09998                 parse_error("Invalid hex-character pattern in string");
09999             num = (num << 4) | digit;
10000         }
10001         return num;
10002     };
10003 
10004     function read_string() {
10005         return with_eof_error("Unterminated string constant", function(){
10006             var quote = next(), ret = "";
10007             for (;;) {
10008                 var ch = next(true);
10009                 if (ch == "\\") {
10010                     // read OctalEscapeSequence (XXX: deprecated if "strict mode")
10011                     // https://github.com/mishoo/UglifyJS/issues/178
10012                     var octal_len = 0, first = null;
10013                     ch = read_while(function(ch){
10014                         if (ch >= "0" && ch <= "7") {
10015                             if (!first) {
10016                                 first = ch;
10017                                 return ++octal_len;
10018                             }
10019                             else if (first <= "3" && octal_len <= 2) return ++octal_len;
10020                             else if (first >= "4" && octal_len <= 1) return ++octal_len;
10021                         }
10022                         return false;
10023                     });
10024                     if (octal_len > 0) ch = String.fromCharCode(parseInt(ch, 8));
10025                     else ch = read_escaped_char(true);
10026                 }
10027                 else if (ch == quote) break;
10028                 else if (ch == "\n") throw EX_EOF;
10029                 ret += ch;
10030             }
10031             return token("string", ret);
10032         });
10033     };
10034 
10035     function read_line_comment() {
10036         next();
10037         var i = find("\n"), ret;
10038         if (i == -1) {
10039             ret = S.text.substr(S.pos);
10040             S.pos = S.text.length;
10041         } else {
10042             ret = S.text.substring(S.pos, i);
10043             S.pos = i;
10044         }
10045         return token("comment1", ret, true);
10046     };
10047 
10048     function read_multiline_comment() {
10049         next();
10050         return with_eof_error("Unterminated multiline comment", function(){
10051             var i = find("*/", true),
10052             text = S.text.substring(S.pos, i);
10053             S.pos = i + 2;
10054             S.line += text.split("\n").length - 1;
10055             S.newline_before = S.newline_before || text.indexOf("\n") >= 0;
10056 
10057             // https://github.com/mishoo/UglifyJS/issues/#issue/100
10058             if (/^@cc_on/i.test(text)) {
10059                 warn("WARNING: at line " + S.line);
10060                 warn("*** Found \"conditional comment\": " + text);
10061                 warn("*** UglifyJS DISCARDS ALL COMMENTS.  This means your code might no longer work properly in Internet Explorer.");
10062             }
10063 
10064             return token("comment2", text, true);
10065         });
10066     };
10067 
10068     function read_name() {
10069         var backslash = false, name = "", ch, escaped = false, hex;
10070         while ((ch = peek()) != null) {
10071             if (!backslash) {
10072                 if (ch == "\\") escaped = backslash = true, next();
10073                 else if (is_identifier_char(ch)) name += next();
10074                 else break;
10075             }
10076             else {
10077                 if (ch != "u") parse_error("Expecting UnicodeEscapeSequence -- uXXXX");
10078                 ch = read_escaped_char();
10079                 if (!is_identifier_char(ch)) parse_error("Unicode char: " + ch.charCodeAt(0) + " is not valid in identifier");
10080                 name += ch;
10081                 backslash = false;
10082             }
10083         }
10084         if (HOP(KEYWORDS, name) && escaped) {
10085             hex = name.charCodeAt(0).toString(16).toUpperCase();
10086             name = "\\u" + "0000".substr(hex.length) + hex + name.slice(1);
10087         }
10088         return name;
10089     };
10090 
10091     function read_regexp(regexp) {
10092         return with_eof_error("Unterminated regular expression", function(){
10093             var prev_backslash = false, ch, in_class = false;
10094             while ((ch = next(true))) if (prev_backslash) {
10095                 regexp += "\\" + ch;
10096                 prev_backslash = false;
10097             } else if (ch == "[") {
10098                 in_class = true;
10099                 regexp += ch;
10100             } else if (ch == "]" && in_class) {
10101                 in_class = false;
10102                 regexp += ch;
10103             } else if (ch == "/" && !in_class) {
10104                 break;
10105             } else if (ch == "\\") {
10106                 prev_backslash = true;
10107             } else {
10108                 regexp += ch;
10109             }
10110             var mods = read_name();
10111             return token("regexp", [ regexp, mods ]);
10112         });
10113     };
10114 
10115     function read_operator(prefix) {
10116         function grow(op) {
10117             if (!peek()) return op;
10118             var bigger = op + peek();
10119             if (HOP(OPERATORS, bigger)) {
10120                 next();
10121                 return grow(bigger);
10122             } else {
10123                 return op;
10124             }
10125         };
10126         return token("operator", grow(prefix || next()));
10127     };
10128 
10129     function handle_slash() {
10130         next();
10131         var regex_allowed = S.regex_allowed;
10132         switch (peek()) {
10133           case "/":
10134             S.comments_before.push(read_line_comment());
10135             S.regex_allowed = regex_allowed;
10136             return next_token();
10137           case "*":
10138             S.comments_before.push(read_multiline_comment());
10139             S.regex_allowed = regex_allowed;
10140             return next_token();
10141         }
10142         return S.regex_allowed ? read_regexp("") : read_operator("/");
10143     };
10144 
10145     function handle_dot() {
10146         next();
10147         return is_digit(peek())
10148             ? read_num(".")
10149             : token("punc", ".");
10150     };
10151 
10152     function read_word() {
10153         var word = read_name();
10154         return !HOP(KEYWORDS, word)
10155             ? token("name", word)
10156             : HOP(OPERATORS, word)
10157             ? token("operator", word)
10158             : HOP(KEYWORDS_ATOM, word)
10159             ? token("atom", word)
10160             : token("keyword", word);
10161     };
10162 
10163     function with_eof_error(eof_error, cont) {
10164         try {
10165             return cont();
10166         } catch(ex) {
10167             if (ex === EX_EOF) parse_error(eof_error);
10168             else throw ex;
10169         }
10170     };
10171 
10172     function next_token(force_regexp) {
10173         if (force_regexp != null)
10174             return read_regexp(force_regexp);
10175         skip_whitespace();
10176         start_token();
10177         var ch = peek();
10178         if (!ch) return token("eof");
10179         if (is_digit(ch)) return read_num();
10180         if (ch == '"' || ch == "'") return read_string();
10181         if (HOP(PUNC_CHARS, ch)) return token("punc", next());
10182         if (ch == ".") return handle_dot();
10183         if (ch == "/") return handle_slash();
10184         if (HOP(OPERATOR_CHARS, ch)) return read_operator();
10185         if (ch == "\\" || is_identifier_start(ch)) return read_word();
10186         parse_error("Unexpected character '" + ch + "'");
10187     };
10188 
10189     next_token.context = function(nc) {
10190         if (nc) S = nc;
10191         return S;
10192     };
10193 
10194     return next_token;
10195 
10196 };
10197 
10198 /* -----[ Parser (constants) ]----- */
10199 
10200 var UNARY_PREFIX = array_to_hash([
10201     "typeof",
10202     "void",
10203     "delete",
10204     "--",
10205     "++",
10206     "!",
10207     "~",
10208     "-",
10209     "+"
10210 ]);
10211 
10212 var UNARY_POSTFIX = array_to_hash([ "--", "++" ]);
10213 
10214 var ASSIGNMENT = (function(a, ret, i){
10215     while (i < a.length) {
10216         ret[a[i]] = a[i].substr(0, a[i].length - 1);
10217         i++;
10218     }
10219     return ret;
10220 })(
10221     ["+=", "-=", "/=", "*=", "%=", ">>=", "<<=", ">>>=", "|=", "^=", "&="],
10222     { "=": true },
10223     0
10224 );
10225 
10226 var PRECEDENCE = (function(a, ret){
10227     for (var i = 0, n = 1; i < a.length; ++i, ++n) {
10228         var b = a[i];
10229         for (var j = 0; j < b.length; ++j) {
10230             ret[b[j]] = n;
10231         }
10232     }
10233     return ret;
10234 })(
10235     [
10236         ["||"],
10237         ["&&"],
10238         ["|"],
10239         ["^"],
10240         ["&"],
10241         ["==", "===", "!=", "!=="],
10242         ["<", ">", "<=", ">=", "in", "instanceof"],
10243         [">>", "<<", ">>>"],
10244         ["+", "-"],
10245         ["*", "/", "%"]
10246     ],
10247     {}
10248 );
10249 
10250 var STATEMENTS_WITH_LABELS = array_to_hash([ "for", "do", "while", "switch" ]);
10251 
10252 var ATOMIC_START_TOKEN = array_to_hash([ "atom", "num", "string", "regexp", "name" ]);
10253 
10254 /* -----[ Parser ]----- */
10255 
10256 function NodeWithToken(str, start, end) {
10257     this.name = str;
10258     this.start = start;
10259     this.end = end;
10260 };
10261 
10262 NodeWithToken.prototype.toString = function() { return this.name; };
10263 
10264 function parse($TEXT, exigent_mode, embed_tokens) {
10265 
10266     var S = {
10267         input         : typeof $TEXT == "string" ? tokenizer($TEXT, true) : $TEXT,
10268         token         : null,
10269         prev          : null,
10270         peeked        : null,
10271         in_function   : 0,
10272         in_directives : true,
10273         in_loop       : 0,
10274         labels        : []
10275     };
10276 
10277     S.token = next();
10278 
10279     function is(type, value) {
10280         return is_token(S.token, type, value);
10281     };
10282 
10283     function peek() { return S.peeked || (S.peeked = S.input()); };
10284 
10285     function next() {
10286         S.prev = S.token;
10287         if (S.peeked) {
10288             S.token = S.peeked;
10289             S.peeked = null;
10290         } else {
10291             S.token = S.input();
10292         }
10293         S.in_directives = S.in_directives && (
10294             S.token.type == "string" || is("punc", ";")
10295         );
10296         return S.token;
10297     };
10298 
10299     function prev() {
10300         return S.prev;
10301     };
10302 
10303     function croak(msg, line, col, pos) {
10304         var ctx = S.input.context();
10305         js_error(msg,
10306                  line != null ? line : ctx.tokline,
10307                  col != null ? col : ctx.tokcol,
10308                  pos != null ? pos : ctx.tokpos);
10309     };
10310 
10311     function token_error(token, msg) {
10312         croak(msg, token.line, token.col);
10313     };
10314 
10315     function unexpected(token) {
10316         if (token == null)
10317             token = S.token;
10318         token_error(token, "Unexpected token: " + token.type + " (" + token.value + ")");
10319     };
10320 
10321     function expect_token(type, val) {
10322         if (is(type, val)) {
10323             return next();
10324         }
10325         token_error(S.token, "Unexpected token " + S.token.type + ", expected " + type);
10326     };
10327 
10328     function expect(punc) { return expect_token("punc", punc); };
10329 
10330     function can_insert_semicolon() {
10331         return !exigent_mode && (
10332             S.token.nlb || is("eof") || is("punc", "}")
10333         );
10334     };
10335 
10336     function semicolon() {
10337         if (is("punc", ";")) next();
10338         else if (!can_insert_semicolon()) unexpected();
10339     };
10340 
10341     function as() {
10342         return slice(arguments);
10343     };
10344 
10345     function parenthesised() {
10346         expect("(");
10347         var ex = expression();
10348         expect(")");
10349         return ex;
10350     };
10351 
10352     function add_tokens(str, start, end) {
10353         return str instanceof NodeWithToken ? str : new NodeWithToken(str, start, end);
10354     };
10355 
10356     function maybe_embed_tokens(parser) {
10357         if (embed_tokens) return function() {
10358             var start = S.token;
10359             var ast = parser.apply(this, arguments);
10360             ast[0] = add_tokens(ast[0], start, prev());
10361             return ast;
10362         };
10363         else return parser;
10364     };
10365 
10366     var statement = maybe_embed_tokens(function() {
10367         if (is("operator", "/") || is("operator", "/=")) {
10368             S.peeked = null;
10369             S.token = S.input(S.token.value.substr(1)); // force regexp
10370         }
10371         switch (S.token.type) {
10372           case "string":
10373             var dir = S.in_directives, stat = simple_statement();
10374             if (dir && stat[1][0] == "string" && !is("punc", ","))
10375                 return as("directive", stat[1][1]);
10376             return stat;
10377           case "num":
10378           case "regexp":
10379           case "operator":
10380           case "atom":
10381             return simple_statement();
10382 
10383           case "name":
10384             return is_token(peek(), "punc", ":")
10385                 ? labeled_statement(prog1(S.token.value, next, next))
10386                 : simple_statement();
10387 
10388           case "punc":
10389             switch (S.token.value) {
10390               case "{":
10391                 return as("block", block_());
10392               case "[":
10393               case "(":
10394                 return simple_statement();
10395               case ";":
10396                 next();
10397                 return as("block");
10398               default:
10399                 unexpected();
10400             }
10401 
10402           case "keyword":
10403             switch (prog1(S.token.value, next)) {
10404               case "break":
10405                 return break_cont("break");
10406 
10407               case "continue":
10408                 return break_cont("continue");
10409 
10410               case "debugger":
10411                 semicolon();
10412                 return as("debugger");
10413 
10414               case "do":
10415                 return (function(body){
10416                     expect_token("keyword", "while");
10417                     return as("do", prog1(parenthesised, semicolon), body);
10418                 })(in_loop(statement));
10419 
10420               case "for":
10421                 return for_();
10422 
10423               case "function":
10424                 return function_(true);
10425 
10426               case "if":
10427                 return if_();
10428 
10429               case "return":
10430                 if (S.in_function == 0)
10431                     croak("'return' outside of function");
10432                 return as("return",
10433                           is("punc", ";")
10434                           ? (next(), null)
10435                           : can_insert_semicolon()
10436                           ? null
10437                           : prog1(expression, semicolon));
10438 
10439               case "switch":
10440                 return as("switch", parenthesised(), switch_block_());
10441 
10442               case "throw":
10443                 if (S.token.nlb)
10444                     croak("Illegal newline after 'throw'");
10445                 return as("throw", prog1(expression, semicolon));
10446 
10447               case "try":
10448                 return try_();
10449 
10450               case "var":
10451                 return prog1(var_, semicolon);
10452 
10453               case "const":
10454                 return prog1(const_, semicolon);
10455 
10456               case "while":
10457                 return as("while", parenthesised(), in_loop(statement));
10458 
10459               case "with":
10460                 return as("with", parenthesised(), statement());
10461 
10462               default:
10463                 unexpected();
10464             }
10465         }
10466     });
10467 
10468     function labeled_statement(label) {
10469         S.labels.push(label);
10470         var start = S.token, stat = statement();
10471         if (exigent_mode && !HOP(STATEMENTS_WITH_LABELS, stat[0]))
10472             unexpected(start);
10473         S.labels.pop();
10474         return as("label", label, stat);
10475     };
10476 
10477     function simple_statement() {
10478         return as("stat", prog1(expression, semicolon));
10479     };
10480 
10481     function break_cont(type) {
10482         var name;
10483         if (!can_insert_semicolon()) {
10484             name = is("name") ? S.token.value : null;
10485         }
10486         if (name != null) {
10487             next();
10488             if (!member(name, S.labels))
10489                 croak("Label " + name + " without matching loop or statement");
10490         }
10491         else if (S.in_loop == 0)
10492             croak(type + " not inside a loop or switch");
10493         semicolon();
10494         return as(type, name);
10495     };
10496 
10497     function for_() {
10498         expect("(");
10499         var init = null;
10500         if (!is("punc", ";")) {
10501             init = is("keyword", "var")
10502                 ? (next(), var_(true))
10503                 : expression(true, true);
10504             if (is("operator", "in")) {
10505                 if (init[0] == "var" && init[1].length > 1)
10506                     croak("Only one variable declaration allowed in for..in loop");
10507                 return for_in(init);
10508             }
10509         }
10510         return regular_for(init);
10511     };
10512 
10513     function regular_for(init) {
10514         expect(";");
10515         var test = is("punc", ";") ? null : expression();
10516         expect(";");
10517         var step = is("punc", ")") ? null : expression();
10518         expect(")");
10519         return as("for", init, test, step, in_loop(statement));
10520     };
10521 
10522     function for_in(init) {
10523         var lhs = init[0] == "var" ? as("name", init[1][0]) : init;
10524         next();
10525         var obj = expression();
10526         expect(")");
10527         return as("for-in", init, lhs, obj, in_loop(statement));
10528     };
10529 
10530     var function_ = function(in_statement) {
10531         var name = is("name") ? prog1(S.token.value, next) : null;
10532         if (in_statement && !name)
10533             unexpected();
10534         expect("(");
10535         return as(in_statement ? "defun" : "function",
10536                   name,
10537                   // arguments
10538                   (function(first, a){
10539                       while (!is("punc", ")")) {
10540                           if (first) first = false; else expect(",");
10541                           if (!is("name")) unexpected();
10542                           a.push(S.token.value);
10543                           next();
10544                       }
10545                       next();
10546                       return a;
10547                   })(true, []),
10548                   // body
10549                   (function(){
10550                       ++S.in_function;
10551                       var loop = S.in_loop;
10552                       S.in_directives = true;
10553                       S.in_loop = 0;
10554                       var a = block_();
10555                       --S.in_function;
10556                       S.in_loop = loop;
10557                       return a;
10558                   })());
10559     };
10560 
10561     function if_() {
10562         var cond = parenthesised(), body = statement(), belse;
10563         if (is("keyword", "else")) {
10564             next();
10565             belse = statement();
10566         }
10567         return as("if", cond, body, belse);
10568     };
10569 
10570     function block_() {
10571         expect("{");
10572         var a = [];
10573         while (!is("punc", "}")) {
10574             if (is("eof")) unexpected();
10575             a.push(statement());
10576         }
10577         next();
10578         return a;
10579     };
10580 
10581     var switch_block_ = curry(in_loop, function(){
10582         expect("{");
10583         var a = [], cur = null;
10584         while (!is("punc", "}")) {
10585             if (is("eof")) unexpected();
10586             if (is("keyword", "case")) {
10587                 next();
10588                 cur = [];
10589                 a.push([ expression(), cur ]);
10590                 expect(":");
10591             }
10592             else if (is("keyword", "default")) {
10593                 next();
10594                 expect(":");
10595                 cur = [];
10596                 a.push([ null, cur ]);
10597             }
10598             else {
10599                 if (!cur) unexpected();
10600                 cur.push(statement());
10601             }
10602         }
10603         next();
10604         return a;
10605     });
10606 
10607     function try_() {
10608         var body = block_(), bcatch, bfinally;
10609         if (is("keyword", "catch")) {
10610             next();
10611             expect("(");
10612             if (!is("name"))
10613                 croak("Name expected");
10614             var name = S.token.value;
10615             next();
10616             expect(")");
10617             bcatch = [ name, block_() ];
10618         }
10619         if (is("keyword", "finally")) {
10620             next();
10621             bfinally = block_();
10622         }
10623         if (!bcatch && !bfinally)
10624             croak("Missing catch/finally blocks");
10625         return as("try", body, bcatch, bfinally);
10626     };
10627 
10628     function vardefs(no_in) {
10629         var a = [];
10630         for (;;) {
10631             if (!is("name"))
10632                 unexpected();
10633             var name = S.token.value;
10634             next();
10635             if (is("operator", "=")) {
10636                 next();
10637                 a.push([ name, expression(false, no_in) ]);
10638             } else {
10639                 a.push([ name ]);
10640             }
10641             if (!is("punc", ","))
10642                 break;
10643             next();
10644         }
10645         return a;
10646     };
10647 
10648     function var_(no_in) {
10649         return as("var", vardefs(no_in));
10650     };
10651 
10652     function const_() {
10653         return as("const", vardefs());
10654     };
10655 
10656     function new_() {
10657         var newexp = expr_atom(false), args;
10658         if (is("punc", "(")) {
10659             next();
10660             args = expr_list(")");
10661         } else {
10662             args = [];
10663         }
10664         return subscripts(as("new", newexp, args), true);
10665     };
10666 
10667     var expr_atom = maybe_embed_tokens(function(allow_calls) {
10668         if (is("operator", "new")) {
10669             next();
10670             return new_();
10671         }
10672         if (is("punc")) {
10673             switch (S.token.value) {
10674               case "(":
10675                 next();
10676                 return subscripts(prog1(expression, curry(expect, ")")), allow_calls);
10677               case "[":
10678                 next();
10679                 return subscripts(array_(), allow_calls);
10680               case "{":
10681                 next();
10682                 return subscripts(object_(), allow_calls);
10683             }
10684             unexpected();
10685         }
10686         if (is("keyword", "function")) {
10687             next();
10688             return subscripts(function_(false), allow_calls);
10689         }
10690         if (HOP(ATOMIC_START_TOKEN, S.token.type)) {
10691             var atom = S.token.type == "regexp"
10692                 ? as("regexp", S.token.value[0], S.token.value[1])
10693                 : as(S.token.type, S.token.value);
10694             return subscripts(prog1(atom, next), allow_calls);
10695         }
10696         unexpected();
10697     });
10698 
10699     function expr_list(closing, allow_trailing_comma, allow_empty) {
10700         var first = true, a = [];
10701         while (!is("punc", closing)) {
10702             if (first) first = false; else expect(",");
10703             if (allow_trailing_comma && is("punc", closing)) break;
10704             if (is("punc", ",") && allow_empty) {
10705                 a.push([ "atom", "undefined" ]);
10706             } else {
10707                 a.push(expression(false));
10708             }
10709         }
10710         next();
10711         return a;
10712     };
10713 
10714     function array_() {
10715         return as("array", expr_list("]", !exigent_mode, true));
10716     };
10717 
10718     function object_() {
10719         var first = true, a = [];
10720         while (!is("punc", "}")) {
10721             if (first) first = false; else expect(",");
10722             if (!exigent_mode && is("punc", "}"))
10723                 // allow trailing comma
10724                 break;
10725             var type = S.token.type;
10726             var name = as_property_name();
10727             if (type == "name" && (name == "get" || name == "set") && !is("punc", ":")) {
10728                 a.push([ as_name(), function_(false), name ]);
10729             } else {
10730                 expect(":");
10731                 a.push([ name, expression(false) ]);
10732             }
10733         }
10734         next();
10735         return as("object", a);
10736     };
10737 
10738     function as_property_name() {
10739         switch (S.token.type) {
10740           case "num":
10741           case "string":
10742             return prog1(S.token.value, next);
10743         }
10744         return as_name();
10745     };
10746 
10747     function as_name() {
10748         switch (S.token.type) {
10749           case "name":
10750           case "operator":
10751           case "keyword":
10752           case "atom":
10753             return prog1(S.token.value, next);
10754           default:
10755             unexpected();
10756         }
10757     };
10758 
10759     function subscripts(expr, allow_calls) {
10760         if (is("punc", ".")) {
10761             next();
10762             return subscripts(as("dot", expr, as_name()), allow_calls);
10763         }
10764         if (is("punc", "[")) {
10765             next();
10766             return subscripts(as("sub", expr, prog1(expression, curry(expect, "]"))), allow_calls);
10767         }
10768         if (allow_calls && is("punc", "(")) {
10769             next();
10770             return subscripts(as("call", expr, expr_list(")")), true);
10771         }
10772         return expr;
10773     };
10774 
10775     function maybe_unary(allow_calls) {
10776         if (is("operator") && HOP(UNARY_PREFIX, S.token.value)) {
10777             return make_unary("unary-prefix",
10778                               prog1(S.token.value, next),
10779                               maybe_unary(allow_calls));
10780         }
10781         var val = expr_atom(allow_calls);
10782         while (is("operator") && HOP(UNARY_POSTFIX, S.token.value) && !S.token.nlb) {
10783             val = make_unary("unary-postfix", S.token.value, val);
10784             next();
10785         }
10786         return val;
10787     };
10788 
10789     function make_unary(tag, op, expr) {
10790         if ((op == "++" || op == "--") && !is_assignable(expr))
10791             croak("Invalid use of " + op + " operator");
10792         return as(tag, op, expr);
10793     };
10794 
10795     function expr_op(left, min_prec, no_in) {
10796         var op = is("operator") ? S.token.value : null;
10797         if (op && op == "in" && no_in) op = null;
10798         var prec = op != null ? PRECEDENCE[op] : null;
10799         if (prec != null && prec > min_prec) {
10800             next();
10801             var right = expr_op(maybe_unary(true), prec, no_in);
10802             return expr_op(as("binary", op, left, right), min_prec, no_in);
10803         }
10804         return left;
10805     };
10806 
10807     function expr_ops(no_in) {
10808         return expr_op(maybe_unary(true), 0, no_in);
10809     };
10810 
10811     function maybe_conditional(no_in) {
10812         var expr = expr_ops(no_in);
10813         if (is("operator", "?")) {
10814             next();
10815             var yes = expression(false);
10816             expect(":");
10817             return as("conditional", expr, yes, expression(false, no_in));
10818         }
10819         return expr;
10820     };
10821 
10822     function is_assignable(expr) {
10823         if (!exigent_mode) return true;
10824         switch (expr[0]+"") {
10825           case "dot":
10826           case "sub":
10827           case "new":
10828           case "call":
10829             return true;
10830           case "name":
10831             return expr[1] != "this";
10832         }
10833     };
10834 
10835     function maybe_assign(no_in) {
10836         var left = maybe_conditional(no_in), val = S.token.value;
10837         if (is("operator") && HOP(ASSIGNMENT, val)) {
10838             if (is_assignable(left)) {
10839                 next();
10840                 return as("assign", ASSIGNMENT[val], left, maybe_assign(no_in));
10841             }
10842             croak("Invalid assignment");
10843         }
10844         return left;
10845     };
10846 
10847     var expression = maybe_embed_tokens(function(commas, no_in) {
10848         if (arguments.length == 0)
10849             commas = true;
10850         var expr = maybe_assign(no_in);
10851         if (commas && is("punc", ",")) {
10852             next();
10853             return as("seq", expr, expression(true, no_in));
10854         }
10855         return expr;
10856     });
10857 
10858     function in_loop(cont) {
10859         try {
10860             ++S.in_loop;
10861             return cont();
10862         } finally {
10863             --S.in_loop;
10864         }
10865     };
10866 
10867     return as("toplevel", (function(a){
10868         while (!is("eof"))
10869             a.push(statement());
10870         return a;
10871     })([]));
10872 
10873 };
10874 
10875 /* -----[ Utilities ]----- */
10876 
10877 function curry(f) {
10878     var args = slice(arguments, 1);
10879     return function() { return f.apply(this, args.concat(slice(arguments))); };
10880 };
10881 
10882 function prog1(ret) {
10883     if (ret instanceof Function)
10884         ret = ret();
10885     for (var i = 1, n = arguments.length; --n > 0; ++i)
10886         arguments[i]();
10887     return ret;
10888 };
10889 
10890 function array_to_hash(a) {
10891     var ret = {};
10892     for (var i = 0; i < a.length; ++i)
10893         ret[a[i]] = true;
10894     return ret;
10895 };
10896 
10897 function slice(a, start) {
10898     return Array.prototype.slice.call(a, start || 0);
10899 };
10900 
10901 function characters(str) {
10902     return str.split("");
10903 };
10904 
10905 function member(name, array) {
10906     for (var i = array.length; --i >= 0;)
10907         if (array[i] == name)
10908             return true;
10909     return false;
10910 };
10911 
10912 function HOP(obj, prop) {
10913     return Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty.call(obj, prop);
10914 };
10915 
10916 var warn = function() {};
10917 
10918 /* -----[ Exports ]----- */
10919 
10920 exports.tokenizer = tokenizer;
10921 exports.parse = parse;
10922 exports.slice = slice;
10923 exports.curry = curry;
10924 exports.member = member;
10925 exports.array_to_hash = array_to_hash;
10926 exports.PRECEDENCE = PRECEDENCE;
10927 exports.KEYWORDS_ATOM = KEYWORDS_ATOM;
10928 exports.RESERVED_WORDS = RESERVED_WORDS;
10929 exports.KEYWORDS = KEYWORDS;
10930 exports.ATOMIC_START_TOKEN = ATOMIC_START_TOKEN;
10931 exports.OPERATORS = OPERATORS;
10932 exports.is_alphanumeric_char = is_alphanumeric_char;
10933 exports.is_identifier_start = is_identifier_start;
10934 exports.is_identifier_char = is_identifier_char;
10935 exports.set_logger = function(logger) {
10936     warn = logger;
10937 };
10938 
10939 // Local variables:
10940 // js-indent-level: 4
10941 // End:
10942 });define('uglifyjs/squeeze-more', ["require", "exports", "module", "./parse-js", "./squeeze-more"], function(require, exports, module) {
10943 var jsp = require("./parse-js"),
10944     pro = require("./process"),
10945     slice = jsp.slice,
10946     member = jsp.member,
10947     curry = jsp.curry,
10948     MAP = pro.MAP,
10949     PRECEDENCE = jsp.PRECEDENCE,
10950     OPERATORS = jsp.OPERATORS;
10951 
10952 function ast_squeeze_more(ast) {
10953     var w = pro.ast_walker(), walk = w.walk, scope;
10954     function with_scope(s, cont) {
10955         var save = scope, ret;
10956         scope = s;
10957         ret = cont();
10958         scope = save;
10959         return ret;
10960     };
10961     function _lambda(name, args, body) {
10962         return [ this[0], name, args, with_scope(body.scope, curry(MAP, body, walk)) ];
10963     };
10964     return w.with_walkers({
10965         "toplevel": function(body) {
10966             return [ this[0], with_scope(this.scope, curry(MAP, body, walk)) ];
10967         },
10968         "function": _lambda,
10969         "defun": _lambda,
10970         "new": function(ctor, args) {
10971             if (ctor[0] == "name") {
10972                 if (ctor[1] == "Array" && !scope.has("Array")) {
10973                     if (args.length != 1) {
10974                         return [ "array", args ];
10975                     } else {
10976                         return walk([ "call", [ "name", "Array" ], args ]);
10977                     }
10978                 } else if (ctor[1] == "Object" && !scope.has("Object")) {
10979                     if (!args.length) {
10980                         return [ "object", [] ];
10981                     } else {
10982                         return walk([ "call", [ "name", "Object" ], args ]);
10983                     }
10984                 } else if ((ctor[1] == "RegExp" || ctor[1] == "Function" || ctor[1] == "Error") && !scope.has(ctor[1])) {
10985                     return walk([ "call", [ "name", ctor[1] ], args]);
10986                 }
10987             }
10988         },
10989         "call": function(expr, args) {
10990             if (expr[0] == "dot" && expr[1][0] == "string" && args.length == 1
10991                 && (args[0][1] > 0 && expr[2] == "substring" || expr[2] == "substr")) {
10992                 return [ "call", [ "dot", expr[1], "slice"], args];
10993             }
10994             if (expr[0] == "dot" && expr[2] == "toString" && args.length == 0) {
10995                 // foo.toString()  ==>  foo+""
10996                 if (expr[1][0] == "string") return expr[1];
10997                 return [ "binary", "+", expr[1], [ "string", "" ]];
10998             }
10999             if (expr[0] == "name") {
11000                 if (expr[1] == "Array" && args.length != 1 && !scope.has("Array")) {
11001                     return [ "array", args ];
11002                 }
11003                 if (expr[1] == "Object" && !args.length && !scope.has("Object")) {
11004                     return [ "object", [] ];
11005                 }
11006                 if (expr[1] == "String" && !scope.has("String")) {
11007                     return [ "binary", "+", args[0], [ "string", "" ]];
11008                 }
11009             }
11010         }
11011     }, function() {
11012         return walk(pro.ast_add_scope(ast));
11013     });
11014 };
11015 
11016 exports.ast_squeeze_more = ast_squeeze_more;
11017 
11018 // Local variables:
11019 // js-indent-level: 4
11020 // End:
11021 });
11022 define('uglifyjs/process', ["require", "exports", "module", "./parse-js", "./squeeze-more"], function(require, exports, module) {
11023 /***********************************************************************
11024 
11025   A JavaScript tokenizer / parser / beautifier / compressor.
11026 
11027   This version is suitable for Node.js.  With minimal changes (the
11028   exports stuff) it should work on any JS platform.
11029 
11030   This file implements some AST processors.  They work on data built
11031   by parse-js.
11032 
11033   Exported functions:
11034 
11035     - ast_mangle(ast, options) -- mangles the variable/function names
11036       in the AST.  Returns an AST.
11037 
11038     - ast_squeeze(ast) -- employs various optimizations to make the
11039       final generated code even smaller.  Returns an AST.
11040 
11041     - gen_code(ast, options) -- generates JS code from the AST.  Pass
11042       true (or an object, see the code for some options) as second
11043       argument to get "pretty" (indented) code.
11044 
11045   -------------------------------- (C) ---------------------------------
11046 
11047                            Author: Mihai Bazon
11048                          <mihai.bazon@gmail.com>
11049                        http://mihai.bazon.net/blog
11050 
11051   Distributed under the BSD license:
11052 
11053     Copyright 2010 (c) Mihai Bazon <mihai.bazon@gmail.com>
11054 
11055     Redistribution and use in source and binary forms, with or without
11056     modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions
11057     are met:
11058 
11059         * Redistributions of source code must retain the above
11060           copyright notice, this list of conditions and the following
11061           disclaimer.
11062 
11063         * Redistributions in binary form must reproduce the above
11064           copyright notice, this list of conditions and the following
11065           disclaimer in the documentation and/or other materials
11066           provided with the distribution.
11067 
11068     THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED BY THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER “AS IS” AND ANY
11069     EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE
11070     IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR
11071     PURPOSE ARE DISCLAIMED. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE COPYRIGHT HOLDER BE
11072     LIABLE FOR ANY DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY,
11073     OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO,
11074     PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOSS OF USE, DATA, OR
11075     PROFITS; OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) HOWEVER CAUSED AND ON ANY
11076     THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, STRICT LIABILITY, OR
11077     TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR OTHERWISE) ARISING IN ANY WAY OUT OF
11078     THE USE OF THIS SOFTWARE, EVEN IF ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF
11079     SUCH DAMAGE.
11080 
11081  ***********************************************************************/
11082 
11083 var jsp = require("./parse-js"),
11084     curry = jsp.curry,
11085     slice = jsp.slice,
11086     member = jsp.member,
11087     is_identifier_char = jsp.is_identifier_char,
11088     PRECEDENCE = jsp.PRECEDENCE,
